This compression prevents the grinding wheel from rotating relative to the hub assembly and disengaging from the spindle. The invention eliminates the need for adhesives and provides a secure, lightweight, and vibration-free attachment of the abrasive finishing article to the power tool. The design can accommodate various sizes of standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels and meets all safety standards.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is based on a generic hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system, which includes a housing block, a motor, and a covering hood. The hydraulic unit has at least one pump with a piston that is indirectly drivable by an electric motor via an eccentric. Pressure fluid entrained into the eccentric chamber by the piston is delivered to a spring chamber, far from electrical components, and collected in that chamber. The invention yields cost savings and the advantage of a hermetic seal of the unit from the environment. A pressure equalization conduit exists between the spring chamber and the interior of the motor, allowing air to escape from the spring chamber into the interior of the motor. A pressure equilibrium is created between the interior of the motor and the housing, which is sealed off relative to the housing block, by a pressure equalization conduit formed by interstices between wires of a cable and a tubular cable sheath. The cable sheath acts as a pressure equalization conduit between the ambient atmosphere and the interior of the housing and indirectly through the cable sheath for the motor as well. The provisions described prevent the invasion of water to the hydraulic unit yet provide a pressure equalization of interiors of the hydraulic unit with the ambient atmosphere. The diversion of pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons into a region of the unit that is located far from vulnerable electrical parts prevents electrolytically active ingredients from attacking electrical components.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to power and free conveyor systems, specifically to the transfer of carriers from one predetermined path to another. A third dog is provided in longitudinally spaced relation to the first and second dogs, normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but held by the track out of operative position. The second and third dogs include cam projections that engage portions of the track, allowing selective transfer of the carrier across short or long distances. The system can be operated by moving the dogs upwardly simultaneously or sequentially, minimizing the number of pushers on the conveyor chain and reducing costs. The invention provides a power and free conveyor system with minimum cost and maintenance, allowing for selective transfer of carriers over short and long distances.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners made of an all-polymeric type, specifically a ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material mixed with a conductive material such as 2% carbon black. This liner provides effective grounding without the need for additional grounding apparatus, eliminating the need for periodic lubrication and reducing wear and damage to the center plate assembly. The liner's conductive properties allow it to discharge any electrical charge built up in the car body through the car trucks and into the track rails, meeting the American Association of Railroads' standards for static electricity conductivity. The invention improves upon previous liners by providing a self-lubricating and conductive material that can withstand the loads imposed by railroad cars and maintain its properties over time.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a gate valve used for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances such as sauces, salad dressings, and catsup. The valve is designed to be operated with one hand, allowing the other hand to hold a receiving vessel. The prior art provides two main types of valves, the rotatable cylindrical tube type and the ball-type, both of which have limitations such as residue accumulation and inability to be disassembled for cleaning. The present invention provides a gate valve that can be disassembled for cleaning and has a curved guide and gate that provide an effective seal when closed. The valve is mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch and has a dispensing passage with a discharge outlet. The gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member by means of an integral operating channel-like extension. The valve can be moved between opened and closed positions with the fingers of one hand, and the movement can be gradual or quick. The passage is completely unobstructed when the valve is opened, and complete cut-off occurs when the valve reaches closed position. The valve can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position, such as when mounted in a dispenser. The valve can be readily disassembled for cleaning and easily reassembled.

</summary>

<summary> The present invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that can be used with various types of vehicles, regardless of the protocol of the reverse-gear indication signal. The system includes a mirror control that determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control by monitoring the output and attempting to conclude the state of the output. The mirror control may be a microcomputer with software that determines the protocol by software processing, and it can maintain parameters such as "reverse-inhibit-running average" and "reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle average" to ensure accurate protocol determination. The system can be implemented in software, reducing hardware expenses, and can be carried out utilizing an 8-bit register, further reducing software resources necessary to implement the invention. </summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, specifically addressing the issue of vertical vibration of the chassis when the front wheel brake is applied. This vibration is particularly problematic for motorcycles with high centers of gravity and short wheelbases. The invention proposes an anti-lock braking system employing an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension. The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel, either by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel. The system aims to provide an anti-lock brake system with anti-dive characteristics, thereby improving braking efficiency. The anti-dive unit controls the contracting action of the telescopic front fork in accordance with the operation of the front wheel brake, suppressing vertical vibration of the chassis and facilitating front wheel braking. This results in minimized variations in the angular deceleration of the front wheel and improved braking efficiency. The system includes a hydraulic pump, modulator, pressure discharge valve, and sensor, which work together to regulate the hydraulic braking pressure applied to the front wheel brakes. The anti-dive unit is designed to restrict the contracting action of the front fork, allowing the grounding load on the front wheel to increase immediately and enabling the frictional force between the front wheel and the road surface to increase quickly. By providing an anti-dive unit on the front wheel-supporting front fork, the invention achieves improved braking performance and stability.

</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to an improved partition system for movable partitions and panels used in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers to separate or insulate cargo during transportation or storage. The system includes at least two panels independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, allowing each panel to be moved independently to define different cargo areas to be maintained at different temperatures. The panels can be slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails and can be raised and lowered with a minimum of fore and aft clearance, providing a flexible and efficient solution for multi-temperature transport.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a novel sanitizable rotary valve used in liquid chromatography and fluid handling systems, particularly for separating and purifying biological macromolecules in the pharmaceutical industry. The valve features a unique diaphragm-like elastomeric seal that allows for partial separation of the rotor-stator faces, enabling sanitizing fluid to flush across the process fluid-contacting surfaces without disassembling the valve. The valve's design ensures sterile operation, prevents contamination, and allows for simple and reliable sealing of all ports, making it suitable for use in pharmaceutical manufacturing processes.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies, specifically an improved tray valve assembly that enhances vapor-liquid flow and increases efficiency. The valve assembly features a circular disc with two legs of different widths, which are mounted in a slotted region of the tray to prevent rotation and ensure proper orientation. The design of the valve assembly facilitates directional thrust and reduces back-trapping of liquid, resulting in improved tray efficiency and increased capacity.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. The assembly reduces variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure and is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain. It consists of a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, a fluid regulator, and a generator, which work together to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical or electrical energy. The vane motor is designed to extract work from the pressurized fluid while reducing its pressure, allowing for the use of a smaller or more inexpensive pressure regulator. The assembly can be used in various applications, including gas grills, scuba diving equipment, and vehicles driven by pressurized flammable fluids. Alternative embodiments of the invention include the use of dual vane motors and the positioning of the vane motor between the first and second stage regulators in a scuba diving system. The invention is not limited to the preferred embodiment and can be modified to accommodate different motors, generators, and regulators.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a pallet system designed to facilitate loading and unloading, and limit the shifting of loaded items, particularly for shipping fragile or loose items such as eggs. The pallet system features a pallet cap with raised, parallel guide rails that allow trays to be slid on and off, and end plates that provide additional stability and protection to the load. The guide rails and end plates work together to restrict both lateral and longitudinal movement of the items loaded onto the pallet, providing enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped. The pallet system is customizable for its intended load and can be made from various materials, such as plastic, and manufactured using different methods, including thermo forming and injection molding.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which aims to make full use of the limited internal space of the saucer shell and design a compact structure with high motive power conversion efficiency. The flying saucer comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system, with the rotary-wing system being a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in space and go around the magnetic suspension shaft under an electromagnetic thrust. The magnetic suspension inner ring and the magnetic suspension shaft form a repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension radial bearing, while the magnetic suspension inner ring and the magnetic suspension inner ring guide rail form a repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension axial bearing. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, and magnetic suspension shaft constitute a magnetic suspension electric engine. Two sets of independent magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems can be superposed and mounted coaxially inside the saucer shell to overcome reactive torque. The radial magnetic suspension structure of the rotary-wing wheels can be designed using permanent magnets, electromagnets, or superconducting materials. The axial magnetic suspension structure of the rotary-wing wheels can also be designed using these materials, providing a natural stable structure or good controllability. The electric engine of the flying saucer can be designed according to general motor principles, with a typical embodiment being a permanent magnet synchronous engine. The coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems can be used to improve the rotary-wing system and overcome reactive torque.

</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins, which are modified forms of streptavidin, a protein that binds to biotin with high affinity. The muteins have been engineered to have a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands, making them useful for the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins. The streptavidin muteins are characterized by at least one mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, which results in a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands. The invention also concerns a process for the production of streptavidin muteins, as well as their use in various applications, including affinity chromatography, Western blot, ELISA, and immune microscopy. The streptavidin muteins can be used in a labelled form, and they can be immobilized on solid phases, such as microtitre plates, microbeads, or sensor chips.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts, specifically nickel in the zero oxidation state, which can be derived from various nickel alloys and compounds. These methods involve reacting guanylating agents, such as thioureas or isothioureas, with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of a nickel catalyst, resulting in high yields of substituted guanidines under mild reaction conditions.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires, providing a colored oxide film with excellent weatherability and fade resistance. The process involves anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring, using a specific acid or water-soluble metal salt, without requiring a large amount of electrical energy. The anodic oxidation bath composition typically consists of an aqueous solution of sulfuric acid, and the electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, cobalt salt, copper salt, tin salt, and selenious acid. The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying the aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, and a sealing bath, with the aluminum strip or wire passing successively through each bath. The invention provides a simple and cost-effective method for producing aluminum strips or wires with colored oxide films, making it highly valuable for industrial applications.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome, involving the use of at least two different vectors that recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in plant cells to produce a non-replicating recombination product containing a DNA sequence of interest. The process allows for the efficient and rapid production of transgenic plants with desired traits, and can be used for various applications such as DNA library screening, gene function analysis, and directed evolution.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate facial surfaces and ends to reduce frictional wear. The coated swash plate can be made from lower-cost alloy materials while maintaining durability and efficiency. The coating comprises a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load-bearing additive, which are applied to the swash plate using a liquid spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature. The coating is suitable for use on non-hypereutectic aluminum and aluminum alloys with less than 10% by weight of silicon. Experimental results show that the coated swash plate exhibits improved durability and reduced friction compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates. The coating can be applied to the swash plate without the need for high surface finishing or electroplating, making it a cost-effective solution for swash plate compressors.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, particularly for photolithography processes using 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams. The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at these wavelengths and can be used to form a layer that prevents the reflection of light from lower layers coated on a semiconductor chip. The polymers can be prepared through reaction equations using commercially available raw materials, and the resulting anti-reflective coating composition can be applied to a semiconductor silicon wafer and hard-baked to form a cross-linked structure. The anti-reflective coating composition may also include light-absorbing compounds such as anthracene and fluorenone derivatives. The polymers and compositions of the present invention have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials for submicro-pattern formation in photolithographic processes.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic, with a thickness of 10-350 μm. The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties. The film can be produced cost-effectively and is suitable for outdoor applications that demand fire protection or flame retardancy. The film passes the fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and the UL 94 test, and does not embrittle on exposure to heat. The film has high UV resistance, meaning it does not yellow or exhibit impairment of mechanical properties after exposure to sunlight. The film can be thermoformed without predrying, and can be used to produce complex moldings. The film is suitable for a wide variety of applications, including interior decoration, exhibition stands, and protective glazing. The film can be recycled without difficulty and without pollution of the environment, and is therefore suitable for use as short-lived advertising placards or other promotional items. The film's property profile includes a surface gloss of greater than 15, light transmittance of less than 70%, and a Yellowness Index of less than 5.

</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) using heterogeneous catalysis. The process uses a chromium salt catalyst, which may be unsupported or supported, and can be carried out at temperatures between 30° C. and 400° C. The molar ratio of HF to 142b can vary between greater than 1:1 and 20:1, and the process can be carried out at pressures between 1 atmosphere and 200 psig. The catalyst can be activated using nitrogen, air, or HF/142b, and the process can be carried out in a fixed bed reactor or a plug flow reactor. The reactor effluent can be purified by removing unreacted HF and HCl, and the product can be distilled to produce high-purity 143a. The process can also be carried out adiabatically, and the adiabatic temperature rise can be controlled by adjusting the feed rates and pressure. The process has been shown to produce high-purity 143a with minimal formation of olefinic byproducts. The catalyst can be regenerated by heating in air, and the process can be carried out using a variety of feedstocks, including 142b, 141b, and mixtures thereof. The process is suitable for industrial-scale production of 143a.

</summary>

<summary>
This invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of triazolothiadiazines to produce pyrazolotriazoles, which are useful as magenta couplers in photographic products. The improved process employs hypophosphorous acid to reduce the formation of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, resulting in higher yields and purer products. The process involves reacting an acylated triazolothiadiazine with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the desired pyrazolotriazole. The reaction is typically conducted at a temperature of 70-90°C and ambient pressure. The use of hypophosphorous acid has several advantages, including the formation of H2S instead of sulfur, which is readily removable, and the non-reduction of nitro groups present on side chains. The process is straightforward and economical to carry out, making it readily adaptable by industry. The invention provides a significant advance in the art, overcoming difficulties associated with previous methods. The improved process results in higher yields and purer products, with yields of up to 82% and purity of up to 98% by HPLC.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially removing partial quantities from different fiber lots. The method involves measuring the entire quantity of each fiber lot before removing a partial quantity, which corresponds to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity. This approach eliminates the disadvantages of previous methods, such as residual fibers and non-homogeneous mixtures, and allows for a finely dosed mixture of the same composition to be formed. The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener based on signals from the quantity measuring device.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel courses of yarns, allowing for controlled overlap and density, and improved strength and uniformity. The apparatus uses a rake mechanism synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, to achieve parallelism of the yarns and control the amount of overlap between successive courses.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, where air under pressure is ejected from a main nozzle unit or subnozzles to produce different weft carrying forces suited for the respective weft threads. The invention achieves stable weft insertion and prevents undue consumption of pressurized air by regulating the air pressure or the interval of time in which the air is ejected, depending on the type of weft thread being inserted.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres and a process of making thereof, with a focus on twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres. The process involves health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, drawing the carded bast fibres into strips, health preserving the strips, and spinning the health preserved strips into yarn. The invention aims to provide a bast fibre yarn with low end breakage rate, and experiments have shown that the end breakage rate can be reduced to 150-200 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12s in fineness. The invention can be applied to various types of bast fibres, including jute, kenaf, and hemp, and can be blended with other fibres such as cotton, terylene, and polypropylene. </summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to nip presses used in various industries, including papermaking, and is directed to methods and apparatus for measuring and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses. Rotational variability can cause inaccurate pressure readings and lead to poor product quality. The invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel the effects of rotational variability. The sensors measure the pressure being placed against the web as it passes through the nip region, and the average of the measurements is used to calculate a more accurate nip pressure profile. The invention can be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation to eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll. The system can also calculate and display a rotational variability profile, providing the operator with additional real-time information to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile. The invention can be used with various types of sensors and can be applied to different types of nip presses.

</summary>

<summary>
This invention relates to a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board, designed to support the electrical cord of an electric iron and hold an article such as a spray starch can or beverage container. The apparatus consists of a releasable clamp, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder. The clamp is "C" shaped and has an adjusting screw to secure the apparatus to the ironing board. The flexible cord support is pivotably attached to the clamp and has a coiled spring resilient section to support the electrical cord above the ironing board. The article holder is mounted to the clamp and has a pair of tangs that detachably receive openings in a mounting brace. The apparatus also includes an electrical receptacle to receive the plug of the electrical cord. The cord support and article holder are removable from the ironing board for storage. The invention provides a convenient and space-saving solution for ironing board users to manage their electrical cords and store small items within easy reach.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can effectively sew buttonholes in various types of materials. The device includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly with a slidable member that can be positioned by a button to control the length of the buttonhole. An adjustable stop on the travelling assembly engages a tripping lever to terminate the formation of the buttonhole, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point. The device is designed to compensate for the slippage of different materials during sewing, ensuring that the buttonhole stitches close without overlap. The operator can adjust the stop to achieve a perfect buttonhole in a sample material before sewing buttonholes in a garment. The device is attached to a presser bar and includes a work engaging shoe and plate that move with the work during sewing. The invention provides a reliable and adjustable solution for sewing buttonholes in various materials.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution. The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch, which allows the liquid to act on the substances to be removed from the web for a longer period. The dwell stretch can be in the form of an air pass or a sieve drum with guide rollers, and is designed to maintain the textile web in a single-layer spread-out state with minimal tension. The apparatus is particularly suitable for treating knitted fabrics and printed materials, and can be used for "soilage washing" and other applications. The suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the conveyor, causing the web to adhere to the conveyor and be entrained thereby. The apparatus can have a compact construction and can be designed to collect and recycle the liquid used in the treatment process. The invention provides a surprising improvement in the washing effect and allows for effective washing without soiling a white background or causing damage to the textile web.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that induces ambient air to flow into the access opening of the machine whenever the door is opened, without exhausting the tubs. The system includes a separate intake fan and duct that is isolated from the solvent vapors developed during the cleaning cycle. The air flow system is designed to minimize the loss of residual solvent vapors from the tubs and air recirculating system. The dry cleaner also includes a solvent flow system, air flow system, and refrigeration system that work together to clean clothes and recover solvent vapors. The refrigeration system has a single compressor that alternatively cools two distinct evaporator coils under either a continuously timed demand or a cyclical temperature responsive demand. The machine is controlled through a timer mechanism that can be altered to provide a modified dry operation for drying filter cartridges. The controls include a "cartridge dry" switch that allows the proprietor to dry the filter cartridges prior to discarding them to reclaim any residual solvent or solvent vapors.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments, particularly using non-eductive drawing, which overcomes the limitations of conventional eductive and non-eductive systems. The system uses a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments, providing good control of cross-machine uniformity. The quench air is accelerated into the impingement slot, developing a drawing force without educting air into the system, and the same air is used for quenching and drawing the filaments. The invention allows for the formation of fine continuous filaments, particularly useful for producing nonwoven webs, and offers advantages such as improved web uniformity, reduced energy consumption, and increased process control.</summary>

<summary>
A sewing machine is disclosed that allows a user to specify a position on a work cloth using an ultrasonic pen. The sewing machine includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory, and can identify the position of the transmission source of the ultrasonic wave based on information pertaining to the ultrasonic wave detected by the detecting portion. The processor controls sewing based on the identified position. The ultrasonic pen includes a switch, a signal output circuit, and an ultrasonic transmitter, and can transmit an ultrasonic wave when the switch is turned on. The sewing machine can calculate the specified coordinates of the position on the work cloth based on the transmission timing and detection timings of the ultrasonic wave. The sewing machine can then display a display image showing the relationship between the specified position and the work cloth, and start sewing from the specified position. The ultrasonic pen can be connected to the sewing machine via a cable or wirelessly using an electromagnetic wave output circuit. The sewing machine can also include multiple receivers to detect the ultrasonic wave and calculate the specified coordinates more precisely.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to fabrics and textiles, specifically cellulosic fabric or textile materials, and methods of applying functional utility enhancing preparations onto these materials. The invention provides a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material, comprising a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with the functional additive carried by the wool particles. The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below. The preparation has demonstrated exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability, enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of a cellulosic fabric material. The invention also provides a preparation comprising powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents, with the bamboo powder being nano-sized and having an ultrafine particle size. The method of preparing the preparation involves pulverizing wool or bamboo fibre into ultrafine powder, forming a suspension, and adding functional additives and a binding agent. The preparation can be applied to the textile material by printing, padding, or foam application. The treated fabric exhibits improved properties such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, moisture management, and wrinkle recovery. The invention also provides a method of preparing a preparation comprising bamboo fibre as a functional additive, involving pulverizing bamboo fibre into ultrafine bamboo powder and mixing it with a binding agent and functional additives.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine that uses two separate computers to control the sewing machine function and the quilting table movement, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function. The machine uses a computer-aided design program to create and duplicate patterns, and the quilting table can be moved in the X and Y directions to sew the pattern into the fabric. The invention simplifies the process of reprogramming the machine and allows for more complex patterns to be created, making it a valuable improvement over prior art systems.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image, suitable for various consumer applications. The fabric is formed from two precursor webs, each comprising a fibrous matrix, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim in between to act as a fiber distribution control layer. The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device, which imparts a durable three-dimensional image to the fabric. The support layer or scrim helps to prevent excessive intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers, resulting in a fabric with distinct surface performance properties. The fabric can be treated with various post-entanglement treatments, such as polymeric binder compositions, mechanical compacting, or surfactant applications, to enhance its properties. The material can be used in various end-use products, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and apparel applications.</summary>

<summary>The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, allowing for continuous operation and the ability to sew relatively stiff strips of material without damaging the needle. The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip, controlling a signal transmitter to start the sewing operation and lower the presser foot.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments, providing a connective knitting method that joins two tape-shaped knit pieces by overlaying and binding off symmetrical loops, thus eliminating the need for a separate sewing process. This method utilizes a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds to knit and join the two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric, resulting in a seamless and comfortable finish.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for producing the traction element, which comprises at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength. The stranded cable is sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer, and the production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller. The method involves degreasing and/or pretreating the stranded cables, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the plastics material, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material. The production line can produce traction elements with a wide range of use, including lift bands or cables that meet high safety requirements. The traction elements have a tensile strength of at least about 4000 kN/steel stranded cable and can be used as electric conductors. The method achieves a sharp improvement in the adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket, which lasts over long-term and intensive use.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement that minimizes hindrance to the guiding of the needle thread loop and its pull-back after maximum expansion. The holding means that prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing are arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached. A capsule release device can be used to give the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, eliminating the slight impediment of thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod. The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture, providing a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop. </summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films from liquid silane inks by electrospinning. The inks can be four-component or five-component, with the latter including a solid phase component such as metallic particles, semiconducting particles, or photoactive particles. The electrospun fibers can be transformed into amorphous or crystalline silicon composites through thermal treatment or light activation via radical polymerization. The resulting silicon-based materials can be used in various applications, including as anodes in lithium-ion batteries, and can be coated with a conductive material to enhance their properties. The invention provides a continuous and scalable method for producing silicon-based nanofibers and composites with tailored chemical composition and structure.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is directed to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel, allowing for both global and individual thread tension control. The arrangement features a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a spool holder, with a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element, and a tensioning lever biased by the departing thread and influenced by a fluid pressure sensitive biasing arrangement. The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, allowing for central control of thread tension, and can be used to increase braking force for rapid shutdown. The invention also includes an alternate embodiment featuring an electromagnetic brake, where a magnetic system generates eddy currents in a braking disc to control thread tension.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that overcomes the disadvantages of conventional detectors by providing a low-cost, durable, and compact detector that minimizes stress on optical fibers and eliminates electrical interference. The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs and stationary reflecting portions to detect sewing machine control signals, including needle position, speed, and thread trimmer timing, and includes an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere with the control circuitry.</summary>

<summary>The present invention is a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through a combination of completion of coagulation, washing with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying. The process eliminates the need for desulphurating and bleaching treatments, reducing the number of treatment liquors and resulting in a more economical and efficient production process.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a continuation-in-part of a previously abandoned patent application and addresses the problem of washing pulp after an oxygen stage in the bleaching process. The inventors created a small deaeration tank that can be placed on top of an oxygen reactor, has no moving parts, and allows for the recovery of steam or oxygen. The deaeration tank uses a swirl-inducing inlet pipe and a filtrate swirler inlet to remove oxygen from the pulp, with the filtrate from the washer being used as the swirling fluid. The tank's design and dimensions, including the location and size of the inlet and outlet pipes, are optimized for deaeration. The system controls the height of the pulp in the deaeration tank and the flow of filtrate to maintain a consistent pulp consistency. The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution for deaerating pulp before washing, compared to existing large and expensive systems.</summary>

<summary>
This invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The BTR composite materials are designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which employs topology optimization to optimize material distribution. The FOMD process has resulted in innovative structural material concepts, including the BTR composite materials. The BTR composite structure includes six fundamental components: tendons, ribs, joints, flesh, skins, and shell. The two-dimensional material concept can be extended to a three-dimensional lattice, and various raw materials can be used to create the structure. The BTR composite has several advantages, including the use of embedded fiber tendons, which can act as safety members to preserve the integrity of the structure. The BTR composite can be used in various applications, including aerospace, automotive, and marine industries.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a load-limiting device that can be used in braced frames to dissipate energy during dynamic events, such as earthquakes, and limit the loads transmitted to other parts of the structure. The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation in response to high lateral loads, allowing it to absorb energy and reduce the stress on the structure. The device can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation, and it can be designed to accommodate various bracing configurations and structural applications. The invention aims to provide a reliable and cost-effective method for protecting structures from damage caused by dynamic events.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use in a flophouse facility, providing individual rooms on the floor of an existing building. The cabinet is designed to be compact, with a floor area approximately equal to the area of a bed, and a height that allows a user to sit up comfortably. The cabinet has a completely enclosed circumference, except for a doorway, and can be easily installed and stacked in a limited floor area. The invention aims to overcome the disadvantages of conventional bedroom cabinets, which have protruding portions that reduce the dwelling area and deteriorate the external appearance. The bedroom cabinet of the present invention has a dual construction, comprising an outer casing and an inner casing, which provides excellent mechanical strength and allows for the formation of a clearance between the two casings. This clearance can be used to house boxes for electric devices, shelves for user belongings, and wiring for interior devices. The cabinet also features a venting system, with vent holes and a clearance that acts as an intake and exhaust passage, providing natural ventilation and sound-proofing. The invention includes two embodiments, with the second embodiment featuring a desired clearance over the entire portion between the outer casings and the inner casing, achieved by using spacer members with vent grooves. The spacer members are interposed and locked between the inner surfaces of the outer casings and the panels of the inner casing, providing a sound-proofing wall and an intake and exhaust passage. The bedroom cabinet of the present invention is designed to be compact, functional, and easy to install, making it ideal for use in flophouse facilities.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the construction industry, particularly in high-rise apartment and office building construction. The guard rail support consists of a base plate, an upright column, rail supporting brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The support is designed to be secured to a floor or ground surface and can be used to construct a safety barrier with upper and lower wooden rails and a kick board. The invention also includes a concrete-filled steel base for use in situations where anchoring to a floor or ground surface is not possible. The guard rail support is designed to be easy to install and remove, and can be used in a variety of situations, including construction sites, roof structures, and bridge construction. The invention provides a safe and efficient way to protect workers from falls and meets safety guidelines and regulations.
</summary>

<summary>

The present invention is a pulsed power device and method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) that uses a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate crude oil reservoirs. The device generates high-frequency acoustic stimulation of the reservoir separately from the direct acoustic response of the electrohydraulic shock wave. The electromagnetic pulse induces a coupled acoustic vibration at very high frequencies in geologic materials, causing stimulation at multiple scales in the reservoir body. The invention differs from prior art in that it uses a coupled process of direct electrohydraulic acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations. The device can be customized to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir. The invention also includes the use of electromagnetic pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, allowing for placement in more sensitive wells. The device can be directed using a range of directional focusing and shaping devices to cause the acoustic pulse to travel only in specific directions. The invention also includes methods for separating the fluids produced from the wellbore into its components, including associated gas, condensate, liquid hydrocarbons, and other materials. The separated components can be further processed using various methods, including membrane separation, fractionation, and cryogenic separation.

</summary>

<summary>The present disclosure describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element, which is used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures, by coupling one or more grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element. The splice includes two wave plates with transverse protrusions that receive and seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, and a connective device that couples the wave plates together, thereby preventing the wires from escaping and securing the splice.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production. The plow blade consists of a blade, leading edge sections, a point, and a fluid tube, with a chute attached to the rear edge of the blade to receive and guide a utility line. The fluid tube is adapted to travel in a void in the leading edge section to transfer pressurized fluid from the top of the plow into the void. The flow paths are defined by providing a small gap between the front surface of the blade and the rear surface of the leading edge section, allowing fluid to pass from the void and out between stitch welds. The invention allows for varying the length of the fluid tube, the number of leading edge sections, and the location of stitch welds to tailor the plow for specific applications. The plow can be modified using hand tools, without welding, by replacing nozzles with plugs or varying the size of nozzles to control flow rates and location of fluid injection.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a building system, specifically stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc. The system allows for the creation of panels greater than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without movement control joints. The invention consists of a frame or substructure, battens, a first mesh attached to the battens, a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix applied as more than one layer. The system is designed to provide compliance with building codes NZS3604 and NZS4251, and to provide stucco walled structures having panel rigidity and integrity.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a safe and door structure, specifically a floor safe, with a valuables receiving chamber and a door that can be easily assembled and removed, featuring a unique locking mechanism that provides security against prying and forced entry. The safe construction can be formed using various materials, including concrete, steel, or a combination of both, and is designed to be simple, yet effective, in protecting valuable items.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the monitoring and measuring of fluid pressures in geological formations, providing a more accurate measurement of fluid pressure at a desired elevation or depth without being influenced by pressures above and below the pressure measuring apparatus. The invention involves cementing a conduit fitted with a filter in a borehole, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and then displacing the grout to achieve a fluid connection between the formation and the filter. The process can be followed by a hydrofracture process to ensure connectivity and measure the fluid pressure in the formation. The invention provides a reliable connection system between the pressure sensing location and the transducer system, allowing for the measurement of formation pressures at desired depths. The system can be used in various applications, including groundwater monitoring, petroleum engineering, and coal seam gas extraction.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, and is easy to maintain. The jointing structure comprises multiple steps, elastic members, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap. The elastic members are designed to be hard to deform vertically and easy to deform horizontally, and are made of laminated rubber. The joint block is made of the same concrete as the traveling path or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete, providing high slip resistance to tires. The jointing structure can be easily mounted without being affected by seasons, periods of time, or bridge girder ages, and allows for smooth vehicle traveling without the need for emergency measures. The invention also provides a method of mounting an elastic member, which involves joining the elastic members together, fixing one side, deforming the elastic member, and then fixing the other side.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, specifically for transporting wheeled trucks in a sanitary environment. The system aims to prevent the wheels of the trucks from contaminating the treatment fluid, allowing for the recovery and reuse of the fluid. The invention includes an enclosed floor track system with a wheel channel that stands off the floor, preventing showered fluid from entering the wheel channel area. The system is designed for use with hand trucks having horizontally axled wheel structures and includes a cover plate that can be pivoted away for cleaning. Another embodiment of the invention utilizes inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the interior wheel channel of the track, preventing brine solution from entering the guide track channel. The seals are attached to the inner surfaces of the sidewalls and make firm contact with the I-beam strut of the hand truck, preventing movement of the trucks along the track system. The invention provides a sanitary environment for transporting meat products and allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution. The enclosed floor track system is designed to be durable and resistant to corrosion, with components preferably constructed of stainless steel.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a boom of a backhoe work machine from being rotated downward by its weight, and it comprises an engaging member and an engaged member that can be easily operated manually to perform a lock operation. The lock device is constructed to maintain the lock position at any rotation position of the boom between the highest and lowest positions, and it can be applied to various work machines such as excavating devices, loaders, and cranes.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency during the pool cleaning operation. The apparatus features a novel adjustment mechanism that enables quick and easy regulation of the amount of suction being exerted by the suction head, without having to adjust the vacuum at the circulation pump. The adjustment mechanism is conveniently located on the top of the suction head and can be operated by hand without the need for tools. The invention also includes a roller height adjustment device that can be provided in kit form for use with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies, allowing for easy retrofitting of existing devices. </summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing, which can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole. The apparatus consists of a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that is slidably movable along the mandrel, allowing for vertical movement while preventing rotational movement, thus preventing damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing. The retriever section can be adapted with protruding members or a threaded lower end section to engage with the wear bushing, and can be easily removed and installed for quick retrieval of the wear bushing during drilling operations.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools used to dislodge stuck objects, known as fish, from a wellbore. Existing vibratory tools have limitations, such as not allowing wireline access through the tool and having components that are prone to wear and fatigue. The new tool design addresses these issues by having a central passage that can be closed by landing a plug on a seat, allowing wireline access before the plug is dropped. The dump valve is disposed annularly about the central passage, eliminating the need for it to be slammed against a seat. The tool uses modular stacked piston units to increase the delivered power of the vibrations. The design allows for the tool to be operated with or without impacts of the pistons on the housing. The tool can be configured to tolerate continued downward mandrel movement to dissipate its momentum after the dump valve opens. The components are designed to apply power to the mandrel for a down cycle when the dump valve closes, achieving a longer power stroke. The tool can be used in various operations, including stimulation and fishing, and provides large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string. The design also allows for a rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for torque transmission.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a precast concrete retaining wall system, comprising a face panel with an integral counterfort and a base, which can be assembled on-site without requiring temporary shoring. The face panel and base are pre-manufactured, allowing for customization and cost savings. The counterfort provides additional support to the wall, and rebars can be cast within the counterfort for added strength. The base can be designed with openings to accept the rebars from the counterfort, and a shear key can be used to connect the face panel and base. The system can be modified to include H-piles for added stability in poor soil conditions, and a vehicle impact barrier can be formed and cast-in-place on top of or behind the wall. The invention allows for taller walls and shorter bases, and the pre-manufactured components can be easily transported and assembled on-site. The system is flexible and can be customized to meet specific design requirements.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving oil and gas well production by heating the oil and paraffin near the production zone. The system addresses the shortcomings of conventional down hole heaters by properly focusing heat where it is needed and protecting electrical components from chemical and physical attack. The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, a heat insulating packer, and stainless steel tubing collars to contain the heat within the desired zone. The invention also includes a method for using the system to heat-treat an oil or gas well, which can be utilized with or without down hole pipe, and is particularly beneficial in treating deep gas wells with iron sulfide occlusion problems. </summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore. The mechanism is designed to effectively connect a pull tool to a down hole object or fish and to simply and effectively disconnect the pull tool from the article if desired. The mechanism can be used in various down hole service operations, including wire line service operations. The tool structure consists of an outer tubular body and an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the overshot or spear to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object to be removed from the well bore. A catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position secures the tubular outer body about the inner body. The mechanism can be locked and unlocked by simple mechanical movement of a wire line controlled pulling tool. The invention provides a means for controlling, locking, and unlocking of the collet or spear slip structures with respect to the object to be removed. The mechanism can be latched and unlatched as many times as necessary to accomplish the service operation involved, and it can be easily removed and replaced with a heavier-duty mechanism if needed.
</summary>

<summary>
The present application relates to stave floors, specifically modular composed stave floors, and claims the benefit of a PCT International Patent Application and two Mexico patent applications. The background of the invention discusses the drawbacks of conventional composed stave floors, including the thin thickness of the sight substrate, which can lead to deformation and detachment. The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate and provide a longer useful life for the floors. The method of manufacture includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, and assembling them together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement means. The invention also provides improved composed stave floors with applied glaze, eliminating the need for glaze application during installation. The example embodiments include a conventional composed stave floor that exhibited detachment and deformation, and a composed stave floor of the invention that did not present deformation or detachment and allowed for corrective maintenance. The invention provides floors with increased durability and allows for the preservation of the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate. The example embodiments can be varied in many ways, and all such modifications are considered to be included within the scope of the claims.</summary>

<summary>The present invention is a ladder attachment designed to improve the lateral stability of a ladder, prevent slipping or sliding, and protect the work surface from damage. The attachment features a large contact area brace assembly with a resilient pad that can pivot to accommodate different surfaces, including corners, and provides a non-slip gripping portion that grips the work surface without damaging it. The invention aims to overcome common problems associated with traditional ladders, such as instability, slipping, and damage to the work surface, and can be adapted to various ladder types and materials.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, defining a collar portion that captures the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between adjacent collar portions. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin or epoxy, and is applied to preheated fasteners to enhance adhesion. The connecting portion can be formed with a bridge and a rib, and can include a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location. The nail strip can be configured to reduce debris generation by positioning the collar closer to the tip of the nail, using a tapered collar, or incorporating a rib that extends less than the axial length of the collar. The invention also includes various embodiments of the nail collation, such as a coiled nail collation, an embossed pattern, and a tapered connecting portion. The present invention reduces debris generation and increases the holding power of the nails in the substrate.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industrial applications, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle comprises a bell or hood-shaped tip and an injection button, which provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function. The nozzle is designed to facilitate the injection of silicone or other sealants in multiple industrial applications, particularly in the aeronautical industry. The injection button has a special design with channels and orifices for carrying out sealing operations with greater accuracy. The nozzle can be used in both manual and automated sealant injection machines, and its design allows for precision adjustment to the sealant container cartridge or injection machine. The nozzle is preferably made of plastic, and its structure allows for the application of sealants in a precise and controlled manner. The invention provides a device that simplifies the sealing work, reducing the sealant application time, and increasing the quality of the resulting sealant application. The nozzle can be used to apply sealing cords, filler sealant, or safety cords, ensuring a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a position sensor that can be used to monitor the position or movement of an object, particularly in mechanical systems such as internal combustion engines. The sensor uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and remove unwanted noise, allowing for a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system. The sensor can be multiplexed with other sensors on a minimum number of wires, making it desirable for use in systems where multiple sensors are required.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, which provides a substantially infinitely variable valve actuator system that can be precisely controlled to present the most advantageous configuration of valving. The system eliminates the need for springs and allows for variable valve displacement, which can be controlled by a computer system to optimize engine performance and fuel efficiency. The invention can be applied to various engine configurations, including multiple valves per cylinder, and offers advantages over traditional cam-spring systems in terms of performance, efficiency, and manufacturability.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, specifically a light member with a housing and a lighting control region that includes multiple control channels for controlling different colors of light, allowing for adjustable color temperature output and variable functionality. The light member can be used with various types of enclosures and structures, including aquariums and underneath office or kitchen cabinets, and can be controlled by switches, timers, or remotely using a remote control.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures. The apparatus is designed to avoid the disadvantages of known flow deflection apparatuses, such as complex casting, high blade weight, and thermal stresses. The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts that are inserted into the apparatus and secured. The use of inserts has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, and reduced blade weight. The inserts can be composed of metal or non-metal materials and can be easily adjusted or replaced. A preferred embodiment of the invention features a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls. The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape and can be secured by soldering or welding. The invention is particularly advantageous for rotor blades in gas turbines, where it results in considerable simplifications. The separating walls can be inserted through the blade root or blade tip and can be secured in the blade tip region or blade root region.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve, and provides output signals to control a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.</summary>

<summary>

This invention relates to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste. Conventional wood waste fuel burners have been inefficient in combustion, discharging undesirable amounts of pollution and requiring frequent cleaning. The invention aims to provide a clean burning waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials and operates with little slag or clinkers. The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile in controlled amounts. The volatile gases are then partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially in a primary combustion chamber. The gases are then discharged into a secondary combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced for complete combustion. The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in the load. The invention can be used for various industrial purposes, including boilers, lime kilns, and dryers. The burner can operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and the feed of fuel can be controlled quickly. The invention also reduces the need for frequent cleaning and prolongs the life of the refractory lining.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is an evaporative refrigeration system that provides a highly efficient apparatus for cooling air. The system uses a heat exchanger that separates its dry and wet sides, keeping evaporating water separate from the useful air to achieve sensible cooling. The working air is drawn from the load, or the room to be cooled, and is recirculated to the wet side of the heat exchanger, where it is used to evaporate water and cool the heat exchanger tubes. The cooled air is then passed through the dry side of the heat exchanger, where it is cooled further and delivered to the enclosure. The system can be modified to include a hybrid vapor compression refrigeration unit, which can further cool a portion of the air stream and dehumidify it. The hybrid system can achieve a dry bulb reduction of 3.8° F and an additional cooling effect of 1° F. The system is more efficient than traditional vapor compression refrigeration units, with a power consumption of about 1 to 1.5 kilowatts compared to 4 to 8 kilowatts for a comparable vapor compression unit.
</summary>

<summary>
A fluid pump is described, comprising two or more pump heads in series, each with a housing containing an impeller driven by a drive structure. The pump heads are connected to provide a fluid flow path between them, and the drive structure commonly drives the impellers. The pump is designed to pump fluids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures. Each pump head has an inlet and outlet, and the fluid flow is combined into a single flow before exiting the pump head. The pump can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, to facilitate operation at a fluid reservoir. The pump is particularly useful for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir, and can be designed to accommodate solid material in the reservoir. The pump heads can be connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal, and can be removably connected to facilitate modularity and repair. The pump can be tailored to specific applications by adjusting the number of pump heads in the series.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes, specifically to engines having engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders. Traditional engine compression release brake systems typically include an engine brake for each engine cylinder, but this can result in excess components if not all cylinders are used for braking. The present invention aims to overcome this problem by providing an engine compression release brake system with a reduced number of components. The system includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, with an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, which is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders. The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve and is controlled by an electronic control module. The system allows for modular engine compression release braking, where customers can choose and pay for the amount of braking horsepower they desire for a specific application. The engine brake is activated by an electrical actuator, which controls the flow of high-pressure fluid to move a piston and open the exhaust valve, allowing compressed air to be vented from the cylinder. The system can be modified to accommodate different engine configurations and braking requirements.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads caused by events like blade-off. The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively retains the links, allowing for translation and damping of motion when the pin is sheared due to extreme loads. The design enables the gearbox to absorb shocks without detaching from the engine or transmitting destructive loads, and the pin can be replaced during maintenance after a shock sufficient to break it. The mounting link's coulomb damping and pin shear characteristics help prevent damage to the gearbox and its peripherals while allowing for the gearbox's safe detachment from the engine in extreme events. </summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to archery equipment, specifically to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts, providing a solution to the shortcomings of prior art. The invention includes a point cap system, a balance pin, and a nock cap adaptor that work together to provide a small, lightweight, and adjustable system for perfect balance. The point cap and balance pin design allows for the attachment of points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft, and the use of external threads reduces stress on the shaft, making it ideal for graphite shafts.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training, specifically designed for the M16 automatic weapon. The device aims to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation. The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system. The expendable contains multiple rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. The device produces sound and flash by electrically igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port. The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt. The simulator is designed to be reusable, reliable, and low maintenance, with a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber. The device is packaged to resemble an M16 magazine clip and includes a reusable housing, an exhaust port, and a battery compartment. The plastic expendable is designed to be fabricated automatically, reducing costs, and contains pyrotechnic charges that are electrically ignited to produce a realistic simulation of small arms fire. The simulator can be used with a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES) unit attached to the weapon.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of airflow to improve volumetric efficiency. A known device with a tank, valve, and valve activating means enhances engine performance but can increase noise if the inlet pipe is too short. The invention aims to improve engine performance while reducing noise from the air intake. The device comprises a tank, two pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a valve actuated by an engine operating condition. The first pipe has a larger cross-sectional area than the second pipe, and the second pipe opens to the air intake passage nearer the air cleaner. A control valve is disposed in the first passage and is actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator. The valve operation is controlled based on engine speed and load conditions, and the control conditions can be stored as a map in the control circuit. The device reduces noise by utilizing the volume of the tank and the narrow passage of the second pipe as a resonator. The invention improves engine performance by controlling the valve to create a compound volumetric efficiency curve.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, allowing for simple mounting and directional positioning. The adjustable bracket is attached to the product and then positioned on the stationary bracket, which is attached to the mounting surface. The bracket assembly is designed for one person to install a fairly heavy item without needing to support the weight and handle attachment hardware simultaneously. The system uses a minimal amount of inexpensive but robust components, providing economic and time-based efficiency for the installer. The bracket assembly can be used on walls or poles, and includes a pole clamp assembly with adapter brackets and a chain for securing the stationary bracket to the pole. The adjustable bracket can be rotated and locked into place, allowing for easy adjustment and secure mounting of the product. The invention is suitable for mounting loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, video cameras, and other equipment.
</summary>

<summary>

The present disclosure relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner that can be part of a system with interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances. The burner is designed to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions. It features a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, surrounded by an outer wall and a shroud, which provides a flow path for tertiary combustion air.
