The burner also has legs to hold it above ground level, a pivotally coupled ash pan, and a perforate food grate that can be moved to a deployed or stowed position. A cover is pivotally coupled to the burner to close the combustion chamber and prevent accidental exposure to heat and exhaust fumes. The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances, including cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The modular heat utilizing appliances can be detachably coupled to the burner using draw latches. The pyrolyzer includes a heating chamber, a condenser, and conduits for conducting vaporized products of pyrolysis to the burner or an external outlet. The burner can be provided with a fuel feed feature to enable continuous operation. The present disclosure encompasses various arrangements and combinations of components, features, and functionalities.

</summary>

<summary> The rotary internal combustion engine's water cooling system is crucial for improving fuel economy and durability, particularly in the area surrounding the spark plugs where combustion and expansion of working gases occur. The in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in the water passageway can disrupt cooling fluid flow, leading to vapor film collection and reduced heat extraction. This invention proposes a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses to improve cooling characteristics and reduce the possibility of structural failure. The staggered configuration allows for high-velocity flow, controlled and devoid of uncontrolled swirling eddies, maintaining a high heat transfer coefficient at the spark plug boss surfaces. Tests have shown that the staggered arrangement can increase the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line arrangement, resulting in a more uniform temperature gradient across the gas side of the wall. </summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance and maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves. This is achieved by determining the flow change due to closure of one of the parallel flow paths and applying the difference to the total flow demand to each of the remaining valves. The invention uses a test compensation circuit that adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing. The method has been tested and shown to reduce pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% during control valve testing.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of two fluids, such as soap solution and water, emerging from an outlet passage. The valve system enables multiple users to operate from a common fluid source without affecting the fluid pressure required by each user, and provides a constant pressure cleaning solution with a continuously adjustable cleaning agent to water ratio.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure, resulting in a lower exit temperature. The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method, which includes a compressor station with at least one compressor, a heat exchanger, and an expanding unit. The compressor station is controlled by an electronic control system that operates the compressor and valves to achieve the desired pressure and temperature. The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution compared to conventional re-cooling technology, with a lower investment requirement of approximately 40-45%. The compressor station can be operated in different modes depending on the outside temperature, with a parallel operation of compressors during winter operation and a serial operation during summer operation. The use of expansion turbines allows for the recovery of drive energy, reducing the specific energy consumption of the compressor station. The invention is particularly useful for long-distance pipelines with high pressures and large diameters. The method and arrangement of the present invention provide a safer and more reliable solution for gas transportation in permanent frost areas.</summary>

<summary> The present invention discloses a system for mounting a cooling fan to an enclosure without using fasteners, reducing labor and handling costs. The cooling fan assembly includes a motor carrier with mounting legs that have resilient leg portions, which are inserted into recessed portions on the panel and secured through a combination of compressive and rotating forces. The mounting legs are designed to spring outwardly and capture the panel, preventing vibrational noise and disengagement, and are urged by spring members to maintain a secure connection. The invention is applicable in various industries, including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation, where forced air movement is used for cooling. </summary>

<summary> 
Spacecraft structures require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have low inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise instrument functionality. To address this issue, researchers have been exploring graphite structure modifications to reduce vibration response, but these efforts may not be sufficient. The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The invention modifies kinematic mounts by inserting vibration damping materials, which introduce a damping mechanism to dissipate high energy disturbances. Two embodiments of the damper design are presented, one using a spherical damper and the other using a cylindrical slot damper. The damping mechanism can be provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts, and the design can be tailored to achieve specific bending stiffness characteristics. The invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads, and it can be applied to a large number of precision or optical instruments/sensors where alignment stability is important. The proposed mounting scheme provides a center-of-gravity mounting system, which can be beneficial in applications where dynamic disturbances are inherent within the instrument.
</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a large size oil shear type clutch unit, particularly for use in an aircraft catapult system, which overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions by providing strong coupling forces between plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy. The clutch unit features a novel arrangement of interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment, and utilizes hydraulic fluid for both retracting the plate actuating means and cooling the clutch discs. The invention also allows for easy removal and replacement of individual clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit, and minimizes residual drag, making it suitable for high-power applications.</summary>

<summary>The invention describes an internal combustion engine with a combustion cylinder and one or more expansion cylinders that capture and utilize the heat energy from the exhaust gases, allowing for increased thermal-to-mechanical efficiency and potentially eliminating the need for a radiator. The engine uses a water injection system to cool the exhaust gases and create additional steam, which drives the expansion cylinders and contributes to the overall power output. The system can achieve steady-state thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies of 94-96% and can be adapted to various engine configurations, including different types of fuel and air cylinders, and can utilize various fuels, including gasoline, diesel, and hydrogen.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat-treated to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance. The invention involves removing a portion of the metal alloy layer from the precoat on at least one face of the plate, leaving the intermetallic alloy layer intact. This removal can be done by brushing or laser ablation, and the width of the removal area is adjusted to prevent the introduction of metal coating into the molten area during welding. The invention also provides a method for fabricating a precoated steel plate, which includes coating a steel plate, removing the metal alloy layer, and cutting the plate to produce a plate with the desired removal area. The steel composition is also specified, with a carbon content between 0.10 and 0.5%, and other elements such as manganese, silicon, and chromium present in specific ranges. The welded blank is then heated to form a surface intermetallic alloy compound, and the part is hot-deformed and cooled to confer the target mechanical characteristics. The invention achieves good ductility of the welded joint after treatment and good corrosion resistance. The parts fabricated using this method can be used for the construction of automotive vehicles, particularly for safety parts such as anti-intrusion or underbody parts, reinforcing bars, and B-pillars.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) remote control system for a mobile structure that recovers energy from severe weather patterns. The system uses an algorithm to optimize efficiency by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, and relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure. The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, such as GPS, weather satellites, and the National Weather Service. The system also includes a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure, which communicates with the central service facility through a wireless physical medium. The central service facility houses a server that aggregates weather data and performs data collection, processing, storage, analyses, and navigation vector determinations. A human operator can interact with the system through a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to invoke various SCADA algorithms and affect the behavior of the mobile structure. The system can be used for various types of mobile structures, including sailing vessels, propelled vessels, and barges, and can be used for energy recovery from wind, water currents, and other sources.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures, and a method for manufacturing such a cage. The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, particularly welded, to one another. The flat material ring segments are cut out from a sheet metal material, preferably as 120° ring segments, and welded together along edge regions that face one another. The invention reduces production costs by minimizing waste material and is particularly advantageous for manufacturing rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.</summary>

<summary>

The present methods and systems relate to processing and transmitting information to facilitate providing service in a telecommunications network, particularly using global satellite positioning to process and transmit information associated with telecommunications service locations and routing travel between multiple service locations. Efficient and effective customer service is crucial for commercial enterprises, and maintaining accurate knowledge of a customer's location is essential. However, computer systems and databases often provide vague references to a customer's exact location, leading to excessive driving time and slow response times. The present methods and systems aim to acquire information associated with a customer's service location, such as latitude and longitude coordinates. A service technician can use an input device to access a technician server, which can request coordinates from the GPS system and update databases with the obtained coordinates. The GPS system can provide supervisors with comprehensive technician activity information and acquire information associated with a customer service location. The dispatch system can receive, process, and transmit information related to service required at customer service locations, while the address guide system stores universal type address information. The customer record system stores customer-related information and interfaces with the dispatch system to generate work orders. The present methods and systems can also provide a mapping system for routing travel of a service technician between multiple customer service locations. The mapping system can generate driving directions from a "from" location to a "to" location for the service technician.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor. The system aims to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields and to simulate measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected. The system consists of two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors to create a virtual sensor signal, which is then processed by independent control loops to generate control signals for the coils. The system can also account for feedback effects when two compensation systems are used in close proximity. The control algorithm used by the control system can be described as O=L·Ω(M·S), where O is the control signal, L is a 6×6 matrix, Ω is the control algorithm, M is a 6×6 matrix describing the averaging over the output signals of the real sensors, and S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors. The system can be used in various applications, including imaging systems using magnetic fields, such as scanning electron microscopes (SEM).</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering (CARS) microscopy. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner. This allows for the introduction of a corresponding structure that is not inherently contained in the sample, enabling the detection of chemical structures that are normally not detectable by CARS microscopy. The bioorthogonal reaction can be used to generate resonance sites in the context of the reaction itself, and can be accomplished through various reactions such as cycloaddition or Staudinger ligation. The method enables the selective accentuation of defined structures in a sample and allows for the use of small molecules that can be introduced deep into a corresponding tissue. The invention also makes it possible to tag the non-resonant background with corresponding resonance sites, generating a stable and reproducible background signal. This method combines the advantages of known multi-photon techniques with a selective reaction, allowing for dedicated detection of target sites in any samples without negatively affecting biochemical processes.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, allowing for the comparison of segmentations from different clinicians or software systems, and evaluating the quality of segmentations for radiation therapy. The system uses electronic files to generate volume models, compares the models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements, and outputs a measure of conformance between the segmentations based on a metric method.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the acceleration of the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit, which is a complex and time-consuming process in data processing systems. The invention achieves this by determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments and using this subset difference to begin the subtraction of differences between operand fractions. The subset is chosen such that when the complete difference is determined and the current procedure is found to be incorrect, the correct resulting fraction is available. The invention accelerates the computation by initiating the operation requiring a calculation prior to the determination of the difference between the complete operand arguments. The apparatus implementing the invention includes a detection logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, and a subtraction unit, which work together to determine the final fraction result.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the collection of blood and medical specimens in a medical facility, aiming to reduce or avoid mislabeling of specimen vials. The method involves storing machine-readable codes for the patient's ID, the order, the specimen-taker's ID, and the specimen container in a computer storage. The processor determines if the patient's ID and order are related to the same patient and stores the codes in a relational manner if they are. The processor then generates a signal to acquire a specimen from the patient and to place the acquired specimen in the container. The method also includes storing an indication that the specimen has been placed in the container and comparing the time between the signal and the completion of the specimen collection to a predetermined time. The invention provides a failsafe, zero-defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples, eliminating the need for vial labels and associated costs. The system can be implemented using standalone or networked computers and local or remote computer storage, and can be used for various types of biological specimens.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that uses GPS and voice recognition technology to provide golfers with information such as distance to the pin, green size, and pin placement. The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a golf hat or visor, and uses a bone conductance vibration sensor to receive voice commands. The device can also provide pre-recorded golf instructions and can be used for other applications such as hiking, surveying, and hunting. The device can be connected to a personal computer via a serial, USB, or wireless connection to upload and download data, and can also be used with a Bluetooth headset for hands-free operation. The device can record geographic coordinates of a golf course, including hazards and fairway boundaries, using a portable computing device equipped with a GPS device. The recorded course data can be used to calculate distances between the golfer's current GPS position and course features, and can also be used for other purposes such as course maintenance and map production. The device can also be used to provide strategic recommendations to golfers based on their past performance, and can be expanded to include other features and applications.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the field of semiconductor design technology, specifically to systems and techniques used for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs). The invention provides a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports errors for different regions in a system, such as memory and logic. The method applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data, eliminating false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules. Customized design rules are created for each different type of region, based on modifying a standard set of logic rules to reflect the needs of particular regions in the chip. The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks or multiple types of memory blocks. The system and method ensure that all types of memory regions fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions fulfill logic and memory rules, avoiding false errors and increasing reliability and efficiency.
</summary>

<summary>This invention uses thin substrate waveguides as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators, providing controlled and efficient illumination with high diffraction efficiency. The waveguide hologram illuminator can be designed to compensate for non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront, reduce stray light, and increase spectral selectivity, making it suitable for various applications.</summary>

<summary>

This invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators. The test apparatus includes a test head with exciting means for magnetizing the rotor, voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal, and current sensing means for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current. The apparatus also includes processing means for determining the resistance and reactance of the rotor, and skew sensing means for sensing the effective electrical skew of the rotor. The test head has a unique construction with a core of magnetic material and a set of primary windings that form at least one pair of poles. The test apparatus is controlled by a data acquisition, processing, and control system that automatically performs the rotor test and provides automatic pass/fail determinations. The system includes a data processor and a control processor that work together to acquire and process data, and to determine the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor. The test results are displayed on a display and can be printed on a printer, and statistical information is stored on a Winchester disk for later analysis. The test apparatus is designed to be efficient and cost-effective, with a dual test fixture system that allows for simultaneous testing of two rotors. The invention provides a novel and improved method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors.

</summary>

<summary>
The present disclosure relates to a method for securing a mobile device by controlling access to native resources of an operating system. A managed library is granted access to native resources in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library. A managed application is denied access to native resources, but may access specific native resources through the managed library if authorized by a digital certificate. The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource, authorizing the request through a manager, and accessing the native system resource through a runtime host. The method also includes verifying managed metadata associated with an executable to ensure type-safe code and storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container. The digitally signed container is transmitted to a mobile device, where it can be executed while preventing unauthorized access to native resources.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers. The card's design protects the electronic components from damage and provides a low-cost, easily constructed identification card. The core layer is made of a silica-filled polyolefin, and the antenna and IC chip are attached to one side of the core layer. The core layer is then bonded to a bottom sheet of printable, silica-filled polyolefin with an adhesive layer, and two layers of substantially transparent polymer are affixed to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure. The identification card may have one or two image-receiving layers, and a protective layer is applied over the image-receiving layer to protect the variable indicia and prevent bleeding of dye. The invention provides an identification card with significant improvements in durability and ease of manufacture compared to prior art identification cards and smart cards.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a queue, in a functional memory environment. A typical FIFO queue implementation is ineffective in functional memories, as each update requires copying the entire queue. The invention proposes a novel way of establishing a queue using a tree-shaped structure, where nodes have a maximum size and additions/deletions are directed to specific nodes. The tree structure is balanced, with all leaf nodes at the same level, and nodes are filled upwards. A header node can be added to the structure, comprising three elements pointing to the end, middle, and beginning of the queue. The header node enables faster and less space-consuming updates, and the queue can be inverted in constant time and space. The invention can be used to implement a double-ended queue, and the structure can be modified within the scope of the inventive idea. The memory arrangement implementing the invention comprises an actual memory, intermediate registers, control logic, and input/output registers.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, specifically embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies. The invention aims to provide practical methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, eliminating the need for special technologies and high voltages. Two types of EPROM devices are proposed: one using DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors and another using stress effects on common transistors, known as "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices. The EPROM devices of the present invention have advantages such as lower operation voltages, smaller area, and higher performance, making them suitable for applications such as programmable redundancy circuits on DRAM devices. The SEPROM devices, in particular, can be manufactured by any IC technology, are ideal for embedded applications, and provide a high level of security.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control, which allows for easy and accurate determination of the proper value of feedback gain in a short period of time. The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, and repeating these steps to calculate a suitable feedback gain value. The evaluation value is calculated based on the error, and the feedback gain value is determined based on the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value. The method is applied to the running control of an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV), where the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains are determined for each section of the running course. The evaluation functions used for the P, I, and D gains are suited for evaluating the stability, accuracy, and response of the running control. The method allows for quick and accurate determination of the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains without using complicated multiple variable analytic processes. The invention is also applicable to cases of obtaining the optimum values of feedback gains other than the P, I, and D gains.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a zoom lens with a high relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end, while minimizing the size of the entire lens system and preserving high-grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range. The zoom lens comprises five lens units, with specific conditions set forth for the construction and arrangement of the elements of the fourth and fifth lens units to achieve good correction of aberrations. The conditions include ranges for the refracting power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit, the refractive power ratio for the second lens in the fifth lens unit, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit. The invention achieves a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation with zooming of the aberrations. The total length of the lens system is reduced to as short as L=9.13φA to 9.19φA, making it suitable for photographic cameras or video cameras.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector. The method involves discharging a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side, allowing for both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals, particularly at high count rates. The device includes a detector, a first fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second slow amplifier for integrating signals, with the option to separate signals as a function of rate using capacitors, inductive elements, or low-pass filters. The invention enables the detection of elementary particles without knowing in advance the expected signal rates, making it suitable for various applications, including scientific research, medical technology, and electrical power engineering.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards each other to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly. A torque motor applies a predetermined torque to the assembly, and an electronic sensor measures the distance between the rings. The movable ring is then gradually moved away from the stationary ring, reducing the frictional force, and the sensor measures the distance when the assembly begins to rotate. The difference between the two distances is compared to a standard value to determine if the assembly is excessively warped. The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement and generates an external indication of whether the assembly is good or bad. The invention aims to provide an improved spin checking apparatus that is more efficient and accurate than prior test fixtures. The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control and minimize operator error.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to the field of image processing, specifically face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software for achieving accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solutions. Face age-estimation is a challenging task due to large variations in human faces and the influence of various factors such as gender, ethnicity, heredity, and environmental factors. The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images, which are then used to estimate the age of a person. The CAM algorithm is a combination of shape variation and texture variation, making it robust against noise and able to extract more robust facial features that encode age information. The invention also uses support vector machines (SVMs) to build an age classifier that distinguishes between youths and adults. The age classifier is used to determine which aging function to use to estimate the age of a person. The invention can be implemented on various computing devices, including smartphones, tablets, laptops, and desktops, and can be used in various applications such as automated control and surveillance systems, homeland security technologies, and management of e-documents. The invention can also be used to prevent children from viewing or consuming unacceptable media or programming and to thwart underage people from driving cars before they reach a legal driving age. The estimated ages can be provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, optionally with a corresponding confidence factor.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, particularly suited for applications where the two images have different definitions. The device comprises a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, with each arrangement having a first plurality of pixels dedicated to the display of a first image and one or more other pixels dedicated to the display of a second image. The device can display a first image, essentially monochrome, produced by a night vision sensor or an infrared sensor, merged with the display of a second image, essentially monochrome, produced by an infrared sensor or a monochrome or two-color symbology image. The device can also display a plurality of combined images, with arrangements of pixels in which pixels are dedicated to different images out of the plurality of images. The invention proposes algorithms for implementing the display of the merged images, which can be carried out by the controller of the matrix display device.</summary>

<summary>The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for keyless activation of a security system in a motor vehicle, which includes a payment element removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, allowing the user to carry out various payment actions. The payment element can be removed from the housing to prevent unauthorized use, and a closure is provided to seal and protect the receptacle and its contact elements when the payment element is removed. The mobile identification transmitter can communicate with both the security system of the motor vehicle and an electronic payment system, and can be designed with various features such as a carrier, energy storage devices, and a communication means for secure payment transactions.</summary>

<summary> An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, may experience a decrease in toner tribo charge when inactive for a long period, leading to inconsistent image quality. To address this issue, a method and apparatus for charging toner in an imaging device have been developed, which determine periods of inactivity and charge the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity. The method and apparatus may also measure the toner charge level when the device is recovered from inactivity and charge the toner based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level. By adjusting the tribo charge of the toner, the imaging device can maintain consistent image quality even after a delayed period of inactivity. </summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that allows for independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural magneto resistive (MR) heads mounted on a rotary drum, and enables high-speed switching over among plural heads with high precision. The apparatus achieves this through a control signal generator, a decoder circuit, and a current supply circuit, which work together to transmit control signals and set the operating currents of the MR heads, allowing for stable data recording and reproduction.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a system and method for locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, in the presence of an adjacent object. The system uses a transmitter with two antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver to sense the magnetic fields associated with the currents. The receiver produces an output signal dependent on the sensing of both fields, allowing for the location and tracing of one or both cables. The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables, and the receiver is moved back and forth over the ground to produce an output signal characteristic. The system can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, making it easier to locate and trace one or both cables. The invention uses techniques such as different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, and pulsing to make the currents distinguishable and produce an output signal dependent on the presence of both currents. The system is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced. The invention can be modified to use a single antenna for cable locating and tracing when only a single cable is present. The system can be optimized by adjusting a threshold sensitivity control to enhance the desired performance of the receiver.
</summary>

<summary>
This invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication. The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler, a timer, and a bypass switch to control the length of time of the interconnection. Two embodiments of the interfacer are disclosed, one using an electronic system and the other using an electromechanical system, both of which provide features such as automatic answering, hands-free communication, and adjustable timing. The invention aims to provide a simplified, portable, and readily connectable automatic answering service for individuals who require hands-free communication, such as the physically handicapped or those with limited mobility.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications, specifically to system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification within such networks. The invention aims to develop a communications system that reduces the number of undersea repeaters required, thereby reducing costs. The system utilizes a trunk and branch ring network, where a light emitting power source is coupled onto the optical fiber cable trunk to provide energy for an optical amplifier. The optical amplifier is located in the branch fiber optic cable, the optical fiber cable trunk, or the branching unit, and amplifies attenuated telecommunications signals. The system also includes a hub assembly with remote pumping, which allows optical energy to be coupled onto the optical fiber cable trunk and transported to the optical amplifier. The invention provides a repeaterless trunk and branch fiber optic ring network that maintains full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations via their respective branch fiber optic cables. The system is not limited to undersea applications and can be used as a terrestrial communications system. The invention reduces capital costs, operating costs, and maintenance costs of communications networks by utilizing repeaterless technology and remote pumping of an optical energy source through the network's branch fiber optical cables.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that eliminates exposed fasteners and provides a finished look. The device consists of two parts: an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it, and a cover plate member that has no fastener holes and only has apertures to receive the wiring device projections. The attachment member has latching pawls that engage saw-tooth shaped racks on the cover plate member, allowing for easy installation and removal. The device can accommodate variations in wall flatness or evenness, making it suitable for use with multiple wiring devices installed in ganged boxes. The cover plate member can be easily removed by inserting a small tool into a slot and prying it off the attachment member. The invention provides a quick and easy way to install and remove cover plates without exposed fasteners, making it a convenient and safe solution for electrical wiring installations.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, such as a television set or monitor, to prevent irritating reflections of natural or artificial light. The device consists of concentrically nested annular strips that can slide over each other between a pushed-in and a pushed-out position. The strips have a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen, enabling viewing from different angles. The device can be easily fitted to a monitor using an adapter member with a flat attachment face, and the strips can be produced by injection-moulding or bending plate material. The invention provides a reliable, inexpensive, and compact light-shielding device that can be easily fitted to a monitor. The device can be folded around the displaying screen to a very small size, taking up relatively little space and not forming an obstruction.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to automated speech technologies, specifically to automatically providing an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can comprehend. The invention aims to improve understanding between discourse participants, particularly when the listener is not a native speaker of the language being spoken. A device can monitor the rate of speech during a discourse and provide an indicator to the speaker to slow down when the rate of speech is too rapid for the listener to comprehend. The device can be a wearable device, such as a smart phone, or a portable device worn by the listener that includes a sensory mechanism noticeable by the speaker. The device can determine a speaking rate threshold based on the listener's language proficiency and adjust the threshold accordingly. The invention can also detect the language being spoken and determine whether the spoken language is a primary language of the listener. If not, the device can attempt to determine the listener's identity or profile to estimate a listening rate. The device can then notify the speaker to reduce their speaking rate if it exceeds the speaking threshold.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, allowing for a higher picture sequence frequency. Conventional TV cameras have a limited picture sequence frequency, and high-speed cameras are expensive and not suitable for immediate computer-assisted interpretation. The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, and a sawtooth generator synchronized with the counter. The counter counts line pulses and supplies an end-of-count pulse after a set number of pulses, which is applied to the beam suppression circuit. The sawtooth generator controls the vertical deviation of the beam, and the delay device allows for a selectable part of a line period. The device can be used to record rapid processes with a high and selectable resolution in time, and the line counter can be programmed to adjust the picture scanning time. The device can also be used to record IR, UV, or X-ray pictures. The video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for analysis, and the jumped-over lines can be completed by repetition or interpolation. The device is suitable for recording processes that previously required expensive film cameras with rotating mirrors. The invention allows for a flexible and cost-effective way to record rapid processes with a high picture sequence frequency.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to multimedia communications, specifically handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services. It provides a solution in the packet domain for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call, using a multimedia server associated with a telephony server. The multimedia server has software, referred to as a blender, that manages blended calls, initiating parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment. The blender controls the signaling paths of the parallel components, allowing the bearer path to be controlled to accommodate multimedia requests during the call. The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices, allowing existing customer premises equipment and network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. The blender may be a function of sequential logic devices or other hardware, and the invention may be used with various network systems and protocols, including Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) and Intelligent Network (IN) signals.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework that enables connected devices to perform contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies, using dynamic attributes and file bundles to optimize data transfer and ensure scalability. The framework allows client devices to synchronize content with a central reference point, which prioritizes and bundles files based on the client's context, and supports features such as data compression, concurrent downloading, and caching to improve efficiency and reliability.</summary>

<summary>The present invention provides a system and method for facilitating anonymous communication between a finder of a lost object and its owner, allowing for the return of the object while protecting the owner's identity and contact information. The system uses unique IDs and virtual locales, such as websites or instant messaging screen names, to enable communication between the finder and owner, and can be implemented using various programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a foil electron multiplier, which uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages, resulting in a higher gain per multiplication stage and increased multiplication efficiency. The foil electron multiplier has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers, including simplicity of fabrication, lower cost, ability to cover a larger area, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback. The invention has potential applications in photomultiplier tubes, particle detectors, electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors, such as night vision devices.</summary>

<summary>
The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows viewers to see 3-dimensional effects in ordinary motion pictures without the need for special equipment or filming techniques. The system uses the Pulfrich effect, which creates a 3-dimensional illusion when lateral motion is viewed through a darkened lens. The 3-D Phenomenoscope consists of viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital sensor, and a computer processor that calculates synchronization events to control the lenses. The system can be used with any type of motion picture media, including film, digital film, VCR tape, and DVD. The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes problems associated with traditional 3-dimensional motion pictures, such as the need for special equipment and the potential for eyestrain and discomfort. The system uses a lens control algorithm to detect lateral motion in the motion picture and adjust the lenses accordingly. The 3-D Phenomenoscope can be used to view any motion picture with sustained lateral motion, including classic films and modern blockbusters.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to the dicing of semiconductor devices, specifically an apparatus and method for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer. Current methods using a dicing machine are slow, require maintenance, and can damage the wafer. The new method involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to cause a "clean break" and singulate the individual die. The process starts with fabricating circuitry and metallization on the wafer, followed by applying a photo resist layer and patterning it to form openings over the scribe lines. The wafer then undergoes an etch to form trenches along the scribe lines, and an adhesive tape is applied to the back surface of the wafer. The wafer is then placed on a soft pad, and mechanical pressure is applied to the back surface to cause the wafer to break along the trenches and singulate the die. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion around the wafer. A ring can be used to hold the wafer in place during singulation. The method can be used for any size wafer or type of die, and the trenches can be formed by etching or partially cutting the wafer using a wafer saw. The invention provides a faster and more efficient way to dice semiconductor wafers without damaging the die.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure that prevents burn-out damage to field emission elements. The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects the discharge path of ionized gases away from the cathode. The reduction plate is typically provided on the cathode and is electrically connected to a bias voltage source that applies a negative voltage. The negative voltage attracts positive nitrogen and oxygen ions, preventing them from contacting the cathode and inducing surging electrical currents. The protection structure can include multiple reduction plates or electrodes that are elongated and run parallel to rows of field emission elements. Alternatively, the reduction plates can be arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements. The invention provides a novel field emission display device with a protection structure that substantially prolongs the lifetime of the field emission elements. The protection structure can be fabricated using conventional deposition and photolithography techniques. The invention is directed to a field emission display device that includes a structure for deflecting the discharge path of gas ions away from a cathode, thereby preventing surges in electrical current and burnout damage to field emission elements.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes, allowing it to image in a plurality of planes simultaneously. The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate with a highly doped bottom layer and a more lightly doped upper layer, where image sensor elements are formed in the upper layer. The image sensor elements include an image sensing region and a charge collecting and transfer means, and are arranged in columns along the length of the sensor. The sensor has imaging planes on the top surface and on two edge surfaces, and uses doped layers to create a waveguide-like structure that guides charge carriers towards the charge collecting and transfer means. This allows the sensor to detect images through the edges, making it suitable for various applications such as simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or surface imaging of passageways. The invention can be easily incorporated into various types of known image sensors and can be used for color applications, such as scanning a color document in a single pass.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to home networks employing devices with power management systems, where a network master node can transfer its administrative functions to a network slave node before entering a power management state, minimizing total power consumption while ensuring network performance. The network master node selects a suitable network slave node based on predetermined criteria, such as visibility, intelligence, or functional capabilities, and transfers the administrative functions to the selected node, which then becomes the new network master node.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. A unique equi-spaced triplet arrangement of similar antenna elements was previously identified, which could determine a function of elevation angle independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient. This invention extends these ideas to optimize angle measurements using the triplet itself, particularly at low elevation angles. The invention comprises at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with radio receiver means and logic means to combine and process the information signals. The array may operate in receive or transmit mode, with the transmitted signal from each antenna coded to enable angle measurement in a remote receiver. A practical embodiment of the antenna array is described, with seven antenna elements deployed as three triplets, optimized for angle measurements up to 7 degrees. The design aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements with high accuracy and resolution, using the smallest number of antenna elements possible. The invention has various applications, including monitoring the height of aircraft approaching to land and measuring the elevation angle of emitting or reflecting objects.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to high-intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, particularly subminiature lamps, with a liquid-tight seal. Conventional subminiature lamps have a glass envelope supported by a metal base, but the adhesive used to secure the envelope can break down due to thermal cycling, causing the lamp to fail. The invention uses a high-temperature polymer, such as a fluoroelastomer, to directly surround and seal the glass envelope, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The polymeric seal support can be molded to fit the glass envelope and the metal base, and can be used with a potting material to further protect the leads and prevent moisture from entering the lamp. The seal supported lamp assembly has a longer seal length than conventional "o" ring seals, and only requires one surface to make a seal, reducing the risk of degradation and failure. The invention can be applied to various situations where insulation, high heat degradation resistance, solvent and chemical resistance, and positive effective sealing are required.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) communications systems, specifically to precoder configuration in MIMO systems. A Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder provides the optimal capacity solution for Multi-user Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MU-MIMO) wireless systems, but its computational cost is often prohibitive. The invention provides a technique to realize a GDFE Precoder that significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss. The technique is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including 4G cellular networks. The invention also provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder and does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (Sxx) for downlink channel is rank deficient. The invention includes methods for computing matrices B, G, and F, which are used in the GDFE Precoder. The methods include using the QR decomposition of a filter matrix C to compute the matrices B, G, and F.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, specifically an axial fan with an increased intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements. The conventional fan has a rectangular fan housing with a restricted air passage, which limits the airflow rate and heat-dissipating performance. The invention provides a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, where the sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying the assembling conditions. The shape of the housing at the air outlet side remains unchanged to enhance the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan. The fan may be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions. The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing for receiving the impeller, where the housing includes a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening. The sidewall of the passage at least one of the opening sides extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake/discharge area for the air streams. The invention provides a heat-dissipating system including a casing, at least one electrical element, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat generated from the electrical element.
</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors according to the situation, without using an intermediate electrode. The display panel is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first luminescent layer that emits light with no visible red components and a second luminescent layer that emits light with visible red components. By changing the driving voltage, the display panel can change the display color, and the color purity can also be changed by selecting the width of the second luminescent layer or the thickness of the second luminescent layer. The display panel can be used as an instrument panel for an automobile, displaying images in green at night and in a lemon color with high luminance during the day.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal comprises audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means, allowing for wireless near field communication with a connecting unit that establishes a connection to a network and/or the Internet. The terminal can independently control and communicate data packets according to a standardized Internet/network protocol, making it possible to use simplified standardized equipment. The invention also relates to a system and method for Internet/network telephony, which provides a central service server that can handle and control the connection between a large number of users.
</summary>

<summary>
The integration of non-SiO2 based oxides directly or indirectly on Si is difficult due to the strong reactivity of Si with oxygen, resulting in the formation of a low dielectric constant layer. A Ge buffer layer on Si can prevent or minimize the formation of this layer, allowing for the epitaxial growth of high-dielectric constant oxides. The Ge buffer layer is compatible with Si process technology and can be used to form three-dimensional epitaxial structures. However, not all oxides are stable next to Ge, and a thin layer of SrTiO3 or other stable ferroelectric can be used as a buffer layer between the Pb-containing ferroelectric and the Ge-coated Si substrate. The use of a Ge buffer layer and a non-Pb/Bi high-dielectric oxide containing buffer layer can solve the problem of Pb/Bi diffusion and allow for the fabrication of high-dielectric constant oxide films on Si or GaAs substrates. This technology can be used to create non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory cells, high-density capacitors, and other semiconductor devices.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a receiver input circuit that aims to eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components, ensuring adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit comprises a control loop for amplification control, with a control signal derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage. A second amplification control loop is added, whose control signal is taken out prior to the mixer stage, and a third amplification control loop with a lower response threshold and frequency band width. The circuit uses PIN diodes for controllable signal attenuation, and the control signal is processed in a control signal processing circuit. The input network can be extended to include additional reactances and PIN diodes, allowing for greater control range and selectivity. The tunable network can be aligned iteration-free, and a single twin diode can be used to form the resonant circuits. The circuit provides protection against signal overloading, high-voltage discharge surges, and distortion-forming circuit components.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties to a telephone call, without complex and time-consuming setup processes. The system includes a collaboration button and an indicator on each party's telephone set, which signals the user that the party has the capability of collaborating with the user. When the indicator is illuminated, the system is capable of establishing a work-share environment. The collaboration control program runs on each PC associated with a telephone and has the capability of communicating over the LAN with the phone to control the collaborate indicator and sense actuation of the collaborate button. The program also has the ability to communicate with the collaboration control programs of remote PCs via the LAN. The system determines whether the parties share a collaboration application program in common and illuminates the collaborate indicator accordingly. If the parties decide to collaborate, they can initiate the collaboration by pushing the collaboration button, which launches the collaboration application program. The system can be implemented in various architectures, including peer-to-peer and client-server, and can be used for multiparty collaboration. The invention can be implemented by remote computers connected over a network and can be integrated within a computer with a microphone input and keyboard. The present invention encompasses a computer program and any form of carrier medium that can carry the computer program.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and device for inserting advertising clips into a video sequence to optimize visual impact. The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and advertising clips, determining the degree of similarity between the maps, and selecting the clip with the highest degree of similarity to insert at a shot change in the video sequence. The salience maps represent the regions of interest in the video sequence and advertising clips, and the degree of similarity is calculated based on the correlation between the maps. The method can be implemented using various algorithms, including correlation coefficient and Kullback-Leibler divergence. The device for processing pictures comprises a processing unit, memory, and input/output interface, and can be used to detect shot changes and insert advertising clips at predefined points in the video sequence. The invention aims to improve the visual impact of advertising clips by ensuring continuity between the regions of interest in the video sequence and the advertising clip.</summary>

<summary>This invention relates to the use of a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections with resulting lower electrical breakdown in very small dimension semiconductor devices. The recessed mask structure achieves a lower and predictable overall capacitance, resulting in faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring, and is particularly useful in damascene type device structures with fine metal features and low dielectric constant insulators.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a Downconverting Digitizer that uses digital signal processing techniques to convert a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to a digital representation of the baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components. The Downconverting Digitizer achieves this through three processes: conversion of the modulated IF signal to a digital representation, downconversion of the modulated IF signal to a digital representation of the baseband I and Q components, and automatic control of the processed modulated IF signal amplitude to extend the dynamic range of the digitization process and minimize quantization noise. The invention utilizes a predictive loop that generates a prediction of the input signal, and the predictive filter is implemented using digital signal processing techniques, allowing for flexibility in reprogramming the predictive filter characteristics. The Downconverting Digitizer also includes an automatic gain control (AGC) loop and an offset nuller element to further enhance its performance. The invention was implemented and verified as part of a wireless telephone receiver and achieved a dynamic range of more than 52 dB without the effect of the AGC loop, and more than 124 dB with the AGC loop.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically to apparatus and method for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms or gas molecules. The invention uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as a sensor or for multiplex detection of analytes. The semiconducting nanotraces are fabricated using a top-down approach without the use of expensive stepper aligner tools, and the dimensions of each nanotrace are critical for increasing the response sensitivity. The invention also provides a method for synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the active semiconductor nanotraces using PhotoGenerated Reagent (PGR). The multiplex detection array is packaged onto an electronics board, and the detection of target molecules is achieved by measuring the change in source-drain electrical current. The invention can be used for various applications, including diagnostic tests for virulent pathogens, detection of specific sequences, and detection of target molecules in solution.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a singulation and plating method for semiconductor packages, where the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe are plated to prevent contamination. The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material. The plating material is a different material than the leads, and can be a metallic material such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold. The singulation process can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting, and the cutting blades can have different shapes and thicknesses to achieve various cutting shapes and heights. The invention also provides a singulated semiconductor package with a leadframe having a die attach pad and a plurality of leads, where the side surfaces of the leads are plated with a plating material. The side surfaces of the semiconductor package can have a step or a beveled surface, depending on the cutting process used.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that selectively connects to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN). The mobile terminal has two wireless modules, a GSM module for connecting to the WWAN and a WiFi module for connecting to the WLAN. When the signal level of the WLAN is low, the mobile terminal turns on the GSM module and uses service information from the WLAN to select a serving base station for connecting to the WWAN. The service information includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of the neighboring base stations. The mobile terminal can skip some initial scanning procedures by using the service information, accelerating the connecting process. If the mobile terminal fails to connect to the serving base station, it can scan the frequency channels using the service information or start an all channels scanning procedure. The invention provides a method for the mobile terminal to switch from the WLAN to the WWAN in time, avoiding dropped or delayed connections. The mobile terminal can use this invention to switch from the WLAN to the WWAN regardless of its status, such as during a call setup, idle, or calling status.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a new process for producing multilayered electrical components, such as capacitors, coils, and resistors, by eliminating labor-intensive steps and reducing production costs. The process involves depositing electrodes and electrical components onto decals, which are then stacked and fired to form the final assembly. This method allows for the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and a variety of shapes and configurations. The invention also enables the provision of a line of capacitors adapted to use with semi-conductor devices and can be applied to other electronic ceramic devices, such as multilayer ferrite inductors and substrates. The process offers several advantages, including reduced labor content, elimination of cutting stress cracks, and enhanced in-process inspection.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to hierarchical lattice structures comprising unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength, which can be used in various applications such as sandwich panels, impact or blast load mitigation, and thermal transfer. The lattice structures can be manufactured through various methods, including injection molding, investment casting, and metal textile lay-up techniques, and can be used in a wide range of fields, including transportation, construction, and armor.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, integrating an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility with a coal-to-liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility. The process uses a combination of dry and wet gasification technologies to produce intermediate streams suited for hydrocarbon synthesis and power production. The IGCC facility generates power from combustion gas produced by wet gasification, while the CTL facility produces hydrocarbons from synthesis gas precursor produced by dry gasification. The facilities share an air separation unit, utilities, and fuel gas, resulting in improved plant energy efficiency, economy of scale, and reduced costs. The integration also allows for CO2 sequestration by capturing CO2 from the off-gas of the IGCC facility and combining it with CO2 produced by the CTL facility. The overall process enhances energy efficiency, reduces costs, and provides environmental benefits.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, with a focus on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface. Oxide superconducting materials have been found to deteriorate at the surface due to the easy removal of oxygen, resulting in a decrease in reliability. To address this issue, a blocking film or passivation film is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent oxygen removal. The film is formed using a photo CVD method, which provides superior stepped coverage, and is typically 10 Å to 2μm thick. The film can be made of insulating materials such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized metals, and can be used to create a Josephson element structure or as a passivation film. After film formation, oxygen is added to the surface or portion close to the surface, and the entire body is heat-treated to position the added oxygen in the appropriate atom location. This process results in a highly reliable device with no oxygen deficiency in the surface portion. The invention provides a method for effectively utilizing the superconductive state of the surface of an oxide superconducting material with long-term stability.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, particularly for quality control in the manufacture of foam sheet stock used in various applications. The apparatus allows for the precise measurement and preparation of laboratory foam sheet cross-sectional specimens. It is designed to grasp a foam sheet sample and make linearly oriented parallel cuts, with a screw thread specimen advance mechanism enabling the preparation of repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges. The apparatus consists of a base structure, a clamping arrangement, and a planar surface for interaction with a cutting knife. The device employs a hand nut with a detent mechanism to secure it in place, allowing for precise control over the cutting process. The apparatus enables the preparation of foam samples with precisely cut surfaces, preserving the structure of individual cells for microscopic examination. This allows for the evaluation of foam materials' properties, such as cell size, shape, and orientation, which is essential for quality control and performance criteria establishment.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to seismometers, specifically ocean bottom seismometers (OBS), and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination and leveling seismic motion detectors. The device uses a pendulum action to align the detectors with respect to the vertical, and a plunger is used to lock the detectors in place. The plunger is activated by a solenoid, which is controlled by an electrical signal, and the angle of inclination can be determined by measuring the acute angle between the detector and a vertical surface. The invention provides good acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the detector, and can be used to level one or more seismic motion detectors. The device is simple, inexpensive, and can be easily used with existing seismometer designs. The invention also provides a means for preserving the orientation of the seismometer, allowing for later measurement of the angle of inclination.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is a relative humidity sensing element that can be energized by low voltage microscopic currents from solid state electronic instrumentation, is physically sturdy, and requires no special physical protection. The sensing element consists of a first electron conductive electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material deposited in the interstices of the porosity of the dielectric, and a second electron conductive electrode pervious to moisture vapor. The impedance between the electrodes varies generally linearly with relation to the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere when excited by a suitable alternating current voltage. The preferred method of manufacturing the humidity element includes forming the first electrode from commercially pure aluminum, anodizing the aluminum to form the dielectric coating, and vacuum depositing nickel onto the sealed anodized coating to form the second electrode. The sensor has a response time of about one second and is suitable for use in a range of temperatures and humidities, such as those found in typical textile mills.</summary>

<summary>The present invention relates to a motor assembly, specifically a force transmission structure, that improves upon conventional designs by reducing vibration and noise. The force transmission structure comprises a drive plate with a mounting hole and a shaft with a toothed portion that fits into the mounting hole, allowing the shaft to rotate stably and quietly. The drive plate and shaft are designed to withstand greater torque and reduce noise, with features such as buffer holes and a circlip to prevent the toothed portion from escaping.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver, particularly in third-generation (3G) wireless communication systems. The system uses a high-frequency oscillator and a low-frequency oscillator to generate and maintain a mobile time reference, which is constantly running and has an accuracy of approximately 32 nanoseconds. The mobile time reference is generated using the high-frequency clock and maintained using the low-frequency clock when the high-frequency clock is not available. The system also includes a free-running counter that operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz or 32 KHz, depending on whether the portable transceiver is in active or idle mode. The invention provides a wideband spread spectrum multipath signal detector, identification mechanism, and multipath monitoring technique that monitors signal strength from multiple asynchronous transmitters within a network.</summary>

<summary> The invention is an individually fitted helmet liner that can be rapidly and simply fitted to a wearer's head, and can also be refitted to accommodate a changed head size. The liner consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with open and unfilled pockets, which are arranged in a superposed contacting relationship and can be deformed to fit the wearer's head. The liner is heated to a plastic state, placed between the outer shell and the wearer's head, and then cooled to a rigid state to retain its shape. The invention provides a helmet liner that is simple and inexpensive to manufacture, resists shifting on the wearer's head, and does not require trimming or drawstrings during fitting. </summary>

<summary>The invention is a multiorifice wafer structure with angularly disposed passages, made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members, and is particularly suited for use in automotive fuel injector valves to atomize fuel.
