<summary> The discussion centered around schools causing concern, with Huw Irranca-Davies questioning the Minister for Education, Kirsty Williams, on how schools are identified as needing support and how the categorization system works. Williams acknowledged that the system has evolved over time and that there are still challenges in identifying schools that need support early enough, particularly in secondary schools. The Minister also discussed the introduction of a new pilot approach to supporting schools that are causing concern, which involves a multi-agency panel working with the school to address underlying issues and achieve sustainable improvement. </summary>

<summary>

The Children, Young People and Education Committee met to discuss school improvement and raising standards in Wales. Minister Kirsty Williams stated that the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) is still involved in the Welsh Government's school improvement journey and will publish a report on Welsh education in March. The national evaluation and improvement resource is being developed to help schools evaluate their strengths and weaknesses, and a new approach is being piloted to support schools that are causing concern. The approach involves a multi-agency panel, including the school, local authority, regional consortia, Estyn, and Welsh Government, working together to support improvement. The Minister acknowledged that the current system of categorizing schools has its limitations and is not always effective in identifying schools that need support. The regional consortia have evolved over time, and the Minister believes that they are essential for delivering school improvement services. The Minister also stated that the pupil development grant has made a difference in closing the attainment gap, but more needs to be done to support disadvantaged learners. The Minister acknowledged that the attainment gap persists, particularly for minority ethnic learners, and committed to maintaining a ring-fenced grant to support their education.

</summary>

<summary>

Kirsty Williams, the Minister for Education, discussed the Welsh Government's school improvement journey with the Children, Young People and Education Committee. The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) has been involved in reviewing the Welsh education system, and their latest report is expected to be published in March. The national evaluation and improvement resource is being developed to support schools in self-evaluation, and it is expected to be introduced across the system in September 2020. The school categorisation system has evolved over time, and it is now used as a triage system to identify schools that need support. The Minister acknowledged that the system is not perfect and that there are still challenges in identifying schools that need support early enough. A new pilot approach is being introduced to support schools that are causing concern, which involves a multi-agency panel working with the school to address its challenges. The Minister also discussed the role of the regional consortia in school improvement, and she acknowledged that there are variations in their performance. The Welsh Government is working to develop a broader range of data and statistics to evaluate the education system, and it is also exploring ways to measure the impact of schools on children's well-being. The Minister acknowledged that closing the attainment gap between pupils who are eligible for free school meals and those who are not remains a challenge, despite significant investment in the pupil development grant.

</summary>

<summary>The Minister for Education, Kirsty Williams, discussed various topics related to education in Wales, including the involvement of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) in the country's school improvement journey, the use of powers under the School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013, and the national evaluation and improvement resource. The Minister also addressed concerns about the attainment gap between pupils eligible for free school meals and those who are not, and the performance of minority ethnic learners, acknowledging that despite progress, there is still more work to be done to address these issues.</summary>

<summary>

The Children, Young People and Education Committee met to discuss school improvement and raising standards in Wales. Minister Kirsty Williams and Director of Education Steve Davies attended the meeting. The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) is involved in the Welsh Government's school improvement journey and will publish a report on Welsh education in March. The national evaluation and improvement resource is a new approach to self-evaluation, developed in conjunction with the OECD, middle tier, and practitioners. The resource is currently being tested and will be introduced across the system in September 2020. The Minister believes that the investment in school standards has been effective, with 50% of the funding directed towards professional learning. The categorisation system has evolved over time and is used to identify schools that need support, but the Minister acknowledges that it is not perfect and will continue to evolve. The Minister is not content with the current level of schools in the red category, particularly in the secondary sector, and has introduced a new pilot to address this issue. The Minister believes that the performance measures have changed for good reasons, but acknowledges that it makes it more challenging to look at trends over time. The Minister is committed to closing the attainment gap between pupils who are eligible for free school meals and those who are not, and will continue to focus resources on this issue.

</summary>

The scene opens with a black screen and a shot of the Berlin skyline at night, where a janitor is mopping the floor while listening to music, and two men walk by, speaking in German. The janitor is revealed to be a spy, and he reports to his team that the two men are in the elevator. The team activates a device that causes the elevator to plummet, and the men are abducted by a helicopter. The scene cuts to Sydney, who is trying to adjust to her new life after being presumed dead for two years. She meets with her father, Jack, who tells her that she may have been brainwashed and that her memories may be false. Sydney also meets with Vaughn, who is now a French teacher, and they have an emotional conversation about their past. The CIA receives a message from a group called the Covenant, who are demanding the release of a terrorist named Sark in exchange for the safe return of two abducted agents. Sydney and Weiss are sent to Mexico to make the exchange, but it is ambushed by Delta Force, and Sark escapes. The scene cuts to Frankfurt, where Sydney goes undercover to gather information about the Covenant and rescue the remaining hostage.

</summary>

<summary>

FBI Agent Seeley Booth and Dr. Temperance Brennan are forced to see a therapist, Dr. Sweets, due to their partnership being considered for severance by the FBI. Their first case with Dr. Sweets is the murder of Franklin Curtis, a wealthy organic supermarket chain owner, whose body was found cooked and dumped in a secluded area. As they investigate, they discover that Curtis was having an affair with a woman named Emma Billings, who was also murdered. The investigation leads them to a composting facility, where they find the body of Emma Billings and discover that she and Curtis were related. They initially suspect Charlie Rogan, a young man who worked at the facility, but later discover that the killer was actually Kat Curtis, Franklin's daughter, who was trying to protect her mother's interests. Kat had killed Emma in a fit of rage and then, with Charlie's help, disposed of her body and later killed her father when he discovered what she had done. In the end, Booth and Brennan's partnership is allowed to continue, but Dr. Sweets notes that they have underlying emotional issues that need to be addressed. Despite this, Booth and Brennan insist that their relationship is purely professional.

</summary>

<summary>

Prue stands up a guy named Sean at P3, and Piper tries to cover for her. Meanwhile, Prue becomes increasingly obsessed with finding the triad, a group of demons that sent a demon back in time to kill the Charmed Ones. The sisters' house is broken into, and all the mirrors are smashed. Prue sets a trap for the demon, but it ends up catching Cole, who is injured. The sisters later discover that the demon's name is Troxa, and he is working for the triad. Troxa reveals that another demon, Belthazor, is also after the Charmed Ones. Prue is later kidnapped by Abbey, the bartender at P3, who is obsessed with Prue and wants to be her. Phoebe and Piper discover Abbey's true intentions and save Prue. In the end, Prue apologizes to Sean and they share a dance, while Phoebe kisses Cole, and Piper and Leo finally have a romantic moment together.

</summary>

<summary>Cole is struggling with the Source's power inside him, and the Seer is trying to manipulate him into accepting his destiny as the Source. Meanwhile, Phoebe casts a spell to hear her heart's desire, which brings her past and future selves into the present. The past Phoebe is a 10-year-old girl who is scared and confused, while the future Phoebe is a bitter old woman who is reluctant to share information about Cole. The Charmed Ones soon discover that a powerful demon named Kurzon is trying to kill them, and they work together to vanquish him. In the process, Cole's true loyalties are tested, and Phoebe's future self is killed by Kurzon. However, before she dies, the future Phoebe reveals to Phoebe that she should not marry Cole, but Phoebe decides to go through with the wedding anyway. The episode ends with Phoebe and Cole reaffirming their love for each other, but the Seer is shown to be watching them, hinting that there may be trouble ahead.</summary>

<summary>

Terri is nervous about the school dance, feeling self-conscious about her weight and worried that no one will want to dance with her. Her friend Ashley tries to convince her to attend, offering to help her get ready and boost her confidence. Meanwhile, a new student named Sean Cameron transfers to Degrassi and catches the eye of Emma. Toby and JT try to find ways to entertain themselves at home, eventually getting caught by Toby's parents while looking at explicit websites. At the dance, Terri gets drunk with the help of Paige and makes a scene, eventually vomiting in the bathroom. Spinner, who had been dancing with Terri, ends up dancing with Paige instead. The next day, Emma talks to her friends about asking Sean to dance, while Toby and JT are teased for getting caught looking at explicit websites. Terri is mortified about her behavior at the dance and feels embarrassed in front of Spinner, who returns her notes and starts spending time with Paige. Ashley tries to reassure Terri that things will work out, but Terri is clearly disappointed. In the end, Terri is left looking sad as Spinner and Paige walk away together.

</summary>

<summary>Ross and Rachel's secret marriage is revealed, and they try to get an annulment, but the judge denies their request, and they must file for divorce instead. Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler babysit Frank and Alice's triplets, with chaotic results, especially when Phoebe is left alone with the babies. Monica's apartment is left in disarray, but Phoebe successfully takes care of the triplets. Ross and Rachel eventually sign their divorce papers, and Rachel reveals that she was the one who suggested getting married in Vegas. In the end, Joey's Porsche ruse is exposed when a group of people playing street football accidentally collapses the car cover, revealing a pile of boxes underneath.</summary>

<summary>Frasier develops feelings for his boss Kate, but struggles to express them, especially after learning she is leaving for Chicago. In the end, Frasier is left alone, but finds an unexpected companion in Kate's cat, Louie.</summary>

The ZBZ girls hold a séance and discover that Virginia's spirit is trying to communicate with them, leading them to reenact the election that Virginia lost. The episode ends with Cappie reflecting on his encounter with Patty and the ZBZ girls redecorating the house with a newfound appreciation for Virginia's memory.

<summary> Amy Fleming works with a skittish horse named Dash, while Ty Borden deals with the aftermath of a run-in with poachers and ultimately gets his old job back at the clinic. The narrator, Ted, tells his children the story of how he got beat up by a girl named Natalie, who he dated and broke up with twice. The story begins with Ted wearing a shirt he hadn't worn in six years and realizing his tastes have changed. He starts thinking about past relationships and considers reconnecting with Natalie, whom he broke up with three years prior. Ted reaches out to Natalie and they start dating again, but he soon realizes he's not feeling the same way and decides to break up with her. Despite knowing it's her birthday, Ted tells Natalie the truth - that she's not the one for him - and she reacts angrily, using her Krav Maga skills to kick him. Ted's friends are proud of him for being honest, but he's left feeling hurt and regretful. The story ends with Ted reflecting on the experience and realizing that sometimes things don't work out, but it can lead to better things for the other person. Natalie goes on to get married and have three children, and Ted learns a valuable lesson about honesty and relationships. The story is a cautionary tale about the pain of breaking up and the importance of being honest, even if it's difficult.

</summary>

Sheldon explains that he uses the room to recharge and turn his mind off, but refuses to reveal what he does in there. In the end, it is shown that Sheldon is actually playing keepie-uppie with a beanbag in the room, trying to reach 43 consecutive kicks.</summary>

<summary> The episode revolves around the funeral of Sheriff Elizabeth Forbes, Caroline's mother, where Damon delivers a heartfelt eulogy. <summary>Veronica Mars is hired by Mindy O'Dell to investigate the death of her husband, Dean O'Dell, who was found dead in his office with a bullet wound to the head. Veronica also reunites with her ex-boyfriend Logan, and they share a passionate kiss. Liza reveals to Adam that she kissed Tad, which may be what Jamie was referring to earlier. Erica and Jack have a heated argument about Chris and their past relationship, with Jack warning Erica that Chris is not the man she thinks he is. </summary>

<summary>David Hayward is trying to gain custody of his grandson, Little A, while also dealing with his wife Krystal's hospitalization and his own conflicts with the police and the Chandler family. Meanwhile, Kendall Slater is struggling with her feelings for her husband Zach and her friend Ryan, who is still grieving the loss of his wife Greenlee, and Zach has filed for divorce, leading to a confrontation between Zach and Ryan.</summary>

<summary>
Kendall's relationship with Ethan is put to the test as Erica tries to convince her that Ethan is lying about Zach Slater's guilt in Edmund's murder. Meanwhile, Lily reveals that she saw Braden Lavery kill Edmund, not Zach. Greenlee informs Kendall that Lily identified Braden as the killer, but Kendall refuses to believe it. Ethan proposes to Kendall and asks for Erica's blessing, but she refuses. Zach Slater hires a new lawyer, Livia, to help him prove his innocence. Ryan confronts his former teacher, Mr. Hewlett, about not reporting the abuse he and his brothers suffered at the hands of their father. Jack and Reggie try to protect Lily from Braden, who is still on the loose. Kendall becomes increasingly isolated from her family and friends as she continues to defend Ethan and deny the truth about Zach's innocence.</summary>

<summary> Adam Chandler returns to Pine Valley and reunites with Erica, but his health is a concern and he's wanted by the police for kidnapping his own grandson. Annie Lavery becomes upset when Aidan Devane tells her that her friend Tori doesn't exist, but later Annie remembers that Tori was a friend from her childhood who she thinks she killed. Ian Slater undergoes successful heart surgery, and his parents Kendall and Zach are relieved. Meanwhile, Colby Chandler searches for her missing father Adam with the help of Pete Cortlandt. David Hayward is determined to find Adam and have him arrested, and he's furious that he wasn't informed about Adam's car being found. Reese Williams visits the hospital to check on Ian, but her presence causes tension with Kendall and Ryan. </summary>

<summary> Erica Kane is working on a new reality show and has teamed up with Carmen Morales, who was released from prison, to star in the show and help Erica find Louisa and Armando. Meanwhile, Greenlee is trying to help Ryan regain his memory, but he tells her to go back to Aidan and be happy. Aidan, who had proposed to Greenlee earlier, is dealing with the aftermath of her rejection and his own drunken confession to Annie about his feelings of guilt. Erica's plan for the reality show involves Louisa and Armando, who are in trouble for a bank robbery, and she promises them protection and anonymity in exchange for their participation. </summary>

<summary> Ryan and Annie discuss their marriage and the possibility of divorce, with Ryan asking Annie to hold off on filing due to his uncertainty about the future. Meanwhile, Greenlee seeks Zach's help in winning back Aidan's heart, and Zach eventually agrees to support her. Erica visits Carmen in prison and vows to do everything in her power to get her out, despite the odds being against them. Jesse shares stories about his friend Jenny with her namesake, Jenny Jr., and reflects on the power of love and its ability to transcend even death. </summary>

<summary>Angie and Jesse's wedding day turns deadly when Robert Gardner, Tad's uncle, takes Angie hostage and starts shooting, injuring Tad and Julia. Meanwhile, Greenlee discovers that her fiancé Aidan had an affair with her best friend Kendall, leading to a confrontation and Greenlee's heartbreak. Julia's injuries are severe, and she refuses surgery, knowing she will die anyway, and instead focuses on making arrangements for her daughter Kathy's future. Jesse and Angie manage to escape from Robert, and Jesse resists the urge to kill him, instead choosing to let him face justice. As the episode ends, Julia passes away, and Tad's life hangs in the balance, while Greenlee turns to Zach for comfort and support.</summary>

<summary>Kendall confronts Ricky, who confesses to killing Zach and Diana Holden, and Griffin arrives to save Kendall, but is arrested by Jesse despite his heroism. Meanwhile, Bianca and Marissa are rescued from Ricky's closet, and Erica, who is being held captive by Jane, tries to convince her captor to release her. Griffin's sister Cara is overjoyed to learn that her brother is alive and has been working to clear his name, and Kendall vows to help Griffin get his life back on track.</summary>

<summary>Adam Chandler's revelation that Kathy is actually Kate, Tad Martin's long-lost daughter, sparks a chain of reactions among the characters, with Tad seeking answers and Adam trying to make amends for his past mistakes. Meanwhile, Ryan Lavery struggles to recall his memories of his wife Annie, and Greenlee Smythe tries to move on from her past with Ryan. Erica Kane, who is in prison, offers Adam advice on how to change his behavior and make amends for his wrongdoings.</summary>

<summary>Jamie is arrested for possession of drugs, but claims he was trying to take down a dealer who had been pushing to kids, and Babe begins to suspect that J.R. may be involved in her recent drugging incident. Meanwhile, Kendall tries to manipulate Bobby into seducing Greenlee in order to break up her marriage to Ryan, and David tries to make amends with Krystal and learn how to be a good father to Babe.</summary>

<summary> Annie is excitedly planning her wedding to Scott, but their plans are put on hold until her divorce from Adam Chandler is finalized. Meanwhile, Marissa is struggling with her marriage to J.R. and her recent failure of the bar exam, leading her mother Krystal to advise her to reevaluate her marriage. Greenlee helps Ryan's daughter Emma by re-embroidering a special message on a new dress, and later has a tense encounter with Madison, who warns her not to interfere with Ryan's new relationship. David accuses Ryan of trying to win Greenlee back, leading to a physical altercation that ends with Ryan collapsing to the ground. Caleb Cooney, a cousin of the Chandlers, is at odds with J.R. over the sale of Cortlandt Electronics, which he ultimately decides not to sell to J.R. Krystal and Caleb share a moment, discussing their past and their feelings about the people of Pine Valley. </summary>

<summary> The scene opens with Taylor visiting Dr. Franklin Hubbard at the hospital, but instead meets Dr. Jake Martin, who examines her foot and diagnoses her with plantar fasciitis. Meanwhile, J.R. discusses his plan to buy Fusion and have Babe run it with Krystal, who is supportive but also warns J.R. not to turn out like his father, Adam. At Fusion, Kendall and Greenlee return from their trip and clash with Babe, who feels undervalued and overworked. Annie quits her job after a heated argument with Kendall and Greenlee, and Amanda receives a mysterious package from Jake, inviting her to meet him at ConFusion wearing a pirate costume. Frankie confronts Fletcher, who is threatening Randi and demanding payment, and Frankie's father, the chief of police, is mentioned as a potential threat to Fletcher. </summary>

<summary> The scenes depict various characters navigating their relationships and personal struggles, including Jamie and Babe's complicated past, Greenlee's grief over Ryan's supposed death, and Julia's attempts to reconnect with her family. Meanwhile, Tad is trying to uncover information about Kevin Sturgess and his potential involvement in Julia's life, while Zach is searching for Di Kirby and her connection to Kevin. The characters' storylines intersect and overlap, revealing secrets, lies, and hidden agendas that threaten to upend their lives. </summary>

<summary>Colby is struggling to cope with the aftermath of a party where a man died, and Damon tries to comfort her. Meanwhile, Greenlee visits Ryan in jail and tries to convince him to plead guilty to a lesser charge, but he refuses. Kendall and Bianca discuss Ryan's situation and Greenlee's involvement in David's blackmailing scheme, and Greenlee eventually confesses to her role in framing Erica for embezzlement and her involvement in the plane crash that nearly killed Erica. The autopsy results reveal that David was poisoned, not killed in a fight as initially thought.</summary>

<summary>
J.R. is trying to find his missing mother, Dixie, and is getting frustrated with the lack of progress. Babe helps J.R. by talking to Alfred, a bank employee, who eventually agrees to give them Dixie's account information. Meanwhile, Tad and Aidan are investigating Dixie's disappearance and discover a lead that suggests she may have been seen with Garret Williams, Mimi's husband. Julia and Di are being held captive by Garret, who is trying to get a letter from Di that incriminates him. Greenlee visits Erin and they bond over their shared loss of Ryan, with Greenlee showing Erin mementos of Ryan's. Josh is skeptical of Babe's motives for helping J.R. and warns her that she's putting too much pressure on their child. Krystal is planning to divorce Adam and take half of his assets, which J.R. has inadvertently made possible by buying back Chandler Enterprises. Julia and Di are planning to work together to take down Garret when he returns.</summary>

<summary>
Bianca confronts her mother Erica about the letter Babe wrote, which J.R. claims says that Bess is Miranda, but Erica insists that the DNA test proves Bess is J.R.'s daughter. Meanwhile, Tad discusses the situation with Joe, revealing that the DNA test was fake and that Bess is actually Bianca's daughter Miranda. Greenlee tries to run Kendall down with her car, thinking that Kendall killed Ryan, but Jonathan intervenes and explains that Ryan is alive. Ryan tries to comfort Greenlee, who is struggling with her mental health. Ethan is in the hospital after trying to escape from custody, and Maria discovers that Zach did not bail him out because he wanted the charges against Ethan to be dismissed due to the presence of another shooter. Kendall meets with Livia, who has filed a motion to dismiss the charges against Ethan. Tad decides to find Jamie and tell him the truth about Bess, and Erica plans to buy a new space for her business, determined to beat Zach Slater at his own game. Ryan takes Greenlee to the hospital to get her help for her mental health issues.</summary>

<summary>The residents of Pine Valley gather for a charity fundraiser to help rebuild the community after a devastating tornado, but the evening takes a dark turn when Annie, Ryan's unstable ex-wife, shows up with a bloody knife and attempts to recreate their wedding ceremony. Meanwhile, Zach receives devastating news about his wife Kendall's condition and Erica auctions off a dance to the highest bidder, which David wins with a $50,000 bid. Taylor and Jake share a romantic dance, and Amanda and J.R. grow closer as they navigate their complicated feelings. Frankie struggles with accepting his new family members, Natalia and Rebecca, and Krystal's past with David threatens to ruin her evening with Tad. As the night comes to a close, Annie's actions become increasingly erratic and violent, leaving the guests in a state of panic.</summary>

<summary>
Kendall tries to explain to Greenlee why she carried Ryan's baby, but Greenlee is too hurt and angry to listen, and she ultimately decides to leave Ryan and start over on her own. Meanwhile, Erica is determined to take down Dr. Greg Madden, who she believes manipulated Kendall into carrying the baby, and she enlists Tad's help in investigating his past. Zach defends Kendall's actions to Jack, who is still struggling to understand why his daughter would do such a thing. Ryan tries to convince Greenlee to stay with him, but she is resolute in her decision to leave. Erin and Aidan have a tense encounter in the park, but they eventually begin to open up to each other. As the episode comes to a close, Greenlee is shown driving away from Pine Valley, while Ryan is left alone in their empty home, and Kendall is comforted by Zach in her condo.</summary>

<summary>Emily is accused of tormenting Rosanna and setting up Will, but she denies the allegations and offers to take a polygraph test to prove her innocence. Meanwhile, Lucy and Rafael are trapped in a mine, but they are eventually rescued by Dusty. However, their relief is short-lived as Dominic appears, threatening to harm them. Alison is torn between her loyalty to her sister Emily and her friendship with Will, who is convinced of Emily's guilt. Margo and Tom rekindle their romance, and they agree to communicate openly and honestly with each other. The episode ends with a cliffhanger as Dominic threatens to harm Lucy, Rafael, and Dusty.</summary>

<summary>Casey returns home after being released from jail and visits Gwen, Will, and their baby, Hallie. Meanwhile, Brad tries to convince Katie to take care of him while he recovers from his injury, and eventually confesses his love to her with the help of Vienna. Carly is dealing with her own family issues, including her son Parker's behavioral problems and her sister Rosanna's departure to a clinic in Switzerland. Jack and Carly meet with a therapist to discuss Parker's issues and how they can work together to help him. Barbara reveals to Lisa that she has cancer, and later visits Will and Gwen to meet her new granddaughter, Hallie. Casey starts working at his grandmother Lisa's diner, and Brad's attempts to win Katie over continue. Carly invites Sam to stay with her, and they bond over their shared experiences of loss and hardship.</summary>

<summary>

Casey Hughes is preparing for his wedding to Alison Stewart, but Alison is dealing with her own issues, including her encounter with Mick Dante, who claims to be under the control of James Stenbeck's spirit. Mick has escaped from the hospital and is being pursued by Paul, who is determined to stop him. Alison tries to convince Mick to turn himself in, but he refuses and instead asks her to run away with him. Meanwhile, Barbara is revealed to be working with Mick, who she believes is actually James Stenbeck, brought back to life through a youth serum. Henry Coleman discovers Barbara's involvement with Mick and tries to warn her that she is being scammed. Paul's wife Emily tries to stop him from seeking revenge against Mick, but he is determined to protect his family. Casey is unaware of the danger that Mick poses and is focused on his upcoming wedding. Alison returns to Casey, but is clearly distracted and troubled by her encounter with Mick. As the episode ends, Mick is shown to be struggling with his own identity, torn between his loyalty to James Stenbeck and his growing sense of self. The stage is set for a dramatic confrontation at Casey and Alison's wedding.

</summary>

<summary>On Valentine's Day, various characters in the story navigate their relationships and personal struggles, including Jennifer's lingering feelings for Paul, who is presumed dead but is actually alive and in hiding, and Holden and Lily's surprise pregnancy. Meanwhile, Will and Gwen are in hiding and receive help from Maddie, and Jack and Carly rekindle their romance. Paul's plan to reveal himself to Jennifer is put in jeopardy when Meg discovers his true intentions and warns him of the dangers of his actions.</summary>

<summary>
Mick Dante, a man programmed to think like James Stenbeck, takes hostages at Casey and Alison's wedding, including Casey, Alison, and several others. Mick forces the hostages to play a game of truth or dare, revealing secrets and lies, including Alison's infidelity with Mick. As the standoff continues, Margo, Casey's mother and a police officer, tries to negotiate with Mick, while Tom, Casey's father, tries to find a way to rescue the hostages. Meanwhile, Paul, who was shot by Mick, and Emily try to escape, and Henry and Barbara work together to try and stop Mick. Eventually, Alison tries to reason with Mick, and he begins to show signs of his true self, but Casey interrupts and Mick is shot by the police. The episode ends with Mick's fate uncertain, and Casey struggling to come to terms with Alison's infidelity.</summary>

<summary>Brad and Katie are trying to conceive a child through a surrogate, Vienna, with Henry's support, but Henry is struggling with his feelings about the situation. Meanwhile, Luke is dealing with his own issues, including a meeting with the Starglow foundation, where he stands up for his foundation's mission and values. Lucinda is recovering from radiation treatment and is grateful for a visit from Brian, who has come to support Luke and the foundation. The episode ends with Brad, Katie, Vienna, and Henry sharing a moment of hope and anticipation as they wait to see if the surrogacy is successful.</summary>

<summary>Jennifer is struggling to balance her work and personal life, particularly with her upcoming wedding and pregnancy, and her family is trying to offer their support. Meanwhile, Lily is moving on from her marriage to Holden and is starting to develop feelings for Keith, but Holden is suspicious of Keith's intentions and is trying to warn Lily. Will is dealing with the aftermath of Alison ending their friendship, and Casey is trying to navigate his relationships with Will and Celia. Margo and Tom are enjoying a night out at a dance, where they run into Lily and Keith, and Holden's concerns about Keith are revealed. The episode ends with a dramatic cliffhanger, as Keith is confronted by a man named Vin, and Lily screams for help as a gunshot is heard.</summary>

<summary>
Katie and Brad are thrilled to be having a baby, but their happiness is short-lived as Katie faints during a TV segment and is rushed to the hospital. The doctor diagnoses her with elevated blood pressure and orders her to bed rest for the remainder of her pregnancy. Brad and Vienna fill in for Katie on the TV show, and Kim offers Brad his old job back, with Vienna as his new co-host. Henry is unhappy about Vienna working with Brad, feeling that it's too much time spent with him. Meanwhile, Paul and Rosanna are on the run with Eliza, and Bonnie and Dusty are hot on their trail. Paul and Rosanna's car breaks down, and they are forced to seek help from a diner owner, who takes pity on them and offers them food and shelter. As the episode ends, Paul and Rosanna are resting at the diner, while Bonnie and Dusty are closing in on them.</summary>

<summary>
Bonnie returns to work after a few days away and is a month behind, while Dusty returns some items she left in his car, including a mysterious undergarment. Meg is enjoying having her daughter Eliza back and is considering giving Paul visitation rights. Paul is trying to make amends with Rosanna, who is staying with him at Fairwinds, and is offering to help her get her money back from Craig. Carly is struggling with her son Parker and is being pursued by Craig, who wants to help her. Rosanna is hesitant to trust Craig, but Carly believes he has changed. Paul is snooping into Craig's laptop and discovers some information. Meg is determined to give Paul a chance to be a part of Eliza's life, despite Dusty's objections. Bonnie is dealing with Derek's jealousy over her relationship with Dusty. Rosanna is considering forgiving Craig for his past wrongdoings, but is still wary of his intentions.</summary>

<summary>Carly and Jack's wedding ceremony takes place in Montana, surrounded by friends and family, and despite some tense moments, the couple exchanges vows and rings, with many offering words of love and support. Meanwhile, Holden, Dusty, and Margo search for Lily and Rose, who are trapped in a well, and eventually, Margo discovers their location with the help of Susan, and Brackett appears to have found Rose.</summary>

<summary>

Lily has a nightmare about Ethan being rescued from the hole, but it's revealed to be just a dream. Meanwhile, Paul is actually down in the hole with Ethan, and he's helping the rescue team get him out safely. Ethan is eventually rescued and taken to the hospital, where he's treated for dehydration and shock. However, he stops breathing at one point, but Dr. Chris saves his life. Meg is worried about Paul, who is still trapped in the hole, and James Stenbeck reveals himself to her, offering to save Paul's life in exchange for her unborn child. Meg is horrified, but James insists that he needs an heir to inherit the Stenbeck empire. As the rescue team tries to get Paul out of the hole, a tunnel is revealed, and Derek appears, claiming that James sent him to rescue Paul. However, the tunnel collapses, and Paul is presumed dead. The episode ends with Paul's angry voice, threatening to kill James, and a cliffhanger about Meg's fate.

</summary>

<summary>Janet is frantic when she discovers her daughter Liberty is missing, but Liberty is found safe at Paul and Emily's house, where she spent the night. Liberty decides to move in with Paul and Emily, who are adopting her baby, despite Janet's disapproval. Meanwhile, Adam's hearing is underway, but Maddie, a key witness, is late, and Adam's lawyer requests a recess. Maddie eventually testifies, explaining that she thought Adam was attacking Gwen, but later realized her mistake. The judge drops the charges against Adam, who is finally a free man. However, Casey had previously told Adam to leave town and never come back, and Adam decides to do so, leaving his family behind. Casey's girlfriend Alison is furious with him for manipulating the situation and using Maddie to get Adam to leave. The episode ends with Adam's family realizing he is gone and Casey's relationships with Alison and his family beginning to fray.</summary>

<summary>Carly's health is declining, and her son Parker is desperate to find a cure, while Rosanna is dealing with the consequences of lying under oath to protect Paul from Craig and Meg. Meanwhile, Colonel Mayer is trying to make amends with his son Noah and his partner Luke, and Craig is being blackmailed by Rosanna to get Meg pregnant to keep her away from Paul.</summary>

<summary>Carly Tenney is planning her wedding to Jack Snyder, despite her supposed terminal illness, and is determined to make it a special day for her family. Meanwhile, Chris Hughes is trying to convince his father, Bob, to support his research project, but Bob is hesitant due to concerns about the hospital's reputation. Jack's decision to marry Carly is met with disapproval from his friends and family, who are aware of his recent annulment from Katie and are concerned about Carly's motives.</summary>

<summary>Steffy and Wyatt finalize their divorce, with Wyatt getting his wedding band removed via laser treatment. Meanwhile, Liam is frustrated and feels abandoned by Steffy, who is late to meet him, and he decides to leave on his father's jet. However, Steffy arrives just in time to stop Liam from leaving, and they reunite, with Steffy revealing that her divorce from Wyatt is final. Quinn and Ridge discuss their secret encounter in San Francisco and agree to keep it hidden and move forward with a newfound understanding and respect for each other.</summary>

<summary>Stephanie discovers Rick and Steffy's secret relationship and tries to convince Rick to end it, warning him of the potential consequences and the fact that Ridge will never accept him as Steffy's partner. Meanwhile, Jackie reveals her new designer, "Madame X", who is actually Bridget in disguise, and Taylor is worried about Steffy's well-being after discovering her secret relationship with Rick.</summary>

<summary>

Nicole is getting ready for her wedding to Zende on Valentine's Day, with her mother Vivienne and friend Maya helping her prepare. Zende's parents, Kristen and Tony, arrive at the Forrester estate, where the wedding is being held. Eric Forrester welcomes the guests and shows off the decorations, including a special portrait of Nicole and Zende. Sally Spectra and her grandmother Shirley try to crash the wedding by posing as caterers, bringing a cake that Shirley had baked. Meanwhile, Julius, Nicole's father, arrives and is emotional about giving his daughter away. Nicole and Zende share a moment before the ceremony, with Nicole's sister Sasha wishing her well. The guests take their seats, and Carter, the officiant, begins the ceremony. As the "Wedding March" plays, Nicole walks down the aisle to meet Zende. The ceremony starts, with Carter welcoming everyone and expressing gratitude for the love between the couple. The scene is set for a romantic and joyful celebration of Nicole and Zende's love.

</summary>

<summary>
Wyatt is considering returning to Spencer Publications after his father, Bill, asked him to come back to work. However, Wyatt wants to revive Spectra Fashions, a company his father previously sabotaged, as a condition of his return. Wyatt's girlfriend, Sally, is hesitant about the idea due to her past issues with Bill. Meanwhile, Katie is dealing with the aftermath of her annulment from Thorne, who left her due to his unresolved feelings for his late wife and daughter. Bill checks in on Katie and their son, Will, and offers his support. Donna asks Katie if she still has feelings for Bill, but Katie insists she's moved on. Justin discusses Bill's efforts to reunite his family with Donna, who is proud of their son, Marcus. Wyatt tells Sally that he won't return to Spencer Publications unless she's a part of it, and Sally expresses her love and appreciation for Wyatt's support. Wyatt and Sally reaffirm their commitment to each other and their future together.</summary>

<summary>Hope and Liam discuss their situation with Steffy, who is using the six-month waiting period to try and win Liam back, while Hope is frustrated that they can't get married yet. Meanwhile, their families meet for dinner at Bikini, where Bill expresses his disapproval of Hope and Liam's relationship, citing Hope's inexperience and Liam's past marriage to Steffy. Hope and Liam share a romantic moment, and Liam suggests they run away and start their lives together, but Hope is hesitant.</summary>

<summary>
Nick is seeking an emergency custody hearing to determine the care of his son, Jack, due to concerns about Taylor's stability and drinking problem. Brooke, Jack's biological mother, supports Nick's decision, citing Taylor's emotional instability and history of alcoholism. Taylor, however, is determined to care for Jack and prove herself as a capable mother. Rick, Brooke's son, is supporting Taylor and helping her prepare for the custody hearing. Meanwhile, Ridge and Phoebe discuss Taylor's behavior and Phoebe expresses concern about her mother's well-being. Felicia visits Ridge to discuss their parents' upcoming anniversary and a plan to reunite them. Storm, Nick's attorney, agrees to represent him in the custody hearing and serves Taylor with the papers. Taylor is devastated by the news and calls Nick, accusing him of trying to take her baby away. Rick comforts Taylor and promises to support her in the custody battle. The custody hearing is set to take place the next morning, with Nick and Taylor both determined to fight for their rights as parents.</summary>

<summary>
Liam visits Steffy and their daughter Kelly, and they discuss how he's struggling with not being able to spend enough time with his daughter Beth, who is living with Hope. Meanwhile, Thomas reveals to Hope and their son Douglas that he's planning to marry Zoe soon, which upsets Douglas. Hope is concerned about the impact on Douglas and feels Thomas is rushing into the marriage. Steffy confronts Thomas about his motives, accusing him of trying to manipulate Hope into marrying him instead of Zoe. Thomas denies this, but Steffy is unconvinced, pointing out that he has a history of manipulating people to get what he wants. Liam talks to Hope and warns her that Thomas is trying to manipulate her into marrying him by using Douglas as leverage. Hope is torn between her concerns for Douglas and her skepticism of Thomas's motives. Steffy and Liam both believe that Thomas's true intention is to marry Hope, not Zoe.</summary>

<summary>
Ridge and Rick discuss a business deal, with Ridge trying to negotiate a lower price by pretending he's not interested. Rick accuses Ridge of manipulating him into leaving the family home. Caroline is having a girl's day at home when she goes into labor, and Thomas helps her until Ridge arrives. Ridge receives the news of Caroline's labor while in a meeting with Rick, who wishes him good luck. Eric is excited about the new baby and tries to mediate between Rick and Ridge, but Rick is still angry about being ousted from his job and home. Rick accuses Ridge of being a master manipulator and warns Eric that he will one day be in for a rude awakening. Caroline's labor progresses, and she is helped by her midwife and doula. Ridge is supportive and loving throughout the process, and Caroline reminds him of their vows. As Caroline gives birth, Ridge is by her side, and they welcome their new baby. The scene ends with Ridge and Caroline's joy and love for their new child.</summary>

<summary>
Steffy and Liam are preparing to leave for their wedding in Sydney, Australia, and are excited to have their friends and family joining them. Meanwhile, Sally is considering crashing the wedding after Thomas invited her as his date, despite Saul's disapproval. Sally eventually decides to book a cheap flight to Sydney, with her grandmother Shirley's encouragement. On the plane, the group is excited for the wedding and the trip, with Steffy and Liam looking forward to their special day. Brooke and Ridge are also on the plane, preparing to get married, and are surrounded by their loved ones. Bill is on the plane as well, but seems to be hiding something, as he's not wearing his usual necklace. As the plane takes off, the group is filled with excitement and anticipation for the adventures ahead.</summary>

<summary>
Katie is in the hospital with heart failure due to myocarditis, an inflammation of the heart muscle, and her family is worried about her condition. Her sister Brooke and husband Bill are trying to keep a secret about a car accident they were involved in, which led to Bill spending the night at Brooke's house and Katie finding out. Donna, Katie's sister, is suspicious of Brooke and Bill's story and thinks they may be responsible for Katie's condition. Taylor, Katie's doctor, is also suspicious and thinks that Brooke and Bill's relationship may be causing Katie stress. Bill had been drinking and driving, and Brooke hid him in her bedroom to avoid a scandal. Katie had been taking her antirejection drugs faithfully, but may have missed some doses due to stress and distraction. The family is trying to stay positive and hopeful that Katie will recover, but Taylor is determined to find out the truth about what happened.</summary>

<summary>Liam and Bill discuss Liam's upcoming fatherhood, with Bill offering words of wisdom and pride in Liam's growth. Meanwhile, Steffy runs into Hope at the office, and they have a tense but ultimately civil conversation about their complicated past and Steffy's pregnancy. Steffy gets stuck in traffic due to an accident on PCH and decides to wait it out rather than join Thomas and Oliver for surfing. Brooke reaches out to Bill's office but decides not to leave a message, and later confides in Eric about her emotional state. Hope reflects on her feelings towards Steffy and Liam, acknowledging her anger and hurt but also expressing a desire to move forward and find happiness for herself and those around her.</summary>

<summary>Beth Logan has made the decision to leave her family and return to Paris due to her struggles with memory loss and early signs of dementia, feeling she doesn't want to be a burden to her loved ones. However, her daughters Brooke, Katie, and Donna try to convince her to stay, offering their support and help in finding ways to cope with her condition. Ultimately, Beth is persuaded to stay with her family, choosing to face her fears and live in the present with the people she loves.</summary>

<summary>
Brooke and Nick are stuck on his boat in the fog, and they pass the time by fishing and cooking dinner together. Meanwhile, Deacon proposes to Macy, and she is hesitant but eventually warms up to the idea. Rick tries to warn Sally about Deacon's intentions, but Sally defends Deacon and Macy's relationship. Brooke and Nick bond over their shared sense of being lost and missing something in their lives. Brooke's phone dies, but she manages to call Rick to ask him to watch her daughter Hope until she returns. Nick and Brooke grow closer, but Nick makes it clear that he's not interested in being a rebound relationship for Brooke. Deacon reassures Macy that he's committed to their relationship and wants to build a life together. Macy and Deacon's relationship deepens, and they consider a future together.</summary>

<summary>Brooke Logan has decided to step down as the spokesmodel for her clothing line, Brooke's Bedroom, and has chosen her sister Donna to replace her. Donna is hesitant at first but eventually accepts the job with Brooke's guidance. Meanwhile, Bridget and Dante are dealing with their own issues as Bridget reveals she is not pregnant, despite their plans to start a family. Felicia, Dante's ex, tries to drive a wedge between Bridget and Dante, claiming that he will never be happy with Bridget. Ridge, Brooke's ex and the designer of Brooke's Bedroom, is struggling to come to terms with Brooke's decision and initially decides not to design for the line anymore. However, after a conversation with Donna, he agrees to continue designing the line, and the two share a moment of connection.</summary>

<summary>
Felicia confronts Nick about telling her mother that she has a drug habit, which Nick denies. Meanwhile, Eric and Stephanie discuss Felicia's possible drug problem, which Nick had previously mentioned to Stephanie. Ridge and Brooke prepare for a meeting at Forrester Creations, where Eric will decide whether to keep Ridge or Thorne as the head designer. Thorne and Darla are confident that Eric will choose Thorne, while Ridge is also confident that he will be chosen. At the meeting, Eric and Stephanie reveal that they have decided to keep Thorne as the head designer, citing that Ridge's behavior has been unacceptable. The decision is met with shock and anger from Ridge, who accuses Darla of being the reason for the decision. The meeting ends with Eric telling Ridge that he needs to apologize to Thorne and resolve their differences like adults.</summary>

<summary>Donna Logan's wedding to Thorne Forrester is called off when Thorne discovers that Donna's true intention is to marry him as an act of revenge against his mother, Stephanie. Thorne's realization comes after a conversation with Katie, Donna's sister, who reveals the truth about Donna's feelings. The failed wedding leads to a confrontation between Donna and Stephanie, with Donna vowing to one day exact her revenge on Stephanie.</summary>

<summary> Eric Forrester has awoken from his coma and is recovering at home with his family, who are keeping his wife Donna away due to her infidelity with her assistant Owen. Donna tries to explain the situation to Eric's family, but they are not interested in listening and instead want to protect Eric from her. Meanwhile, Taylor is struggling to care for her baby Jack and is worried that she will lose custody again if anyone finds out. Brooke tries to help Donna by talking to Ridge, but he is not willing to let Donna see Eric. Stephanie tells Donna to stay away from Eric and that he wants to be with her, but Donna is determined to win him back. Eric's family is trying to help him focus on his recovery and move on from Donna, but he is still hurting from her betrayal. </summary>

<summary> Deacon returns to see Hope and apologizes for leaving her on her wedding day, feeling responsible for her and Liam's failed marriage. Hope explains the events that led to their breakup, including Liam's misinterpretation of a letter Deacon left for her and his subsequent relationship with Steffy. Meanwhile, Bill is pushing Liam to move on from Hope and become a more ruthless businessman, while Katie tries to caution Bill against interfering in Liam's life. Thomas and Caroline discuss the latest Hope for the Future campaign, which features Thomas and Hope together, causing tension between them. Deacon promises to stick around and support Hope, who is still struggling to come to terms with her feelings for Liam. </summary>

<summary>
Thorne is surprised by his parents' reaction to his success, as they express their pride and love for him. Eric and Stephanie reveal that they have been working on a collection, "Spectra Couture by Thorne Forrester," and want Thorne to sell the gowns and keep the money. Thorne is touched by their gesture, but is unsure if he will return to Forrester. Meanwhile, Thomas is secretly meeting with Amber, despite his father's restraining order against her. Caitlin informs Stephanie about Thomas and Amber's relationship, and Stephanie decides to take action. Stephanie confronts Amber at her workplace, accusing her of disobeying the restraining order and lying about her relationship with Thomas. Ridge says goodbye to Brooke before leaving for a business trip, and Brooke expresses her concerns about being apart from him. Thorne confides in Darla about his parents' offer, but is hesitant to return to Forrester due to his complicated relationship with Ridge. Stephanie is determined to protect her family, particularly Thomas, from Amber's influence. Thomas and Amber continue to see each other in secret, with Thomas even buying her a burrito during her break.</summary>

<summary>
Liam is struggling with his engagement to Hope, feeling that she prioritizes her work over their relationship. Bill, Liam's father, is concerned about Liam's well-being and wants him to call off the engagement. Steffy, who has feelings for Liam, is asked by Bill to drive Liam home and try to end the engagement. Liam confides in Steffy about his issues with Hope, and Steffy offers to support him. Liam plans to talk to Hope in person and work through their issues, but Steffy is skeptical. Steffy offers to spend the night with Liam, but he declines, and she asks if she can give him a friendly kiss. The scene ends with Liam considering Steffy's request, leaving the outcome uncertain.</summary>

<summary>Nick is preparing to tell Brooke that he is having a child with Bridget, his ex-wife, which could potentially threaten their marriage. Meanwhile, Shane McGrath, a man who knows a dark secret about Phoebe and her family, is trying to gain their trust, but Stephanie and Hector are suspicious of his intentions. Brooke's mother-in-law, Jackie, is also causing tension by expressing her desire for Nick and Brooke to have a child together, despite Brooke's insistence that she is not interested in having more children.</summary>

<summary>Flo, who had previously kept Hope's baby a secret, donates a kidney to Katie, shocking the Logan family, who are grateful for her sacrifice but still hurt by her past actions. Meanwhile, Wyatt and Sally care for Beth, discussing their future and Wyatt's past with Flo, while Brooke and Shauna have a tense conversation about Flo's place in the family.</summary>

<summary>Quinn Forrester is upset after finding her son Wyatt in bed with Katie Logan, and her husband Eric is angry with her for attacking Katie. Quinn visits Mateo for a massage to relieve her tension, and Mateo tries to calm her down. Meanwhile, Sheila Carter, who has a history with the Forresters, starts working as a waitress at a restaurant near Forrester Creations and runs into Pam, who is skeptical of Sheila's intentions. Sheila tries to gain Pam's trust by talking about her rehabilitation and her desire for Eric's happiness, but Pam sees through Sheila's motives. Eric confronts Quinn about her behavior, and Sheila learns about the argument from Mateo, who gave Quinn a massage. Sheila is pleased with the development and sees an opportunity to drive a wedge between Eric and Quinn.</summary>

<summary>
Ridge reveals to Thorne that he called in a favor from a judge to help Katie gain custody of her son Will, which was a move to get revenge on Bill. Bill, however, believes Brooke was the one who convinced Katie to share custody with him. Brooke tells Bill to stay away from her, but he insists that she's the true blessing in his life. Meanwhile, Charlie proposes to Pam in the kitchen, hiding the engagement ring in a lemon bar. Pam and Charlie share the news with Eric and Quinn, and Pam expresses her desire to get married at the Forrester estate. Quinn is hesitant about the idea, suggesting alternative locations, but Eric agrees to host the wedding. Ridge is upset with Brooke for not telling him about Bill's advances, but she promises to stay away from him. Bill continues to pursue Brooke, showing up at her business meeting to thank her for her help with the custody situation. Ridge becomes increasingly paranoid about Bill's intentions, feeling the need to protect his wife and family. Brooke tries to calm Ridge down, reminding him that he's not like Bill and that their love is stronger than Bill's attempts to come between them.</summary>

<summary>Ridge Forrester, presumed dead, returns to his loved ones, including his wife Brooke and his mother Stephanie, who had been grieving his loss. Brooke had been comforted by Ridge's brother Nick, but is overjoyed to be reunited with Ridge. Meanwhile, Amber is dealing with her own family drama, as Deacon, the father of her son Eric, asks her to leave his home, citing concerns that her presence will confuse Eric. Amber is heartbroken and feels like she's lost another person in her life. Oscar, her boss, tries to lift her spirits and convince her to stay on at her job, telling her that she's talented and valuable. Stephanie and Massimo, Ridge's father, both express their gratitude for Ridge's return and their desire to put past conflicts behind them. The episode ends on a hopeful note, with Ridge and Brooke looking forward to starting their life together again.</summary>

<summary>
Rick disapproves of a design created by Ridge and Caroline, and Maya suggests that Rick should be aware of Caroline's relationship with Ridge. Hope confronts her father, Deacon, about his relationship with Quinn, warning him that Quinn is manipulating him to get to Hope and her baby. Deacon is torn between his feelings for Quinn and his loyalty to his daughter. Maya reveals to Rick that she caught Caroline in an intimate embrace with Ridge, but Rick is skeptical. Quinn tries to convince Deacon that her feelings for him are genuine, but he is unsure if he can trust her. Hope and Wyatt discuss their concerns about their parents' relationships, but ultimately decide to focus on their own future and family. Deacon is tempted to stay with Quinn, who promises to show him more of what she has to offer. Caroline and Ridge share a bittersweet goodbye, hinting at a deeper connection between them.</summary>

<summary> Bill Spencer is in the hospital after being pushed over a balcony by Ridge Forrester, but he has decided not to press charges and instead wants to change his life and practice forgiveness. Brooke Logan believes Bill is genuinely trying to change, but Eric Forrester and Ridge are skeptical, thinking Bill's motivation is to get back to Brooke. Meanwhile, Pam Douglas is arguing with Quinn Forrester about having her wedding at Eric's house and the destruction of Stephanie's portrait, which Quinn denies doing on purpose. The argument escalates, and Pam decides she no longer wants to get married at the house due to the conflict with Quinn. Bill and Ridge continue to exchange insults, with Bill claiming he is a better man and Ridge accusing Bill of being a child who doesn't know right from wrong. In the end, Justin arrives to take Bill home, and Ridge warns Bill to stay away from his wife, Brooke. </summary>

<summary>Thomas Forrester is preparing to unveil his new men's line at a Forrester Creations fashion show, but he's worried that it will be overshadowed by Hope's successful premiere earlier in the day. Whip advises Thomas to do something big to get the audience's attention, and Thomas has a mysterious plan that he's keeping secret from everyone except Brooke. Meanwhile, Hope is talking to Oliver and they're reminiscing about their past and how they've helped each other. Oliver tells Hope that he's not giving up on her and that their future together is going to be great. Thomas takes the stage and introduces his men's line, which is focused on bold new styles and a departure from traditional business suits. The audience is initially unimpressed, but Thomas is confident that his plan will turn things around. As the show comes to a close, Thomas and Brooke take the stage together, and the audience erupts in cheers and applause.</summary>

<summary>Hope is struggling with the guilt of pushing Thomas into a vat of acid, believing she killed him. However, she is also considering keeping the secret to avoid losing her family and freedom. Meanwhile, Ridge is searching for Thomas and is concerned about his well-being, unaware of the events that transpired. Brooke is trying to convince Hope to keep the secret, warning her of the consequences of confessing. Steffy and Ridge discuss Thomas's recent behavior, including his decision to give Hope joint custody of Douglas. In a shocking turn of events, Hope discovers that Thomas is actually alive, leaving her stunned and relieved.</summary>

<summary>

Stephanie is struggling with her health and asks Brooke to remove her ring, but then requests it back and gives it to Brooke instead. Eric is hesitant to show Stephanie a tribute video due to her current condition, but is advised to watch it first and decide later. Katie is struggling with postpartum depression and feels like she's not a good mother, but Taylor reassures her that she's sick and needs help. Thorne and Felicia have a heart-to-heart conversation about their past and their relationship with their mother. Stephanie tells Brooke that she hurt her, but also saved her, and Brooke apologizes for the pain she caused. Katie is reunited with her baby and begins to bond with him, with Taylor's help. The family members share their appreciation and gratitude for Stephanie, acknowledging her impact on their lives. Brooke reads a story to Stephanie and tells her that she loves her, and Stephanie accepts her apology. Stephanie asks Brooke to sing her to sleep and Brooke sings "When Irish Eyes Are Smiling" as Stephanie drifts off. The scene ends with Brooke sobbing and Stephanie sleeping peacefully.

</summary>

<summary>Stephanie Forrester is recovering in the hospital after being shot, and she accuses Donna Logan of being the shooter. Eric Forrester is torn between his loyalty to his wife and his relationship with Donna, and he asks Donna to tell him the truth about what happened. Donna denies shooting Stephanie and claims she was in the hallway when she heard the gunshot. Meanwhile, Brooke Logan and Ridge Forrester discuss the shooting and the possibility that someone from Brooke's family was involved. Ridge believes that his mother knows who the shooter is, but Brooke is skeptical. Donna confronts Stephanie in the hospital and denies shooting her, suggesting that Stephanie may have staged the shooting to win Eric's sympathy. Eric returns home to find that Pam, Stephanie's sister, has cooked him a meal and is staying at the house to take care of him.</summary>

<summary>
Phoebe returns home after her tour and reunites with her mother, Taylor, and discusses her feelings about Taylor's past relationship with Rick. Taylor apologizes for hurting Phoebe and promises to make it up to her. Meanwhile, Brooke tries to convince Rick to attend her wedding to Ridge, but he is initially resistant due to his disapproval of their relationship. Ridge and Brooke discuss their upcoming wedding and Ridge's children, including Phoebe, who has returned home. Phoebe agrees to sing at the rehearsal dinner and Ridge promises to spend more time with her after the wedding. Taylor congratulates Ridge on his upcoming wedding but is still emotional about their past relationship. Brooke and Rick have a heart-to-heart conversation, and Rick eventually agrees to attend the wedding to support his mother. Brooke is overjoyed and thanks Rick for his support. Rick's change of heart comes after Brooke shares her desire for him to be there and celebrate her special day with her.</summary>

<summary>Brooke Logan wants to be a part of her biological son Jack's life, despite him being raised by Taylor and Nick, and suggests a family gathering at Jack's christening to bring everyone together. However, Ridge, Brooke's fiancé, is opposed to the idea, citing concerns about Brooke's past relationship with Nick and the potential complications it could bring to their own relationship. Ultimately, Brooke decides to distance herself from Jack, despite her love for him, in order to prioritize her relationship with Ridge and avoid causing tension with Taylor.</summary>

<summary>
Thorne confesses to Brooke that he has been wanting to kiss her for a long time and expresses his feelings for her. Brooke is flattered but reminds Thorne that she has a son with Ridge and that her relationship with him is complicated. Thorne tells Brooke that he believes Ridge will hurt her again and that she deserves better. Meanwhile, Ridge is planning a surprise for Brooke and has asked Quinn to design an engagement ring. Quinn shows Ridge two options, an emerald cut and a round brilliant cut, and he chooses the round brilliant cut. Nicole returns from Paris and tells Maya that she saw Brooke and Thorne looking intimate, which makes Maya wonder if something is going on between them. Thorne tells Brooke about the time Ridge kissed Quinn and how he believes Ridge is incapable of commitment. Brooke is torn between her feelings for Ridge and Thorne's words, which make her question her relationship with Ridge. Thorne asks Brooke to consider her options and not rush into a marriage with Ridge, who he believes will only hurt her again. Thorne ultimately proposes to Brooke, telling her that he would treat her the way she deserves to be treated and that he would be grateful to have her in his life.
</summary>

<summary>Nicole is trying to convince Mia to let her adopt her baby, but Mia wants to meet Nicole's fiancé first. Brady tries to help Nicole but ends up telling Mia the truth, causing Nicole to become angry with him. Meanwhile, Lucas and Chloe are preparing for their engagement party, but Daniel's presence causes tension, especially when Lucas finds out that Daniel and Kate are no longer together. Chelsea is hesitant to attend the party alone, but Max offers to go with her. John has decided to undergo hypnosis to try and regain his memories, with Marlena's support. Nicole is determined to make the adoption work, even if it means lying to Mia about her fiancé's whereabouts.</summary>

<summary>Abigail is struggling with her interactions with EJ DiMera, and her mother Jennifer is concerned about their relationship. Meanwhile, Sami is dealing with the aftermath of her brother Eric's drugging and is trying to clear his name. EJ reveals to Sami that he helped Abigail by stopping her from revealing a secret about Nick, and Sami is grateful but also wary of EJ's motives. Daniel's computer crashes, and he discovers that all his files are gone, including the evidence he was collecting to clear Eric's name. Nicole encounters a mysterious doctor named Chyka, who is revealed to be working against Daniel and Eric. Kate is dealing with the fallout of Nick's disappearance and is trying to keep his secrets safe. Anne is causing trouble at the hospital, accusing Daniel of harassment and trying to get him in trouble. Jennifer intervenes and helps to clear up the situation, allowing Daniel to focus on his investigation.</summary>

<summary> Various characters navigate their personal and professional lives, including Melanie dealing with her father's departure, Chad rejecting Stefano's offer to help with his coffeehouse, and Hope being offered a modeling job by Madison James. Meanwhile, Sami works to sabotage Kate's plans at Countess Wilhelmina, and Bo and Hope try to get Stefano to reveal information about a safe deposit box he shares with Hope's grandmother. </summary>

<summary>
Mimi confesses to Rex that she lied to him about helping Belle and Shawn get back together, and also reveals that she had an abortion without telling him she was pregnant. Meanwhile, Belle is struggling with telling Philip the truth about her feelings for Shawn, and Shawn suggests she email Philip to break the news. Jan tries to guilt trip Belle into staying with Philip, but Belle is determined to follow her heart. Sami is stressed about her wedding to Lucas and is tempted by Brandon, who has returned to Salem. Kate is trying to keep John's addiction a secret and is working with Eugenia to sabotage Sami's wedding. John is struggling with his addiction and is desperate for help, while Marlena is trying to reassure him that she will always love him.</summary>

<summary> The scene shifts between various characters in Salem, with storylines involving EJ and Sami's marital issues, Nick's attempts to make amends, and Daniel and Nicole's investigation into Chyka's hideout. Meanwhile, JJ is dealing with his upcoming sentencing hearing and his complicated relationships with Theresa and his family members. Brady is struggling with his own demons, including his addiction and his feelings for Theresa, who is trying to navigate her own recovery and her attraction to Daniel. </summary>

<summary>Carly Manning is being held captive by Vivian Alamain in the cannery building on First Street, where Vivian reveals her plan to harm Melanie, Carly's daughter, on her wedding day. Meanwhile, Melanie is getting ready for her wedding to Philip Kiriakis, but is having second thoughts and has written a letter to Nathan Horton, her former love interest. Nathan, however, refuses to read the letter and is preparing to leave with Stephanie Johnson for a vacation. Vivian's plan is still unknown, but it is clear that she intends to harm Melanie. Hope Brady is suspicious of Vivian's intentions and is trying to warn Bo, but he is unreachable. Carly manages to escape from her captor and warns Bo about Vivian's plan, but it may be too late. The wedding ceremony is about to begin, and Melanie is unaware of the danger that awaits her.</summary>

<summary>Chelsea faces rejection from her father Bo, who believes she betrayed the family by helping Patrick Lockhart, while Nick tries to make amends with Chelsea after his deception as Dr. Shane Patton is revealed. Meanwhile, Max and Abby reconnect and share their past feelings for each other, and Billie tries to help Chelsea and Nick work through their issues.</summary>

<summary> Lexie is having an affair with Tek, and Abe is starting to suspect something, but his poor night vision prevents him from seeing the truth. Meanwhile, Mimi is struggling with the secret that Shawn is the father of Belle's baby, and she decides to write him a letter revealing the truth. Philip gives a heartfelt speech at Shawn and Mimi's engagement party, but the happiness is short-lived as secrets and lies threaten to tear the group apart. Marlena is trying to move on from John and focus on her future with Alex, but John's threats and her lingering feelings for him continue to cause tension. </summary>

<summary> Marlena and John have a disagreement about a bug-sweeping device he planted in her purse, which she believes is a sign of his lack of trust in her. Meanwhile, Belle and Shawn-D are happy to be back together and discuss their relationship and future plans. Roman and Kate have a romantic evening, but Kate reveals a secret from her past that makes her worry about Roman's feelings for her. Rex meets with Professor Rolf, who reveals that he is the doctor who delivered Rex and his sister Cassie, and that they were created as part of an experiment by Stefano Dimera. Rolf's true identity and motives are revealed, and Rex is left to process this new information. The episode ends with various characters reflecting on their relationships and personal struggles, including Marlena and John, Belle and Shawn-D, and Kate and Roman. </summary>

<summary>Chelsea is in the hospital after passing out, and Dr. Jonas is running tests to determine the cause of her illness. Meanwhile, Ava is holding Steve, Kayla, Bo, and Hope hostage, and her behavior becomes increasingly erratic and violent. E.J. and Sami are arguing about his decision to represent Nicole in her divorce, with Sami threatening to keep him from seeing their son if he doesn't drop the case. Ava reveals that she plans to keep her hostages for nine months, as she believes Kayla is carrying her baby and she intends to take it from her. Dr. Jonas receives the test results and tells Lexie that they are not good, but the nature of Chelsea's illness is not yet revealed.</summary>

<summary> Theo and Ciara are found safe and sound after running away, and they are reunited with their families. Meanwhile, Nicole discovers a DNA report that she believes will prove EJ and Stefano kidnapped Rafe and took over his mind. EJ tells Taylor that he plans to divorce Nicole because he loves Taylor, but Taylor is hesitant and feels guilty about being the reason for the divorce. Stefano tries to convince Chad to work for him at DiMera Enterprises, and Chad eventually agrees, while Kate reveals to Chad that EJ plans to ask Nicole for a divorce. </summary>

<summary> Jack Deveraux returns home to his family, reuniting with his wife Jennifer and daughter Abby, after being presumed dead. Meanwhile, Bo and Billie search for their daughter Georgia, following a lead that takes them to an abandoned house. Roman Brady and Marlena Evans, also thought to be dead, return to Salem and reunite with their loved ones, including John Black and Kate Roberts. Kate is shocked to see Roman, as she had moved on and was planning to marry John. The scene also shows Belle and Mimi discussing their concerns about Shawn, Brady, and Rex, who are on a mission to rescue Philip. The episode ends with Bo and Billie searching the abandoned house, where they hear a child's voice calling out for "Mama", and Jack confronting Patrick about his relationship with Jennifer. </summary>

<summary> Paul and Sonny are investigating Deimos' activities, and they discover that Deimos has chartered a plane to Manitoba, Canada. Brady and Nicole are living in Manitoba with their children, and Deimos has sent someone to find them. Meanwhile, Abigail and Gabi have a heated conversation about Chad and their relationships with him. Abigail explains that she ended her marriage to Chad because she felt he was still in love with Gabi. Gabi argues that Chad loves Abigail and that she should not have given up on their marriage. Steve and Kayla try to connect with their son Tripp, but he is still struggling to forgive Steve for killing his mother. Jade tries to convince Tripp to give Steve a break, but Tripp is unsure. Brady is shot by the person Deimos sent, and Nicole is left to care for their children. The shooter is revealed to be Xander, who has a surprise for Nicole. </summary>

<summary> Roman tries to reach Kate, who is avoiding him, and later discovers she is leaving on a business trip. Meanwhile, Cassie throws a party at the Dimera mansion, which gets out of control when Vin Ramsell, a drug dealer, shows up and tries to poison Shawn. Bo and Hope arrive to investigate and arrest Chaz, Cassie's boyfriend, who is suspected of being involved in the poisoning. Lucas visits Sami, who is scared and thinks someone is on her fire escape, but it turns out to be just wind chimes. Bo tries to get Chaz to cooperate and tell him what he knows about Vin Ramsell's whereabouts. </summary>

<summary> The scene revolves around the upcoming wedding of Brady and Kristen, with various characters expressing their concerns and reservations about the union, including John, who is determined to stop the wedding and expose Kristen's true nature. Meanwhile, other characters deal with their own personal struggles and relationships, including Eric's confrontation with Kristen, Daniel's defense of Jennifer against Anne's accusations, and Marlena's complicated relationships with John and Roman. </summary>

<summary>
Lucas returns to Salem and confronts Kate about her actions, particularly her treatment of Sheryl. Jordan reveals to Rafe that she loves him and decides to stay in Salem. Meanwhile, Nick's behavior becomes increasingly erratic, and Julie expresses concern for his well-being. Sonny and Will discuss their plan to deal with Nick, who is trying to gain custody of Ari. Abigail confides in Will about her problems with Nick, who is using secrets against her. Nick reaches out to Marlena for help, but before he can get it, he is shot in Horton Square. Julie finds Nick and calls for an ambulance, and Rafe responds to the emergency. The identity of the shooter is not revealed, but it is clear that Nick's actions have consequences.</summary>

<summary>
The scene opens with Lucas trying to convince Sami to attend her mother Marlena's funeral, but Sami is in denial about her mother's death. Meanwhile, Belle is struggling to come to terms with her mother's passing and is worried about Shawn, who is not present at the funeral. Shawn is actually being held captive by Jan, who is trying to keep him from leaving her. Nicole visits Jan, demanding that she hand over some money, and Shawn tries to escape. At the funeral, John delivers a eulogy, and Belle and Hope share their memories of Marlena. Sami is overcome with grief and anger, blaming John, Kate, and Bo for her mother's death. As the service comes to a close, Sami asks for a few more minutes alone with her mother and suddenly hears Marlena's voice, indicating that she may not be dead after all. Celeste also senses Marlena's presence, and the scene ends with Sami trying to free her mother from the casket. The episode ends with a cliffhanger, setting up the next day's events.

<summary>Nick Fallon discovers that his friend Max Brady altered his alternative fuel source proposal without his knowledge, leading to a heated argument and Nick's decision to return the grant money. Meanwhile, a warehouse containing John Black's impounded goods catches fire, and he accuses Philip Kiriakis of arson. Philip denies any involvement, but the police investigation is ongoing. Max struggles with his own secrets, including his exceptional intelligence, which he has been hiding from everyone, including his family.</summary>

<summary>Chloe and Daniel are preparing to get married, but Chloe's past mistakes and her health issues are causing tension. Meanwhile, Jennifer is working on a scrapbook for her grandmother, Alice, who is nearing the end of her life. Alice's family is gathering around her, and they are reminiscing about old times and sharing stories. Stefano and Kate are dealing with a mysterious box that contains secrets about Madeline, a judge. Chad is deciding whether to attend Wake Forest or Salem University, and his mother, Madeline, is trying to convince him to leave Salem. Will is visiting his great-grandmother, Alice, and is trying to make her happy by not worrying her about his living situation with Stefano. Carly interrupts Chloe and Daniel's wedding ceremony, and it seems like she has something important to say.</summary>

<summary>Hope and Aiden plan a getaway to the Green Mountain Lodge, while Rafe is left to deal with his feelings about Hope's relationship with Aiden. Meanwhile, Ciara is offered a volunteer position at Shady Hills, where Abigail is being held, and Chad is planning to break Abigail out of the facility. André is seen making threatening phone calls to Aiden, hinting at a larger plan in motion.</summary>

<summary>
Abe agrees to perform the ceremony for Sami and EJ's wedding, which is a surprise to Sami. Abigail is overwhelmed with planning the wedding and feels like she's being taken advantage of by Sami. JJ meets Paige's mom, Eve, who is a singer and travels a lot for her job, and they have a pleasant conversation. However, JJ is worried that Eve will find out about his past troubles with the law. Jordan and Rafe are still not talking, and Kate tries to convince Jordan to reach out to Rafe and help him move on from his guilt over Gabi's actions. Sami asks Abigail to do a reading at the wedding, and Abigail agrees despite feeling uncomfortable. Eve discovers that JJ's full name is JJ Deveraux, which raises her suspicions.
