Jennifer tries to reassure JJ that Eve will understand and respect his efforts to clean up his life.</summary>

<summary>
Kate visits Victor to offer condolences for Caroline's death, but Victor is more concerned about his business dealings. Meanwhile, Ted is being held captive by Xander, who is working with Nicole to keep a secret about Holly's death. Sami confronts Nicole about her behavior towards Eric, who is still grieving the loss of Holly. Rex and Sarah decide to get married immediately, with Eric agreeing to perform the ceremony. Brady tries to convince Nicole to work for Titan instead of Dimera, but she declines. Nicole is hiding a secret, which Sami is determined to uncover. Kate offers to snoop around Nicole's room to gather information for Victor. Xander spares Ted's life and decides to give the necklace Ted had to Sarah as a gift. The episode ends with Kate discovering a secret in Nicole's room, while Nicole is shown to be hiding something intense.</summary>

<summary> Hope and Marlena discuss Ben Weston's mental fitness, with Hope believing he's a psychopath and Marlena thinking he can lead a productive life with therapy. Meanwhile, Chad confides in Marlena about his struggles with Abigail's pregnancy with Stefan's child. Abigail tells Stefan she wants him to stay away from her and the baby, but Stefan insists on being involved. Lani and Eli discuss their grief over their stillborn son, David, and Lani warns Eli not to try to comfort her inappropriately. Tripp is skeptical of Ben's claims of innocence in the fire that almost killed Ciara, but Ciara wants to hear Ben out. Gabi and JJ have a heart-to-heart about their past mistakes and JJ encourages Gabi to be kinder to herself. Hope and Rafe discuss the investigation into the fire, with Hope wanting to keep the case open and Rafe suggesting they close it and encourage Ben to leave town. </summary>

<summary> Marlena's wedding to John is interrupted by Sami, who claims that someone is going to kill Marlena. The situation escalates with the arrival of Kristen DiMera, who reveals she has been seeking revenge against Marlena for pushing her out of a window. Kristen holds the guests hostage and reveals that she has been manipulating Susan, who was invited to the wedding. Meanwhile, Will, who has been struggling with memory loss, begins to recall his past, including his wedding to Sonny. As Kristen's plan unfolds, she reveals that EJ is alive and offers to take Sami to him if she kills John. Sami is torn, but ultimately refuses to pull the trigger. The scene ends with Kristen's plan still in motion and the guests in danger. </summary>

<summary> JJ reveals to Jennifer that Paige knows he's working undercover for the DEA to take down Kyle, and he's worried about the consequences. Meanwhile, Abigail confesses to Chad that the baby she's carrying is actually his, not Ben's, and she loves him. Adrienne and Lucas share a fun night of bungee jumping, and Adrienne expresses her desire to move on with her life and do new things with Lucas. Hope and Aiden discuss their plans for the Salem bicentennial celebration, and Aiden reveals he has a special contribution to make. Eve tries to warn Paige about JJ's undercover work and the danger it poses, but Paige refuses to listen. Chad and Serena grow closer, but Serena tries to put the brakes on their relationship due to her complicated past and fear of hurting Chad's reputation.</summary>

<summary> Will's grandma is in surgery after being shot, and his dad is on his way to Salem. Vivian, who had been presumed dead, is revealed to be alive and is trying to cover her tracks after shooting Kate Dimera. Eve is trying to get a job at Dimera Enterprises, and Vivian agrees to pass along her contact information to Stefan. Brady is struggling with his feelings for Kristen, who is trying to win him back. Eric is trying to let Sarah down gently, and Nicole is dealing with Xander, who claims to have feelings for Sarah. Xander agrees to sign divorce papers with Nicole, but she is skeptical of his motives. Brady is tempted by Kristen but ultimately resists her advances. Meanwhile, Jack is trying to find Dr. Rolf, who has gone missing after his lab was destroyed. Jennifer and Jack are trying to figure out who destroyed the lab and are suspecting Eve. </summary>

<summary> JJ is shot by Orpheus and undergoes surgery, with the next 24 hours being critical for his recovery, while Orpheus is eventually killed after taking Marlena hostage and attempting to inject himself with a sedative. Meanwhile, various characters deal with their own personal struggles and relationships, including Adrienne and Justin's complicated past, Lucas's kindness to Anne, and Gabi's emotional plea for JJ to recover. </summary>

<summary> Eli fills in for Sonny at Arianna's school event, and Gabi is grateful for his help. Meanwhile, Eve reveals to Victor that she is the new CEO of Basic Black, which was left to her by Deimos, and Victor tasks Brady with getting rid of her. Kate offers Gabi a job at Dimera, but Gabi is hesitant due to rumors about the company's financial troubles and her past with Chad. Abigail starts her new job as head of PR at Dimera, and Kate asks her to deal with a press situation involving her mother, Jennifer. Brady accuses Eve of killing his uncle Deimos, and Eli and Rafe arrive to investigate. </summary>

<summary> Paul has decided to leave Salem to pursue an experimental treatment in California that could help him walk again, and he says goodbye to his loved ones. Will is trying to find Sonny, who left town after learning about Will's relationship with Paul, but Victor is refusing to give him Sonny's flight plan. Tripp's scheme to frame Ben for the cabin fire is exposed, and Ciara breaks up with him as a result. Abe is struggling with the idea of a long-distance relationship with Valerie, who has been offered a job as chief of staff at a hospital in D.C. Ben and Ciara have a brief encounter, but she's not ready to talk to him about her breakup with Tripp. </summary>

<summary> Abe and Valerie go on a dinner date, but Theo is suspicious of Valerie's intentions and catches her in a lie, leading Claire and Ciara to investigate her background. Meanwhile, Gabi decides to give JJ another chance, which disappoints Chad, who has developed feelings for her. Abigail is struggling to come to terms with the fact that Chad may have moved on with Gabi and is considering revealing herself to him. Sonny locks his parents and Lucas in a room together to help them figure out their feelings, and Paul and Steve investigate a shipment from the Hernandez family business, discovering that it contains counterfeit designer handbags. </summary>

<summary>It's New Year's Eve in Salem, and the residents are celebrating with parties and romantic getaways. Melanie and Philip are planning to elope to Las Vegas, but Nathan is determined to stop them, believing Melanie is making a mistake. Meanwhile, Carly is being blackmailed by Vivian, who knows a dark secret from Carly's past, and Daniel is trying to help Carly while also navigating his own relationships. As the night unfolds, secrets are revealed, and relationships are put to the test.</summary>

<summary> The scene opens with Luke, who is recovering from an illness, receiving a visit from his friend Ernesto, who brings him a gift of Cuban cigars. Meanwhile, Diane is thrilled to learn that she has been nominated for Litigator of the Year, while Alexis receives the same news and is also nominated for the award. Sonny is in trouble after being arrested for assault in New York City, and Jason is trying to find a way to get him out of jail. Nikolas is struggling to come to terms with the loss of Emily, but is visited by her ghost, who tries to comfort him. The episode ends with Luke's health taking a turn for the worse, and Tracy calling for help as his monitor flatlines. </summary>

<summary>Sonny Corinthos unknowingly shoots his own son, Detective Dante Falconeri, who was working undercover to take down Sonny's organization, and the story unfolds as Sonny discovers the truth about his son's identity and tries to make amends. Meanwhile, a christening ceremony for Josslyn Jacks takes place, and various characters navigate their relationships and personal struggles amidst the celebration.</summary>

<summary>Jason Morgan is dealing with multiple crises, including the disappearance of Sonny's son, Kate Howard's shooting, and the search for the text message killer, while also navigating a potential truce with Claudia Zacchara. Meanwhile, Nikolas Cassadine is trying to remember who killed his fiancée Emily, with the help of Nadine, and Diego Alcazar is holding Sam McCall captive and taunting her about his plans. The story also explores the personal struggles of various characters, including Lulu Spencer, Lucky Spencer, and Epiphany Johnson, as they navigate their relationships and health issues.</summary>

<summary>

Lucky questions Johnny about a mask and a break-in at Bernie Abrams' office, but Johnny denies any involvement. Maxie discusses her attraction to Johnny with Spinelli, while Jason receives a threatening message from Franco. Claire Walsh, a federal prosecutor, informs Sonny that she plans to send him to prison with Dante's help. Diane and Alexis discuss their strategy for Sonny's trial, while Nikolas talks to Elizabeth about setting up a trust for her baby. Luke advises Sonny to keep Ethan out of the mob war, and Lucky warns Jason not to retaliate against Johnny. Michael feels guilty about his role in Claudia's death and the impact it's having on his family. Elizabeth considers raising her children on her own, while Steve advises her to keep her options open. Lucky tries to persuade Ethan to leave the country to avoid getting caught up in the mob war, but Luke intervenes. Dante visits Michael and tries to get him to open up about what really happened to Claudia, but Sonny interrupts and tells him to leave.

</summary>

<summary>Todd Manning attempts to kill Sonny Corinthos, believing he is responsible for the death of his granddaughter and her father, but is stopped by Lieutenant John McBain and later taken into custody. Meanwhile, Starr Manning, Todd's daughter, confronts Sonny and vows to prove his guilt, while Maxie Jones struggles to cope with the loss of her cousin Robin Scorpio Drake. Johnny Zacchara tries to manipulate Kate Howard and Connie, while Anthony Zacchara tries to avoid being killed by Sonny and Tracy tries to protect herself from being implicated in his crimes.</summary>

<summary> Sonny confesses to Carly that he slept with Nelle, which leads to a heated argument and Carly wanting space. Meanwhile, a bomb is discovered in the hospital, and Jason and Curtis work together to disarm it, successfully preventing a detonation. Olivia Jerome is revealed to be the one who planted the bomb and is also responsible for Morgan's death. She kidnaps Alexis and forces Julian to choose between killing her or facing a more painful death. Carly discovers that Olivia is alive and vows to find her and make her pay for Morgan's death. The police are searching for Olivia, and Sonny is determined to find her and get revenge for his son's death. </summary>

<summary>
Michael and Abby discuss Brandon's release on bail, with Michael vowing to protect Abby from him. Meanwhile, Luke grapples with the guilt of hitting and killing Jake, despite Sonny's attempts to reassure him it was an accident. Carly and Brenda have a heated argument over Brenda's involvement in Carly's children's lives. Patrick and Robin share a tender moment with their daughter Emma, and Patrick reflects on his past mistakes. Theo and Suzanne have a tense confrontation, with Suzanne revealing she has been hiding their grandson from Theo. Brenda tries to make amends with Carly, but Carly refuses to back down. Luke and Elizabeth both struggle with guilt and blame over Jake's death. Michael and Abby disagree over how to handle Brandon, with Michael wanting to take matters into his own hands. Suzanne proposes that she and Theo work together to raise their grandson, keeping his existence a secret from Brenda. Sonny reflects on the pain of losing a child and the guilt that comes with it, using his own experiences to try to help Luke and Jason cope with their loss.</summary>

<summary>
Alexis visits Jason and Sam, discussing Jason's concerns about having a child due to his dangerous lifestyle. Carly and Jax argue over custody of their daughter Josslyn, with Jax trying to use a preliminary report on Shawn's past against Carly. Meanwhile, Lisa traps Robin in the basement, planning to kill her and frame Patrick for the crime. Brenda struggles to connect with her son Alec, feeling like an outsider in her own home. Sonny tries to reassure her, but Brenda feels like he's hiding things from her. Kristina confides in Michael about taking hydrocodone, which was given to her by Lisa without a prescription. Michael promises to keep her secret and encourages her to seek help. Carly asks Shawn to stay on as Josslyn's bodyguard, despite Jax's attempts to discredit him. Jason and Sonny discuss their concerns about their loved ones, with Jason regretting not spending more time with his son Jake and Sonny wondering if he can keep Brenda's son Alec safe. Brenda considers whether she can make her marriage to Sonny work, given the dangers of his lifestyle.</summary>

<summary> 
Elizabeth and Hayden get into a physical altercation, and Hayden's mother Naomi arrives, revealing a complicated past between them. Franco tries to offer Elizabeth his help in taking down Hayden, but she's hesitant. Meanwhile, Jason and Sam discuss the possibility that Nikolas faked his own death, and they start to investigate. Nathan confesses to Maxie that he shot his ex-wife's lover in a fit of jealousy, causing tension in their relationship. Lucas wakes up in the hospital and tries to remember what happened to him, but his memories are fuzzy. Jordan starts to investigate the hospital staff, looking for a suspect in Lucas's attack. Naomi tries to manipulate Hayden into giving her the diamond necklace that Nikolas stole, but Hayden claims she doesn't have it. Jason receives a call from Monica, informing him that there's a warrant out for his arrest for Nikolas's murder. Jason and Sam decide to lay low and come up with a plan to prove his innocence.
</summary>

<summary>Nikolas ends his relationship with Rebecca, citing that he cannot be with her due to her resemblance to his late love Emily, while Claudia plots to have Jason killed to protect herself and her unborn child from his accusations. Meanwhile, Olivia confides in Carly about her relationship with Johnny, and Carly advises her not to worry about Sonny's disapproval, but Claudia warns Johnny that Sonny is a threat to their family and that he needs to be taken care of.</summary>

<summary>Maxie's health is deteriorating, and her family is preparing to say their goodbyes, while Georgie, who was also critically injured, wakes up and is taken to see her sister. Meanwhile, Sonny is questioning Reese's honesty, and Ric is being interrogated by John Durant about the death of Evan, Reese's ex-husband.</summary>

<summary>

Patrick and Robin take care of Elizabeth's baby Jake, with Patrick struggling to change his diaper and feed him. Carly and Jax discuss the possibility of her being pregnant, with Jax wanting to take a home pregnancy test and Carly refusing. Sonny and Kate discuss their upcoming wedding and Kate's desire for a prenuptial agreement, which Sonny is hesitant about. Maxie and Johnny are stuck in an elevator together, where Maxie tries to flirt with him and warns him about Lulu's fragile state. Lulu and Logan have a confrontation, with Logan warning Lulu about the dangers of the Zacchara family. Jason and Claudia take care of Spinelli, who has a fever and is talking about Jason's destiny and his relationship with Sonny. Claudia warns Jason that Sonny will try to manipulate him into killing him as a form of punishment for Michael's accident. Kate and Sonny reaffirm their love for each other and decide to move forward with their wedding plans. Lulu and Maxie have a confrontation, with Maxie using Lulu's mother's condition as a way to try and break up Lulu and Johnny. Johnny is arrested for assaulting Logan, but claims it was self-defense.

</summary>

<summary> Luke Spencer is dying from polonium 210 poisoning and Tracy Quartermaine wants to help him find a cure, but Luke is hesitant to let her get involved. Meanwhile, Nikolas Cassadine and Elizabeth Webber have a conversation about AJ Quartermaine, who slept with Carly Corinthos while he and Elizabeth were on a break. Elizabeth is upset with Nikolas for not telling her that AJ and Carly's encounter happened when they were not together. Lulu Spencer-Falconeri reveals to her family that she is having a baby girl, but also shares a dark secret about her past with Stavros Cassadine. Ava Jerome and Franco Baldwin try to convince Carly to let Morgan stay with them, and eventually succeed. Shawn Butler and Alexis Davis have a disagreement about his job as a hitman, and Alexis gives him an ultimatum to quit or end their relationship. Shawn agrees to quit, but it's unclear if he will follow through. AJ is worried that Nikolas will use his mistake with Carly to win Elizabeth back. Tracy finds a note from Luke saying he has to do things alone and is counting on her to keep it a secret.</summary>

<summary>

Patrick is exposed to the AIDS virus after pricking himself during a procedure and must undergo testing and treatment. Sonny has a difficult therapy session with Dr. Lainey, who suggests that his mother was at fault for not protecting him from his abusive stepfather. Emily stands up to Sonny, telling him he needs to take control of his life and stop blaming others for his problems. Nikolas and Emily spend time together with his son John, and Alfred predicts they will be a couple again soon. Lucky confides in Elizabeth that he didn't actually kill Manny, but rather Jason did. Sam is stuck in an elevator with Jason and opens up to him about her struggles, including her upcoming GED test. Jason offers to help Sam study, and they share a moment of connection. Carly talks to Sonny about his childhood and his mother's role in it, suggesting that she should have done more to protect him. Sonny begins to see his mother in a different light and realizes that Carly has been a positive influence in his life. Patrick starts his treatment and is determined to stay positive and focused on his work.

</summary>

<summary> Sam McCall leaves a message for Dr. Finn to call her back with her test results, which will affect her decisions. Meanwhile, Kevin Collins is recovering from being shot and thanks Laura for saving his life. Ava Jerome is visited by Holt, who wants to discuss her brother Julian's escape plan. Julian is in prison and receives a visit from Alexis, who wants him to speak to the Bar Association on her behalf. Kristina Davis tries to make amends with Aaron for lying to him about her feelings for Parker. Sam confides in Elizabeth about her pregnancy and asks her to keep it a secret from Jason until she knows the baby is okay. Alexis visits Julian in prison and refuses to help him escape, and Julian is later broken out of prison by an unknown person. Laura talks to Ava about her son Nikolas and Ava reveals that Nikolas died a hero, sacrificing his life to save her. </summary>

<summary>Elizabeth finds out that Lucky is having an affair with Maxie and turns to Jason for comfort, leading to a romantic night together. Meanwhile, Sam discovers that Ric slept with her to get revenge on Jason and threatens to tell him, while Ric tries to get Sonny to intervene. Alexis confides in Sonny about her troubled marriage to Ric and her health issues, and Lulu decides to leave Port Charles. Lucky's addiction and infidelity are revealed to his family and friends, causing tension and concern for his well-being.</summary>

<summary>It's Sonny and Carly's wedding day, but things are complicated as Morgan is struggling with his recent breakup with Kiki and his possible bipolar disorder, while Michael is hesitant to attend the wedding due to his issues with Sonny. Meanwhile, Anna returns to Port Charles and offers to help Sam with her investigation into Nikolas, and Molly and TJ work together to fix a disastrous wedding cake. Spencer is trying to win back Emma on his first day of school, and Hayden and Nikolas grow closer as they spend the day together. As the day unfolds, secrets and tensions come to the surface, threatening to disrupt the wedding and the lives of those involved.</summary>

<summary>Carly is preparing to marry Sonny, but he is nowhere to be found, and his family and friends are starting to get worried. Meanwhile, Sonny has been shot and is fighting for his life, with Jason and Sam trying to keep him stable until the ambulance arrives. As the wedding preparations continue, Carly remains optimistic that Sonny will show up, but the situation takes a dramatic turn when Jason arrives at the wedding with Sonny's blood on his shirt.</summary>

<summary> Franco is exonerated of all charges due to his tumor, which allegedly affected his ability to tell right from wrong. Sonny is struggling with his bipolar disorder and is found by his family after a night of drinking and contemplating suicide. Britt gives birth to her baby, who has fluid in his lungs and needs immediate medical attention. Sabrina delivers the baby and helps him get to the hospital, where he receives treatment and recovers. Meanwhile, Kiki is trying to find Franco, and Michael is trying to make amends with Morgan and Kiki. Carly is dealing with Franco's claims of having feelings for her, which she strongly denies. </summary>

<summary> The city of Port Charles is in chaos as a deadly pathogen spreads, and the only hope for a cure lies in a single dose of antiserum that Tracy Quartermaine's immune system has generated. Meanwhile, Jerry Jacks, who has been holding the city hostage, is revealed to be dying from radiation sickness and is desperate to escape with the money he has stolen. As the characters navigate the crisis, relationships are put to the test, and sacrifices are made in the hopes of saving loved ones. In the end, Edward Quartermaine gives the antiserum to Emma, Patrick's daughter, and the city holds its breath as it waits to see if the cure will work. </summary>

<summary>Paul Hornsby's divorce papers have been finalized, and he is struggling to cope with the end of his marriage. Meanwhile, Morgan Corinthos is seeking revenge against Julian Jerome, who he believes shot his father Sonny. Michael Corinthos is trying to stop Morgan, who has obtained a gun, and Kristina is worried that her mother Alexis may be in danger if she is with Julian. Ava Jerome is trying to retrieve a flash drive that could incriminate her in Connie's murder, and Scott Baldwin is demanding $5 million from her in exchange for his help. Patrick Drake is celebrating his birthday with his family, and Sam Morgan has given him a guitar as a gift. Paul Hornsby has used his connection to Mayor Janice Lomax to get the cease and desist order on Dillon's movie production lifted. Ava is trying to track down Julian, and Morgan is getting closer to finding him, leading to a potentially violent confrontation.</summary>

<summary>Sonny and Kate's wedding is disrupted by various interruptions, including Olivia's concerns that Kate is actually her alternate personality Connie, and Connie ultimately reveals that she is already married, calling off the wedding. Meanwhile, Elizabeth confesses to Jason that she lied about the DNA test results, revealing that Sam's baby is actually alive and living with Téa in Llanview. Kristina is being held captive by Joe Jr., who plans to use her as leverage to get revenge on Sonny and gain control of his assets.</summary>

<summary>Claudia Zacchara is set to marry Sonny Corinthos as part of a business deal between their families, despite her brother Johnny's disapproval. Meanwhile, Jason Morgan is dealing with the aftermath of a warehouse fire and the shooting of three men, and is eventually arrested for arson and murder. Elizabeth Webber and her sons, along with Sam McCall, are on a trip to a cabin, but their getaway is disrupted when they discover that the Russians are outside. Nikolas Cassadine is also facing a challenge as Jax prepares to build a resort on Spoon Island, which Nikolas owns, and Carly tries to mediate the situation.</summary>

<summary> Jason is preparing to meet with the artist Franco, who has been sending him cryptic messages and clues, despite Sam's concerns for his safety. Meanwhile, Carly is trying to convince Sonny to let her take Michael to the police and confess to Claudia's murder, but Sonny is adamant that they stick to their original story. Rebecca is recovering from her accident and is discussing her feelings about Nikolas with Ethan, who is determined to help her get revenge. Johnny is struggling with his feelings for Olivia, who has confessed that she is in love with Sonny. Maxie is trying to downplay her encounter with Franco and is asking Sam to help her get in touch with Jason to discuss a photo shoot. Franco finally meets Jason at his studio, and the two begin a tense and awkward conversation. </summary>

<summary>Maxie is struggling to cope with the loss of custody of her daughter, who may be moving to Portland with Spinelli, while Lulu is grieving the loss of her own child and blaming Dante for their failed custody battle. Meanwhile, Franco is seeking therapy with Kevin to deal with the aftermath of killing his mother, Heather, and Carly is trying to help him get his life back on track, including finding a job at the Haunted Star.</summary>

<summary> The scene cuts between various characters as they prepare for Christmas, with Carly trying to convince her doctors to let her leave the hospital to be with her sons, while Alexis is forced to defend Manny Ruiz, a man who was responsible for a crash that nearly killed her and her newborn child. Meanwhile, Sonny and the boys are preparing for Christmas without Carly, and Emily has agreed to fill in for her, but Courtney's plans with Nikolas have been put on hold as she agrees to spend Christmas with Sonny and the boys instead. </summary>

<summary>

Gus is shocked to discover he has a 16-year-old son, Rafe, with Natalia, a woman from his past. Natalia had kept the secret for years, fearing Gus's reaction and wanting to protect Rafe. Meanwhile, Beth is struggling with Alan's overbearing behavior, feeling like a prisoner in her own home. She confides in Leah, Rick's daughter, who is angry about Beth's relationship with her father. Reva confronts Alan about a bounced check for cancer research, accusing him of stealing from cancer patients. Rick and Mel discuss their daughter Leah's adjustment to the news about Beth's pregnancy and Rick's plans to fight for custody. Natalia explains to Gus why she kept Rafe a secret, citing her fear and uncertainty about Gus's whereabouts. Gus is torn between his desire to connect with Rafe and his anger towards Natalia for keeping the secret. Rafe is in a holding cell at the police station, and Natalia is determined to find him. The scene ends with a preview of upcoming conflicts, including Mallet's denial of being a contract killer and Rafe's rejection of Gus as his father.

</summary>

<summary>

The scene opens with Lizzie telling Ava that she knows Ava went to a fertility clinic, and Ava tells her to get out. Meanwhile, Rick is talking to his dad about not feeling up to hosting the annual Bauer barbecue, but his dad tries to guilt trip him into doing it. Beth breaks the news to Rick that she's chosen Alan over him, and Rick decides not to host the barbecue. However, Cassie and Josh decide to host it instead, and the party is a success. Bill tries to convince Lizzie to have an affair with him, but she rejects him. Ava's secret about the baby is revealed to Remy, who is angry and hurt. The episode ends with a speech by Mallet about the importance of unity and the holiday, and the partygoers singing "Yankee Doodle Dandy". The preview for the next episode shows Reva and Josh discussing their relationships and a possible reconnection.

</summary>

<summary>Cassie and Jeffrey navigate their relationship while dealing with Edmund's schemes, and Reva discovers that her son Jonathan's adoptive father Alfred is actually Nate, a man from her past who may be connected to a murder. Meanwhile, Dinah agrees to help Edmund in exchange for his cooperation, and Bill tries to convince Dinah to participate in a family photo session to help Olivia heal from her sister's death.</summary>

<summary>Alan Spaulding confesses to shooting his son Phillip, but tries to justify his actions as a means to protect his family. However, his family members, including his granddaughter Lizzie, turn against him and demand justice. Meanwhile, Edmund is struggling to come to terms with the loss of his unborn child with Dinah, and Dinah tries to convince him to start a new family with her. Cassie, Edmund's ex-partner, is determined to protect her unborn child from Edmund's alleged unfit parenting. Jonathan tries to comfort Dinah, who is heartbroken over her miscarriage and Edmund's rejection. Tammy tries to win back Sandy, who has moved on to someone else. Alan is eventually arrested for Phillip's murder, and his family is left to deal with the aftermath of his actions. Alexandra, Alan's sister, reveals that she has physical evidence linking Alan to the crime, including a pair of gloves with powder burns and Phillip's blood. As Alan is taken away, his family members express their relief and anger, and Lizzie vows never to return to the Spaulding household again.</summary>

<summary>Shayne Lewis is struggling to cope with his newfound fame as a baseball player, while Marina Cooper tries to help him navigate the challenges that come with it. Meanwhile, Ben Reade is trying to visit his dying grandmother, but Detective Gus Aitoro is hesitant to let him go due to concerns about his safety and potential involvement in a murder investigation. Eden August is also dealing with her own problems, as Gus accuses her of being involved in a string of murders and she tries to clear her name with the help of Tony Santos. Cassie Winslow is evicting Jeffrey O'Neill from her hotel, while Edmund Crumb is working on a surprise for her that involves restoring a farm that holds sentimental value to her and her children.</summary>

<summary>
Alexandra Spaulding hosts a charity fundraiser, where Cyrus Foley, her husband, plans to steal from the guests by reading off their account numbers to his accomplice, Griggs. Meanwhile, Marina Cooper, a police officer and Cyrus's former lover, is working at the event and becomes suspicious of Cyrus's activities. Natalia Rivera attends the event with Alan Spaulding, who is trying to win her over, but she is also being pursued by Gus Aitoro. Vanessa Lewis, Dinah's mother, attends the event with Billy, causing tension with her ex-husband Matt. Mallet, Dinah's boyfriend, is struggling financially and is caught by his boss, Frank, with a large sum of money that he had been entrusted with. Dinah confesses to Matt that she has feelings for him, but he is not interested. As the night comes to a close, Cyrus's plan is discovered by Marina, who threatens to stop him. Cyrus's accomplice, Griggs, is waiting to receive the stolen funds, and Cyrus is determined to see his plan through. The night ends with several characters facing uncertain futures and unresolved conflicts.</summary>

<summary> Lizzie is recovering in the hospital after being kidnapped, and Bill is trying to clear his name as the main suspect. Meanwhile, Reva is worried about her son Shayne, who has gone missing after returning from a stint in the military. Shayne is struggling to come to terms with his past and his current injuries, and is pushing away those who care about him. Beth is torn between her feelings for Coop and her obligations to her family, particularly her daughter Lizzie. Alan is trying to convince Beth to join him on a trip to China for business, but she is hesitant. Lizzie is determined to stay with Bill and clear his name, rather than going to China to save the Macau deal. </summary>

<summary> The residents of Llanview navigate complex relationships and secrets, including Blair's return to Todd, Max's attempt to reconcile with Roxy, and Antonio's concerns about Liz's plan to take the baby and leave town. Meanwhile, Asa's plan to divorce Rae is foiled, and Jen considers confessing the truth to Cristian about her lies. </summary>

<summary> Jessica prepares for her daughter Chloe's christening, while also visiting her late husband Nash's grave and reflecting on her past. Meanwhile, Cole reveals to Starr that he found a locket that belonged to their deceased daughter Hope, and they begin to question the circumstances of Hope's death. Todd tries to manipulate Téa into helping him gain custody of his children, but she refuses to cooperate. Nora and Bo investigate a serial killer case and discover a knife that may be the murder weapon, but the fingerprint on the knife belongs to John McBain, Blair's new husband. Natalie and Jared are revealed to be keeping a secret about Jessica's baby, and they promise to take the secret to their graves. Cole and Starr decide to investigate the truth about Hope's death, and Cole vows to find out what happened to their daughter. Langston discovers that Markko helped Cole fake a drug test, and she warns him about the consequences of helping an addict. The episode ends with Nora and Bo discovering John's fingerprint on the knife, which raises questions about his involvement in the serial killer case. </summary>

<summary> Dani visits Todd in the hospital, where he claims he didn't push Marty down the stairs, despite an eyewitness account. Meanwhile, Langston confesses to Markko that she's been cheating on him with Ford, causing Markko to become upset and defensive. Rex receives a call from someone who recognizes the necklace he's been searching for, leading him to Santa Fe. Jessica prepares for prom with Brody, while Natalie and Brody discuss their plans to attend the event. Téa reveals to Blair that she's defending Todd because she wants Dani to have a relationship with her father in case something happens to her, and Blair discovers that Téa is terminally ill. Kelly is encouraged by Dorian to pursue a relationship with Reed Wagner, who has been showing interest in her.</summary>

<summary>Natalie and Paul share a moment, but she receives a call from John, who is moving on from his past and wants to see her. Meanwhile, Viki suffers a coronary and is rushed to the hospital, where her family gathers around her. Marcie decides to take matters into her own hands and sneaks into Dr. Long's office to gather evidence, while Michael tries to stop her. Dr. Long is questioned by John, but is released due to lack of evidence. Daniel stands up Nora, but apologizes and asks for a second chance. Lindsay visits Jen, but is rebuffed, and David confronts Paul about his treatment of Kelly. Marcie is seen by Dr. Long, who reveals he has a stolen heart, and Michael arrives to confront him.</summary>

<summary>Blair and John investigate Todd's disappearance, suspecting Miles of involvement, while Viki and Clint search for a liver donor for Jessica, who has revealed her love for Nash and ended her marriage to Antonio. Antonio is furious with Cristian for keeping Jessica's secret, feeling betrayed by his brother. Meanwhile, Marty is attacked by three men but manages to defend herself, and Miles happens to drive by and offer assistance, raising John's suspicions. Viki and Clint discuss possible experimental treatments for Jessica's liver cancer, and Blair offers to be tested as a potential donor. Antonio is heartbroken and angry, feeling lied to by everyone, including Cristian, who he no longer considers his brother. Jessica and Nash are together, but she is struggling with guilt and the possibility of not surviving her illness. The investigation into Todd's disappearance continues, with John following Miles and Blair offering to help.</summary>

<summary>

Nora and Clint discuss Dorian's actions, with Nora saying she told Clint that getting involved with Dorian would be a huge mistake. Dorian arrives and reveals that she saw David and Viki kissing at Viki's house, which was staged to upset her. Clint tells Dorian that she needs to calm down and spend time apart from him. Meanwhile, Blair, Rex, and Cristian are searching for Todd, who was kidnapped by Hunter, Sarah's boyfriend. Sarah claims she didn't know what Hunter was planning and is trying to help them find Todd. A detective is called in to investigate, and Sarah is asked to provide information about Hunter's associates and car. Marty is being blackmailed by Miles, who is threatening to reveal her past unless she stays with him. John tries to help Marty, but she tells him to back off, saying she can handle the situation. Michael and Marcie discuss having another child, with Marcie wanting to wait a little longer.

</summary>

<summary>

Viki is searching for her daughter Natalie, who has been kidnapped by a serial killer known as "The Killing Club" maniac. Marcie, the author of a book that the killer is using as inspiration, is trying to help the police find Natalie. John is leading the investigation and is working with Marcie to understand the killer's motives. Meanwhile, Nora is dealing with the aftermath of her relationship with Daniel Colson, who may have put her at risk of contracting HIV. Antonio is trying to find Jessica, who has left a note saying she needs time and space. Todd is acting as a messenger for Jessica and is trying to keep her location a secret. Rex is feeling guilty for his role in Natalie's disappearance and is trying to make amends. Lindsay is trying to comfort Rex and reassure him that Natalie will be found safely. Bo is working to find Natalie and is dealing with the pressure of the investigation. Tess is causing trouble by stealing a car from a man who rejected her advances.

</summary>

<summary> The scenes depict various storylines, including Tess and Nash's growing connection, Marcie's desperate attempt to escape from Hayes, and Dorian's insistence that David invite his brother to their wedding. Meanwhile, John and the police are racing against time to find Natalie and Marcie, who are being held hostage by Hayes. The story also touches on other characters' struggles, such as Starr's feelings of isolation and Adriana's concern for Rex's safety. </summary>

<summary>

Kevin and Asa discuss Willy Dawes, who they believe is behind the chandelier falling and is trying to break up Kevin's marriage. David Vickers returns to Llanview and claims to be in love with Dorian, but Kelly is skeptical. Todd sets up a romantic evening for Blair at Crossroads, playing the piano and singing to her. Antonio's custody case is reheard, with Evangeline and R.J. trying to prove that Antonio is unfit to be a father. Marcie visits Al in the hospital and tries to lift his spirits, while Jen takes care of Marcie and tries to help her recover from her own illness. Bo testifies on Antonio's behalf, stating that he is a good father and loves his daughter. The judge grants joint custody to Antonio and Keri, despite R.J.'s objections. Al's condition worsens, and the doctor tells Max that he will need a liver transplant to survive. Marcie broadcasts a message on the radio, asking Al's fans to send him their thoughts and prayers. Todd and Blair share a romantic dance, and David tries to woo Kelly away from Kevin.

</summary>

<summary>

Rex is stuck in the women's steam room with Kelly, where they discuss his relationship problems with Gigi. Gigi is upset with Rex for telling his ex-wife that they are not sleeping together. Meanwhile, Cole is preparing to go to jail and says goodbye to Starr and their daughter Hope. John is upset with Natalie for not telling him about her amniocentesis test, but they eventually make up. Layla has to choose between her career in Paris and her relationship with Cristian. Eddie, the father of Ford and James, shows up unexpectedly and causes tension. Inez, Eddie's ex-wife, tries to protect her sons from him. Markko says goodbye to Langston and Starr before returning to UCLA. Cole is taken away to jail, leaving Starr heartbroken. Rex asks Kelly to be his escort to Todd and Téa's party.

</summary>

<summary>Whitney is considering a career in singing, despite her mother's disapproval, and is working on a demo with Chad. Meanwhile, Theresa is trying to protect her son Little Ethan from Rebecca's abuse, and has called child protective services to intervene. However, Rebecca is planning to evict the Lopez-Fitzgerald family from their home, which is owned by Crane Industries. Ethan is torn between his loyalty to the Cranes and his love for Theresa, and is forced to deliver the eviction notice to the Lopez-Fitzgeralds. Whitney has been offered a job as a singer at the Blue Note club, which she accepts despite her mother's likely disapproval. Miguel is struggling to find a new job after being fired from the cannery, but Kay is being supportive and helping him to care for their daughter Maria. Tabitha is encouraging Kay to pursue a relationship with Miguel, and it seems that Miguel is starting to develop feelings for Kay. The Lopez-Fitzgeralds are facing financial difficulties and are worried about losing their home, while Rebecca is reveling in her plan to take revenge on Theresa.</summary>

<summary> Sheridan Crane is hospitalized after being trapped in a fire at her home, which is suspected to be arson, and her loved ones gather around her, including her husband Antonio and brother Luis. Meanwhile, Theresa Crane's charitable donations have made her a target for her husband Julian and his mistress Rebecca, who are plotting against her, and Liz is scheming to destroy Eve's marriage and steal her husband T.C. </summary>

<summary>
T.C. and Liz visit Tabitha's house, where they confront Eve and Whitney about Whitney giving up her baby for adoption. T.C. is furious and blames Eve for Whitney's decision, while Eve claims she tried to convince Whitney not to give up the baby. Meanwhile, Sheridan tries to convince Luis to do a D.N.A. test on Marty to prove that he is her son, but Beth refuses, claiming Marty is her son with Luis. Gwen and Theresa get into a heated argument over Jane, with Gwen threatening to kill Theresa. Ethan and Fox try to escape from the guards on the island, while Theresa tries to take Jane back from Gwen. T.C. and Liz, as well as Julian and Eve, both express interest in adopting Whitney's baby. Luis decides to do the D.N.A. test on Marty despite Beth's objections. Gwen's anger towards Theresa continues to escalate, with Katherine trying to intervene and calm her down.</summary>

<summary>Whitney's mother, Eve, has changed her mind about Whitney moving to LA with Chad, causing tension between Eve and her husband, TC. Meanwhile, Sheridan is revealed to be trapped in Beth's basement, and Beth is gloating about her plan to keep Sheridan captive. Kay's water breaks, and she is rushed to the hospital, where she gives birth to her baby. Tabitha is shown to be carrying a demon child, and Charity discovers the truth. Julian confesses to accidentally setting fire to Liz's club, but TC is skeptical. Luis is determined to find Sheridan, despite everyone believing she is in Paris, and he restarts the search efforts.</summary>

<summary>
Spike is confronted by Jessica's family and friends, who want him to leave her alone, but Jessica ultimately decides to stay with him. Meanwhile, Fancy and Luis are dealing with the aftermath of their undercover operation, which was misinterpreted by Sheridan and Chris. Gwen and Ethan are trying to have a romantic evening, but are interrupted by Theresa and Jared, who are also in the hotel. Gwen is hiding a secret, and Theresa is suspicious of her. Kay and Miguel find themselves transported to a mysterious location, where Miguel tries to convince Kay to be with him. Luis and Sheridan share a moment, but are interrupted by Chris. The scene ends with Theresa discovering Rebecca and J.T. on the ledge outside Gwen and Ethan's hotel room.</summary>

<summary>
Kay and Miguel are planning to get married and raise Maria together, but they need to tell Fox, who is currently engaged to Kay. Fox, however, has just received news that he is dying and wants to keep it a secret from Kay to make their remaining time together happy. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa are competing to win Ethan's heart by bribing J.T. with money to either keep quiet about Gwen's past mistakes or reveal the truth. Theresa ultimately wins J.T.'s favor and plans to expose Gwen's secrets to Ethan. Luis and Sheridan are searching for Fancy, who has been trapped in a cave, and Luis accuses Chris of being involved in her disappearance. Rebecca is pretending to be Gwen to take care of Ethan, but her true intentions are revealed when Ethan wakes up and finds her in bed with him. Theresa and J.T. plan to go to the B&B to show Ethan the proof of Gwen's past mistakes. Luis dives into a shaft to rescue Fancy, putting his own life at risk.</summary>

<summary> Karen and Colleen discuss a patient's medication, while Kevin confides in Karen about his struggles with addiction. Meanwhile, Ian's vampiric hunger grows stronger, and he seeks help from Chris to manage his condition. Alison is held captive by Joshua, who reveals his past connection to her family and his motivations for his actions. Lucy, who has lost her slayer powers, is persuaded by Elizabeth to help find Alison using her intuition and mystical abilities. Jamal, a newly turned vampire, is confronted by Rafe, who is searching for Alison. Joshua's obsession with Alison is rooted in his past experiences and his desire for power and love.</summary>

<summary>Sharon tries to convince Victor to help her prove Adam's innocence, but Victor refuses, believing Adam is a lost cause. Meanwhile, Leslie tries to convince the D.A. to drop the charges against Adam, but the D.A. is determined to prosecute. Daniel is found injured and hypothermic after searching for Daisy, who has escaped from custody. Phyllis is frantic with worry about Daniel's condition and vows to find Daisy before the police do. The police discover a tire tread matching Jana's car at the scene where Daniel was found, leading them to believe Daisy was involved. Cane tries to defend Blake's work on a report, but Sofia and Neil are not impressed and decide to fire Blake. Colin tries to get close to Lily and her children, but she is hesitant to let him in. The police discover that Daisy has crossed the border into Canada, where she is being searched for by the Mounties.</summary>

<summary>

Victor Newman is frustrated with his daughters Victoria and Abby, who are suing him, and expresses his anger to his lawyer Michael. Meanwhile, Victoria and Abby discuss their case with their lawyer Vance, who reveals that Victor may be planning to sell off a major subsidiary in Dubai, which could devalue their trusts. Ronan, a detective, discusses a case with Spencer, the district attorney, involving a wire recording of a shooting. Heather, a former detective, tries to help Spencer with the case but is rebuffed. Sharon, who has been trying to prove that Skye Lockhart is alive, receives a call from Jack, who has found the shack where Skye was living in Hawaii. Jack tries to convince a local detective to investigate further, but the detective is uncooperative. Nina, Ronan's mother, tries to convince him to accept her offer to donate part of her liver to him, as he is in need of a transplant. Heather and Paul, a private investigator, listen to the wire recording and discover that the gunshot heard on the recording may have been a blank. The judge in Victor's case orders that one-third of Newman Enterprises' assets be frozen in escrow, which Victor sees as a major blow to his business. Sharon meets with the district attorney, who is skeptical of her claims that Skye is alive, and Adam, who is in jail, expresses his frustration with the lack of progress in the case.

</summary>

<summary>Lily and Tyler get stuck in an elevator, and Lily helps Tyler through his claustrophobia by telling jokes and making up stories. Meanwhile, Fenmore is accused of pushing Jamie off a rooftop, but he denies the allegations, and his parents, Michael and Lauren, are torn between believing their son and the possibility that he might be guilty. Chelsea meets with Cane to discuss her fashion designs, and Cane offers to help her get a meeting with Neil and Jack. Summer feels guilty about her role in bullying Jamie and wishes she could take it back, while Fenmore and Jamie's argument escalates, with Jamie threatening to press charges against Fenmore.</summary>

<summary>

Nick Newman has arranged for Newman Enterprises to buy Jabot's debt, planning to foreclose and take over the company, which would put Victor Newman in a difficult position. Jack Abbott calls an emergency meeting with the shareholders to discuss the situation and proposes that Chancellor Industries buy a 51% stake in Jabot to prevent Victor from taking over. Victor finds out about Nick's plan and is furious, feeling betrayed by his son. Victor meets with the bankers who hold Jabot's debt and offers to buy the debt himself, which they agree to, backing out of the deal with Nick. Devon Hamilton is feeling unappreciated and like he doesn't belong with the Winters family, especially after his birthday was forgotten. Malcolm Winters is waiting for the results of a paternity test that could reveal he is Lily's father, and Phyllis is trying to get involved and cause trouble. Jack puts his proposal to a vote, and the majority shareholders agree to sell a 51% stake in Jabot to Chancellor Industries. Nikki Newman tries to call Victor to find out what's going on, but he doesn't take her call. The episode ends with several cliffhangers, including the arrival of the paternity test results and Nikki's determination to get to the bottom of things.

</summary>

<summary> The Abbott family is dealing with the aftermath of Jack's departure from the mansion, with Gloria and Jeff celebrating their newfound ownership and Jack and Sharon looking to start fresh. Meanwhile, Jill and Kay are working with Alistair to uncover the secrets behind Gloria's marriage to Jeff, and Victoria is struggling to work with her new brother Adam at Newman Enterprises. Victor, meanwhile, is in Los Angeles meeting with Sabrina and exploring the city's art scene, while Gloria is feeling lonely and isolated in the mansion. </summary>

<summary>
Detective Chance informs the Newman family that the body found in the Athletic Club's basement is Adam's, and they have a search warrant for the Newman ranch. Phyllis discovers a bloodstained jacket that Nick wore the night of the ball and enlists Sharon's help to get rid of it. Jack is questioned by District Attorney Owen Pomerantz about a monogrammed handkerchief found in Adam's throat, which Jack claims he lost at the ball. Abby runs into Ryder, who is revealed to be working with Daisy and possibly Sheila, and they have a secret meeting. Lauren tries to reason with Ryder, who is holding her and Jana captive, and urges him to turn against Sheila. Owen questions Victor about a broken watch with Adam's blood on it, which Victor claims he broke during a confrontation with Adam. Chance searches the Newman house and finds a piece of evidence in the trash, while Phyllis tries to cover up the bloodstained jacket. The police investigation into Adam's murder continues, with several characters emerging as suspects.</summary>

<summary>Genevieve is preparing to marry Jack in Las Vegas, but Nikki tries to stop him, warning that he's making a mistake by prioritizing business over love. Meanwhile, Chelsea is dealing with the aftermath of her scheme to seduce Billy, and Adam is trying to make amends for his past mistakes. Victor's manipulations are also revealed, including his role in setting up Billy and his attempts to pay off Chelsea to leave town.</summary>

<summary>Lauren and Michael plan to go to Canada to bring back their son Fen, while Phyllis is struggling to cope with the loss of her granddaughter Lucy to Daisy. Meanwhile, Victor is dealing with the aftermath of purchasing Beauty of Nature from Genevieve, who is trying to convince Tucker to lie to the S.E.C. about the source of her funds. Devon is celebrating his newfound success with his loved ones, but Neil's phone call interrupts the party. Harmony and Neil have a tense conversation about their differences, and Katherine senses that there is more to their issue than they are letting on. Lauren's encounter with Daisy ends with her being arrested for pulling a gun on her, and Michael rushes to her side.</summary>

<summary>Phyllis and Nick celebrate their one-year anniversary with a treasure hunt, and Phyllis eventually finds the final gift, a GPS device with a heartfelt message from Nick. Meanwhile, Victor approves Adam's proposal to acquire Green Clean, despite Victoria's objections. Lily returns to work after her miscarriage, but her family and friends are concerned about her emotional well-being. Gloria discovers that her husband Jeffrey is staying with Jill and confronts him, leading to a heated exchange. Jack and Sharon discuss their feelings about Phyllis and Nick's anniversary, and Jack reassures Sharon that he's happy with their life together. Amber visits Kay and opens up about her fears of commitment and heartbreak. Kay shares her own experiences with love and loss, encouraging Amber to take a chance on love. Daniel and Amber discuss Lily's miscarriage and decide not to bring it up with her, giving her space to grieve.</summary>

<summary>Phyllis shares the news of her pregnancy and engagement to Nick with her sister Avery and later with Daniel, who also reveals that he is getting married to Daisy. Meanwhile, Lauren's case takes a turn as Avery negotiates a plea deal with the prosecutor, and Jill gets into a physical altercation with Genevieve. Ricky tries to manipulate his father Paul into helping him, but Paul is skeptical of Ricky's intentions and seeks Avery's opinion on his son's character. Billy struggles to take care of his daughter Delia, who gets into a mess, and Genevieve receives a call from Colin, who has been released from prison.</summary>

<summary>Lauren and Michael reconnect after a period of separation, with Michael giving Lauren a gift and planning a special evening for her. Meanwhile, Daniel is struggling with the consequences of his actions, including the possibility of jail time, and considers leaving Genoa City, while Lily tries to support him and help him clear his name. Cassie, who was injured in the car accident, begins to recover and remember fragments of the incident, including the fact that she was driving the car.</summary>

<summary> 
Nick Newman is struggling with the anniversary of his daughter Cassie's death and is worried about his other daughter Summer, who is growing up and making her own decisions. Summer had a party at Phyllis' penthouse with her friends, including Fenmore, and things got out of hand, leading to a confrontation with Kyle. Michael and Lauren Baldwin are dealing with their own marital issues, as Michael is still hurt by Lauren's past infidelity with Carmine. Carmine is now involved with Abby, but is still causing trouble for Michael and Lauren. Sharon Newman is struggling with her feelings for Adam and her own mental health, and is seeking help from her doctor. Jack Abbott is trying to navigate his relationship with Phyllis, who has moved out due to his sister Traci's interference. Kyle is developing feelings for Summer, but Nick is opposed to their relationship. Phyllis is trying to help Nick see that Summer is an adult and needs to make her own decisions, but Nick is still trying to protect her.
</summary>

<summary>Kevin tries to convince Chloe to seek help at Fairview, while Michael is torn between his duty as an officer of the court and his loyalty to his brother, who wants to help Chloe. Meanwhile, Ian Ward's release from charges sparks tension among the Newman family, with Victor and Dylan seeking revenge, and Nikki trying to move on from the past.</summary>

<summary>
Nick is struggling to cope with the loss of his daughter Cassie and the damage it has caused to his relationships with his family. He is haunted by memories of Cassie and feels guilty for letting her go out the night she died. Nick's marriage to Sharon is strained, and he is drawn to Phyllis, Daniel's mother. Cassie appears to Nick in visions, and they have conversations about what could have been if she were still alive. Nick realizes that he has been living in a state of denial and anger, and that he needs to take responsibility for his actions. Cassie encourages Nick to move forward and to try to repair his relationships with his family. Nick decides to move back home with Sharon and their son Noah, hoping to rebuild their family. Cassie's visions help Nick to see that he doesn't have the power to control everything, and that he needs to focus on what he wants and go for it. In the end, Nick is determined to try to heal and move forward, with Cassie's memory always with him.</summary>

<summary> The Newman Enterprises IPO is underway, with the stock price expected to soar, but Adam and Diane have a plan to sabotage Victor's success. Meanwhile, a court hearing is taking place to determine whether Daisy Carter's parental rights should be reinstated, with Phyllis supporting her in exchange for Daisy's help in gaining custody of Lucy. Victor's day takes a dramatic turn when Diane arrives at his office, claiming to be pregnant with his child, and later suffers a medical emergency. As the day unfolds, Victor's condition worsens, and news of his apparent stroke sends shockwaves through the community, with Michael trying to reach him and Jack taking advantage of the situation to make a move on the stock market. </summary>

<summary>Devon tries to make amends with Elena after paying off her student loans without her consent, while Adam's return to Genoa City causes chaos as he sues Nick for custody of Christian and makes a deal with Kevin to trade Phyllis for Chloe. Meanwhile, Victoria tries to mediate between Adam and Nick, but her efforts are unsuccessful, and Kevin's attempts to rescue Chloe from Adam's clutches lead to a series of complications. As tensions rise, alliances are formed and broken, and the characters must navigate their complex relationships and motivations to achieve their goals.</summary>

<summary>Kevin Fisher reveals to his family that he is moving to Portland with his daughter Bella, seeking a fresh start after the death of his wife Chloe. Meanwhile, Nikki Newman returns home after a brief absence, claiming she was at a wellness center in Colorado, but her son Nick is skeptical and concerned about her health. Victor Newman is preparing for a charity concert featuring Nikki, which he hopes will bring the Newman family together again. Tensions run high as Nick clashes with Victor over the concert and Nikki's well-being, while Abby and Scott work together to ensure the event's success.</summary>

<summary>Sharon is struggling with Nicholas' absence and lack of communication, while Jack is trying to help her with her schedule for the promo tour. Meanwhile, Colleen is dealing with her own issues, including mysterious notes and phone calls that seem to be related to her father, Brad. JT is investigating Brad's past in Cleveland, and he discovers a connection between Brad and a tragic event from the past. Daniel and Kevin are trying to come up with a plan to deal with Alex, who is blackmailing them over a secret. Nick returns to Genoa City and reveals that the baby is his, but he decides to stay with Sharon and be a father to Noah. JT's investigation leads him to a surprising discovery about Brad's true identity.</summary>

<summary>

Victoria is considering job offers from Jabot, Beauty of Nature, and Newman Enterprises, while also thinking about staying home to raise her son Johnny. Billy fires Phyllis from "Restless Style" due to her arrest and plans to feature her on the cover of the magazine, which angers Nick. Adam and Chelsea return from their elopement in Kansas and Adam shows Chelsea their new home. Jack and Nikki are planning their wedding reception and discussing the menu with Gloria. Ashley confronts Jack about his plans to merge Jabot and Beauty of Nature, which she opposes. Victor tries to convince Victoria to return to Newman Enterprises, warning her that Jack wants to take what's his. Phyllis is upset about being fired and plans to write a blog to defend herself, but Avery advises against it. Anita returns to town and claims that she and Jeff are still married, causing tension with Gloria. Adam and Chelsea settle into their new life together, excited for their future.

</summary>

<summary>
Hilary and Devon are getting married in the hospital due to her poor health after an accident. Devon has planned a special ceremony, and their friends and family are gathering to support them. Hilary's friends give her gifts, including a heart-shaped rock, a joke book, and earrings, as part of the wedding tradition. However, Hilary suddenly passes out, causing concern among her loved ones. The doctor explains that she is weakening and needs pain medication to stay comfortable. Despite this, Hilary and Devon exchange their vows and rings, with Devon reading a heartfelt passage about his love for her. Hilary also expresses her love and gratitude for Devon, and they are pronounced husband and wife. The ceremony is a emotional and intimate moment for the couple and their loved ones.</summary>

<summary>John Abbott is taken to the hospital after experiencing vision problems and a headache, and is later diagnosed with a minor stroke. His family, including his wife Gloria and children Jack and Ashley, gather at the hospital and are relieved to hear that the stroke was not severe. However, they are frustrated by the lack of information from the hospital staff and the prison authorities. Meanwhile, Lily Winters is dealing with her own problems, including her troubled marriage to Daniel Romalotti and her complicated relationship with her parents, Neil and Dru. Daniel is struggling to come to terms with his mistakes and the loss of Lily's trust, while Kevin Fisher tries to offer him advice and support. As the episode ends, John's condition takes a turn for the worse, and a code blue is called in his hospital room. The family is left in a state of panic and uncertainty. The episode also touches on the theme of honesty and trust, as several characters grapple with the consequences of their own dishonesty and the importance of being truthful with those they care about.</summary>

<summary> 
Jack Abbott is interviewed on television and makes a comment about Victor Newman having a "black hole for a heart," which upsets Sharon and Nick. Meanwhile, Adam Newman fires Neil Winters and hires Brad Carlton as the new CEO of Newman Enterprises. Victoria returns from Dubai and is furious to learn that Adam has fired her and appointed Brad as CEO. Paul Williams searches for Nikki in Mexico, who is trying to find out what happened to Victor. Jill Abbott is angry about an article in "Restless Style" that claims she knew about David Chow's gambling problem and did nothing. Jack and Nick get into an argument, and Jack reveals that he hacked into Nick's server to get information about Victor. Victoria tries to call her mother but gets voicemail, and Nikki is shown to be in Mexico, trying to find out what happened to Victor. Adam asks Heather to move in with him at the ranch, and Victoria is not happy about it.
</summary>

<summary>

The scene opens with Murphy gathering Katherine's loved ones to deliver her instructions from beyond the grave. Katherine's letter asks everyone to write down their thoughts, hopes, and dreams, and then burn the letters, allowing the smoke to deliver their words to her. The group participates in the ritual, with some being more open than others about their feelings. Meanwhile, Victoria and Billy sneak out of the hospital so she can attend Johnny's preschool orientation. After the ceremony, the group gathers to party and dance, with Neil struggling to come to terms with his temporary blindness. Nikki appears shaken and is advised by Stitch to take care of herself, but she brushes him off. Victor receives a call from Dr. Cutler, who is working to bring Phyllis out of her coma. Jill finally figures out the meaning behind Katherine's music box and realizes that the journey, not the destination, was the true treasure. The episode ends with Jill returning the music box to Katherine, thanking her for bringing her and Colin together.

</summary>

<summary>The scene revolves around various characters and their relationships, including Billy and Amber's growing connection, Daniel's art show, and Colleen's feelings for Daniel, while also exploring other storylines such as Jill's S.E.C. investigation, River's arrest, and Cane's pregnancy with Chloe. The characters navigate their personal and professional lives, dealing with issues of trust, loyalty, and identity.</summary>

<summary>Jack Abbott resigns from the Abbott-Winters Foundation, citing a loss of faith in the cause, and announces that the foundation will be renamed the Winters Foundation. The decision is met with shock and disappointment from the other board members, particularly Neil Winters, who tries to persuade Jack to reconsider. Meanwhile, Phyllis Abbott tries to make amends with Jack for her infidelity, but he is unforgiving and tells her to leave their home. Victoria Newman tries to work through her feelings about her ex-husband Billy's new relationship with Phyllis, and ultimately decides to focus on her relationship with Travis Crawford. The episode ends with Phyllis being injured at the Abbott estate, and Jack calling out for her as she lies unconscious.</summary>

<summary>
Damon Porter is in critical condition after an accident, and his son Elias appears to him, trying to convince him to live. Meanwhile, Michael Baldwin is dealing with his brother Kevin's anger over his relationship with Lauren, and Kevin challenges Michael to a fight. Lily Winters is struggling to overcome her past traumas, including her experiences with Kevin and Alex, and Kevin tries to reassure her that she is not to blame. Ashley Abbott is reeling from her rejection by Victor Newman and her impending divorce from Brad Carlton, and Brad tells her that he will be there for their daughter Abby. Nikki Newman is upset by Victor's continued involvement with Ashley and feels that Ashley needs to face the consequences of her actions. Jack Abbott discusses the possibility of hiring Sharon Newman as a spokesperson for Jabot, but the company's financial situation makes it unlikely. Damon's condition takes a turn for the better after Elias' visit, and he is rushed to the operating room for further treatment.</summary>

<summary>

Chance Chancellor is honored with a medal of valor for his bravery, and his family and friends gather to celebrate. Meanwhile, Daniel Romalotti is dealing with the possibility of going back to jail, and his mother Phyllis is trying to come up with a plan to save him. Amber, Daniel's wife, suggests that they leave the country, but Michael, their lawyer, advises against it. Ryder Callahan is preparing to testify in front of the grand jury, but Kevin is worried that he might not tell the truth. Billy Abbott is struggling with his breakup with Mac, and Chloe, the mother of his child, is trying to move on with her life. Chance and Chloe's relationship is blossoming, but Jill and Nina are skeptical of her intentions. Phyllis and Amber are at odds over how to handle Daniel's situation, but they eventually come to an understanding. Heather Stevens, the district attorney, is determined to convict Daniel, and Michael is trying to find a way to stop her. Ryder is getting pressure from all sides to reveal the truth, and Daniel is getting anxious about his fate. In the end, Chance and Chloe share a romantic moment, while Billy is left to deal with the aftermath of his breakup.

</summary>

<summary> The scene opens with Billy and Victoria discussing a potential pregnancy, while Phyllis is dealing with her own family drama, including her daughter Daisy's pregnancy and her complicated relationship with Daniel. Meanwhile, Chloe and Kevin are preparing for Christmas with their daughter Delia, but their festive plans are disrupted by a visit from Child Protective Services. Cane and Lily are also getting into the holiday spirit, but Cane's work life is complicated by a background check on his colleague Blake, who is hiding secrets about his past. </summary>

<summary> The residents of Genoa City celebrate Christmas Eve with various gatherings and parties, including Devon and Hilary's holiday party at their new penthouse, where Devon announces that Hilary will be returning to the GC Buzz as host and executive producer. Meanwhile, Billy spends Christmas Eve with his sisters Traci and Ashley, but is met with hostility by their brother Jack, and Phyllis considers leaving Jabot to work for Lauren at Fenmore's. </summary>

<summary>Adam learns a shocking secret about his father's death from his grandmother Constance, who reveals that Victor Newman was responsible for his father's downfall and subsequent suicide. Meanwhile, Nick and Sharon try to reassure their daughter Faith that they both love her despite their breakup, and Victoria and Billy discuss their daughter Katie's name, with Victoria initially wanting to give her the Newman last name but eventually agreeing to add Abbott to it as well. The episode also touches on other storylines, including Ashley's work in the lab, Joe's redevelopment project, and Dylan's efforts to stop the demolition of the warehouse district.</summary>

<summary> 
Jill sold Chancellor Industries to Jack, but Billy informed her that the Jabot board had voted Jack out as CEO, making the deal questionable. Ashley is trying to kill the deal and has called a board meeting to adopt common-sense measures. Cane is unhappy about the sale and feels Jack doesn't want to work with him. Lily is struggling to come to terms with Cane's new baby and her feelings about Hilary's involvement in their lives. Reed's parents, J.T. and Victoria, are discussing their past and how it affects their son, who is going through a tough time after his father's latest marriage failure. Meanwhile, Nick is planning to renovate the bathroom and expand the closet, but Chelsea is hesitant about the changes. Mattie called the police on Reed for driving under the influence, which may damage their relationship. Victoria received a call from the police informing her that Reed has been arrested.
</summary>
